Reviews.Title: “St Regis”
Reviews.Author: Born_in_Manhattan
Reviews.Content: A very pretty hotel and grand features in the room. Bathroom was exceptional with a ceiling shower head and big tub. There was a TV in the bathroom mirror, which made us laugh at such indulgences. We traveled as a family of four with two children, 4 & 8 year old boys. The kids had a good time at the pool. The staff was welcoming, pleasant and courteous. The boys thoroughly enjoyed the nightly 6pm Koi feeding event in the lobby. Although we did not leave our kids for babysitting services, we did visit the Kid's club for a couple of Wii games, table hockey, ping pong and outdoor basketall court during the short tropical showers. The staff there also seemed also very responsible and accomodating. We booked an oceanfront room which was nice although a little farther from the main lobby. You can take a quicker shortcut by walking along the beach area to your room. The beach was fairly rocky with a lot of debris. It was pretty desolate, as most guests enjoyed the pools. If you walk further down the beach, you may be lucky enough to find a few sand dollars. Bicycles were available at the boat house with additional activites to go fishing (although the fish were too smart to bite), There is also duck, turtle, fish feeding at the convention center where they sell the private residences. Receptionist is very kind to provide a big bowl of fish food for the kids to throw at feed at the pleasure. All in all, the hotel is very nice and you will not be disappointed in the rooms. The one thing in general at Puerto Rico, seems a lack of selection with salads and vegetables. We craved these staples and tried to eat local often, although they don't seem to be local staples as a lot of things are fried. I would recommend renting a car to travel as the roads are easy to drive and parking is about 23 dollars a day at the hotel. It was convenient to get visit the supermarkets, go out for dinner at the Kiosks, (La Parilla was always recommended) and the food was tasty. Having a car also made it easier to visit El Yunque rain forest and visit at your pace, long trail but my four year old made it all the way to the falls. Wear swimsuits as you will want to take a dip. You should not be disappointed as I agree that the grounds are beautiful and the staff are friendly and accomodating. We also had a late flight and were able to spend the day at the resort with a late shower at the golf house.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth201
Reviews.Content: The property is beautiful! The restaurants have great service and delicious food! Even our room at the low end of the scale was very nicely appointed. The golf course is very nice and well maintained. We also made use of the non-motorized water sports which were fun but did not give you a very large space to explore (interior lagoon) but it was very safe for the kids. The downside is that having only 2 restaurants (plus an extra for lunch) is very limiting for a one week stay (not to mention the high prices) so we had to go in search of local restaurants. We rented a car and did not like that they did not offer self parking (though there was plenty of space) and charged $20-25/night for valet. Several times we called the valet before leaving the room and the car was not ready when we arrived. It would have been much more convenient and quick to go to our car directly from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with family”
Reviews.Author: cokaer
Reviews.Content: We stayed with wife and kids at St. Regis Bahia from 4/8-4/13. All in all it was a really good time. This was our second trip to Bahia; my wife and I liked it so much last fall that we returned wtih the kids for their spring break. As many travelers have noted, the grounds are absolutely beautiful. The beach was great. We did all the nearby adventures including hiking in the rainforest, surfing lessons for the whole family, kayaking at biobay, deep sea fishing, exploring Old San Juan and ziplining. And we still had plenty of time to lounge by the beach and pool. All were fun (though I wouldn't recommend the fishing boat suggested by the concierge). Prices for food and drink were generally about what you would expect to pay at a good restaurant--not cheap. But for anyone who travels much, they are in line with expectations. And notwithstanding a couple of reviews I've seen to the contrary, the food at all three restaurants on site was excellent. We particularly liked breakfast at the Fern restaurant (kids loved the French Toast) and dinners at Fern and Molasses were really great. And throughout the resort, the staff could not have been nicer and more accommodating. They vary in experience, but all seemed genuinely motivated to make our stay pleasant. We had a couple of minor annoyances, but they were resolved to our satisfaction by management. Hope we can return for a third trip to Bahia later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Inconviences take away a star”
Reviews.Author: margawil
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week-end at the hotel and although the overall experience was very good, we were disappointed by some inconviniences that we did not expect to find in a hotel of this category. We have stayed at St. Regis properties in other locations, so we know their standards and that is precisely what we hoped for during our stay in Bahia. Let me start with the inconviniences, so that I may leave the best for last! First of all, there was no hot water in part of our beautiful bathroom. The shower and faucets only had lukewarm water (room 922) and the only way you could get really hot water was in the bathtub. It was overcast and cool and I missed the hot water! It is very difficult to wash your hair in the bathtub( no manual shower), so that was not an option. Also, one of the bathrobes provided had a HUGE brown stain in the front.....Next we went to our beautiful and cozy bedroom terrace and while having a nice conversation, realized there were some "creatures" moving across the floor which turned out to be small roaches. Needless to say, we reported all these inconviniences to the front desk and they were very attentive and apologetic. By the time we got back to our room that evening the robe had been replaced, the little creatures gone but the hot water problem was not solved. The hotel management provided some unexpected and greatly appreciated complimentary benefits but I still wished they had given me HOT water. The second big disappointment was the dinning arrangements. We always make reservations well in advance because we do not like to wait for a long time when we go out to dinner. On our second evening, when we promptly arrived at the Molasses Rest, we were informed that there was a back up because they were the only rest available that night since Fern was hosting a private affair and the rainy, windy weather did not allow the outside tables at Molasses to be available. We were then informed we could wait for an hour or order "take out" Trying not to ruin an otherwise wonderful day we proceeded to wait and luckily were taken to our table before the estimated time.The staff tried very hard to take care of all the unhappy dinners and were very professional in their approach but a property like this should have in place a plan for rainy and windy weather which is not uncommon in our tropical island.(we are locals and we know the weather) The fact that the second rest was not available did not help the situation. Maybe they need to reconsider if they can handle groups without affecting the individual guests! Having said all that, the good news! The hotel grounds are BEAUTIFUL! The rooms are large, cozy and in good taste. The pool area is large and designed to provide various small areas to swim and lounge.We were celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary and on two ocassions the staff surprised us with some complimentary sparkling wine! Very thoughtful !The staff at all levels are extremely professional and will go out of their way to accomodate to your needs and request. Customer service is outstanding! The food at both restaurants is excellent. Following the bartender's advice we ordere the octopus appetizer at Ferns and it was incredible, a MUST try if you like spicy and savory dishes. If you want to get away from it all, relax and be pampered, this is a great choice. I just hope management takes note and solve the mentioned inconveniences so that the hotel can really shine as the beautiful and first class proerty that it is meant to be.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay; Do not pay attention to negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: stefhef
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 days at the end of March. The resort, as others have written, is BEAUTIFUL. Very lush, tropical. Relaxed setting. It is an oasis. You can stay here the whole time or venture out. We rented a car and ventured out several nights. First, the rooms are great - we had a Deluxe, which is a large bedroom, a nice size foyer with wet bar and SUBZERO undercounter refrigerator, small walk in closet and huge bathroom with a great shower that is about 8 x 8 feet. We played the golf course and it is one of the nicest ever - just beautiful and very challenging. You get a discount as a St. Regis guest but it is still pricey. But it's not crowded and you feel like you have it to yourself. Note that the driving range is included with your daily resort charge. The gym was very nice - we went every day. The pools are beautiful. The beach is very nice too - a beautiful horseshoe shape and very private. It is true that they water is more of a green color, not Caribbean blue, so if that will bother you then this is not the place for you. The service at the pool was excellent. But for even better food, take a break and go over and grab lunch at the bar in the lobby (or at tables just outside the lobby) and you can be fed by Jean Georges' Fern restaurant. Great bar food. The service here was terrific. For example, on our last day, they came and picked us up at in the golf cart and we sat in the lobby until it was time to leave (it was pouring rain). I asked the valet to watch our luggage for us as we would be leaving in an hour and also asked him to retrieive our golf club travel bags at the pro shop. He came in later to the lobby and told me that everything had been taken care of. When we went out side and they brought around our car, the valet had loaded our luggage into our car already AND had retrieved the golf bags at the pro shop (about a half a mile away) and loaded our clubs into the travel bags. We literally got in the car and left. Now that is how it should be. The staff is VERY accomodating. Our butler offered to go to the store and buy us whatever we needed (otherwise we didn't see much of him, but we weren't really looking for him). There is a store about 10 minutes away by car, Ralph's, where you can stock up on cheese, snacks, wine, etc. which you can keep in your Subzero refrigerator and have breakfast or an after pool treat/happy hour in your room or on your patio. I highly recommend this. We ate at Fern for dinner and breakfast. The food is excellent, but yes, the service is terribly slow. But then again, where are we going? The other restaurant, Molasses, is just ok and definitely a lot of money for what it is. The food at the pool is very good, especially the Thai salad, but it is pricey (well, like every other high end hotel). We ate at the Kiosks twice and really enjoyed them. La Parilla and Vegigantes. We liked the food at Vegigantes better (and it was cleaner) but the atmosphere is better at LaParilla. The kiosks look grungy but if you go to the more recommended ones, you will be fine. The St. Regis would not recommend any of them because "they don't meet the level of St. Regis service". Well, if you like to go local, definitely go there. We also ate in Old San Juan at Marmalade, which was great (and St. Regis "approved"). Now, if you want to nitpick, yes there are things that could be improved upon. Isn't that true everywhere? Once there were no water bottles in the gym but when I informed them, they quickly supplied them, including at everyone's machine. Yes, the chairs at the beach are not the best, but they are fine (the ones at the pool are more luxurious). Yes, the service at Fern is slow, but where are you going anyway? Yes, the housekeepers seem to come at all different hours but they eventually do the job (although I am not sure how often they vacuum, but the beds are made and the bathroom is spotlessly clean). Sometimes I had to call for turn down service but they always come willingly and asked me if there was anything else they could do for me. So, like any vacation, it is what you make of it. You can go here and have a wonderful time. But do note the green water, the distance to Old San Juan (about 45 minutes, you need a car as the taxis are very expensive), and the lack of much outside of the hotel resort. We went to another golf course one day (the Rio Mar), and it was pretty bad. Is the St. Regis worthy of Category 7? That is probably a bit much but it is a 6. Also, note that there are lots of couples here, as well as lots of young families but I have to say that the children were VERY well behaved. In any event, we are rather particular travellers (5 stars or better) and this property is a fine place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “It costs to be treated like a boss!”
Reviews.Author: FoolinLove2012
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed at St. Regis for one night as part of my 8 day honeymoon to Puerto Rico and Vieques. I choose St. Regis for our grand finale and go all out and spare no expense! The W was another option but after researching it is overpriced and poor quality (also I went there for a day see that review.) Prior to arrival I made my reservations using my Starwood points and worked extensively with the concierge to make special requests. The service and care I received from Jossell and Luisa were impeccable. They arranged for my husband and me to be picked up in a Panamera Porsche with 2003 vintage Moet & Chandon on ice in it, per my request. The driver was extremely nice and told us "St. Regis will get your luggage and you donâ€™t have to worry about anything, just walk in and they will take care of the rest." We were welcomed and addressed by my new married name as soon as we stepped out of the car. We were given their signature drink and had a quick personal check in were you sit at an office table. Very private and felt like celebrities! We were introduced to our butler Luis and he was by far the most hospitable, humble, respectful, and sincere person I have met in the service industry (I have worked in the service industry and travel a lot so I know good talent.) Luis deserves a raise! We rented a poolside cabana and he asked if we wanted to go there or our room first. He whisked us away in a golf cart to our room. When we arrived our bags were already inside, with our champagne on ice with fresh glasses, rose petals from the door to the bed, complimentary chocolate covered strawberries, an a hand written thank you and welcome card from the general manager Anthony. Anthony gave us his personal congrats on our wedding. Luis gave us a tour of our room and it was spotless! It had a bar, living room, patio, two bathrooms, whirlpool tub, tv in the mirror, master bedroom leading to another patio area ....I mean it was luxury!! Luis escorted us to our cabana were we had a waitress waiting and brought us our favorite drinks as soon as we arrived without ordering them (this was part of my special requests.) We ate sushi from Seagrapes which was average and took a dip in the pool and hot tub. Luis confirmed our dinner reservations and spa reservations at Remede. We walked around the grounds and it looks like a tropical rainforest. The beach is okay but the golf course makes up for it. We went to Remede spa for a massage. Remede spa is five stars! I also went to the W Away Spa in Vieques and it was mall quality. Remede used aroma therapy and had delicious treats afterwards to help reenergize, whirlpool, showers, and private dressing rooms. They had a separate area for men and women it was exquisite. Definitely go there! We had 9:30pm dinner reservations at Fern and Luis left us a note informing us he would be at our room at 9:15pm to pick us up. He also left a menu for us to choose our private dining am breakfast because we were leaving at 6:30am. Fern was nice but we felt rushed to order. The menu was limited and I was hoping for more. However, the meal was outstanding. We had the chicken. When we returned to our room we found Luis had run a bubble bath for us and cleaned the room! He was so nice he even turned down a tip (we tipped him every time we saw him.) He was like,"No this is my service to you." Amazing! Now, the downside. We had put in a special request for breakfast and they got the order wrong and they didn't have our cab on time. Besides that this place is the best resort in Puerto Rico! Jimmy Fallon, Dwayne Wade, and tons of other celebrities stay there. In Vieques we met a couple that golfed with Oscar de la Hoya who owns a house at St. Regis. There were no bedbugs so don't worry about that. Overall, I had a five star experience and if they didn't mess my breakfast up I would have given them five stars. However, I worked with the concierge and spent 3k for one night there so my experience might be skewed from others just on a normal stay. Even if we didn't receive "presidential" treatment the place is still lovely. Bring plenty of cash because you should tip a lot and often. Will post all of the pics. The St. Regis is the best! If you want to be treated like a boss you have to pay. St. Regis is not for people on a budget. Will definitely return and recommend to others. They put the icing on the cake to complete our honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious stay!”
Reviews.Author: aq1020
Reviews.Content: No words or pictures can describe how beautiful this resort is. Once you are here you will never want to leave. There are so many activities to choose from (cycling , nature tours, canoeing, fishing, sailing, tennis, golf etc). The property is huge I think about 500 acres all covered with exotic trees, gorgeous landscapes, lakes and bike trails. Not to mention the beautiful pools and private cabanas covered with white drapes. They also have their own nursery garden which is huge (sign up for the eco-tour)! Near the boat house you have a gorgeous view of the El Yunque rainforest. Everything is absolutely perfect. It feels like you are in a middle of a rainforest which obviously means mosquitoes! So make sure you bring insect repellent. We were here for 4 days and stayed in the luxurious Astor Suite which comes with butler service. The butler gave us the entire tour of our suite. The suites are very large ( living room , bedroom , very large terrace, and wet bar ) . There is a pull-out sofa bed in the living room , very impressive furniture (all wood), 2 bathrooms (marbled- there is even a hidden TV in your mirror which was pretty cool) and lots of storage space(walk in closets, dressers) . The butler service covers the usual , packing, unpacking, pressing and tea/coffee service..always available whenever needed. I also tried the Explorerâ€™s relief spa treatment which was great. The only thing I didnâ€™t like was occasionally I would find creepy little creatures crawling on the floor (I have a phobia of crawling insects so I would panic) but I donâ€™t think there is anything that can be done about that. There are so many trees around so itâ€™s almost impossible to get rid of every insect. Beds are also very comfortable but the singing of Puerto Rican Coqui can get really annoying. So if you are a light sleeper ..reconsider! Overall , this place is for nature lovers and if you are one you will definitely enjoy this place!

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller W
Reviews.Content: So, I am not sure where to start, but if you are reading this- do not stay here. I am embarrassed to say this was actually my second stay. While I could go on about the beauty of the design, the grounds, and the golf course. Here is a list of a few of the mishaps I encountered during my unfortunate second stay. 1. The rooms have a musty odor! Be prepared should you have asthma, there is definitely mold. 2. Housekeeping does not exist. Do not expect for them to even clean your room. We stayed here for five nights and our room was cleaned two times. It was very inconsistent as well, trash not taken out of trash can, mirror not wiped, amenities not replaced, and many other detailed items. Piles of dirty towels were stacked outside our room on the foyer for 8 hours one day, ohâ€¦PS. My room didnâ€™t get cleaned that day either. 3. The one highlight in my first stay was the spa (about 1 year ago), this visit I was totally not impressed, and it has lost its sophistication, charm, and cleanliness. The male manager was very loud and obnoxious- I felt terrible for the female employee he was talking to, it was very demeaning- get a new manager! Also- a very dirty area of the hotel. I actually paid the erroneous prices that they were charging and the massage was just ok...It was not advertised properly- I was told I would have paraffin and did not get this service! 4. Mold and bird poop stains ravage this place- don't plan on enjoying sitting on anything outside that has a cushion- it is GROSS! Walls are covered in dirt and mold, when it rains everything is slippery and I fell twice. 5. The food prices are ridiculous, and totally not worth what they are charging! I was horrified to find a hair in my salad at Molasses. Services was horrible and I mean horrible at Fern... and donâ€™t get me started on In Room Dining. Hours of waitingâ€¦ 6. Take you bug spray, and plan to get eaten alive. 7. Wear your shoes at all times! There is trash everywhere, no one cleans the grounds. 8. Don't expect service- all we found were employees texting and having private conversations (specifically in the front of the hotel the bell boys were upset about their pay and health benefits), now I have stayed all over the world with Four Seasons and Ritz-Carlton and let me tell you, I have never experienced these prices coupled with such poor service. Also, there is a lack of attention to detail- water spots on glasses, water spots on flatwear, stains on walls, wobbly tables, not getting correct order, food cold, listen I could go on for days! 9. The fitness machines were broken. 10. The cabanas by the pool were dirty, and cost $300/day!?! No chairs were available for seating; when I said something to the waitress, she told us to come back in two hours and that this is normal, so donâ€™t worry. WOW! 11. When we checked in there were STAINS on the sheets on my bed, ashes and bird poop on the balcony, and we had to wait 3 hours for our room to be ready. Seriously, don't stay here. St Regis- I will NEVER come back to visit one of your hotels, nor will I return to Puerto Rico! Whoever your hotel manager is should be ashamed that is what they are calling luxury. But then again, maybe that's the problem with this place... management!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: mglass78
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to take our two daughters to this beautiful resort after our amazing trip last year, we were not dissapointed. The hotel is as amazing as we remember. Our kids had a great time swimming, collecting shells and playing at the kids club. The hotel partnered with a service called Nanny on Call which we utilized for some babysitters, this made the trip that much better. The grounds are spectacular and the service was great. We can't wait to return next year!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: Jim K
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the new St. Regis Bahia Beach Resort. The property is stunning - lush foliage, contemporary design with highly amenitized rooms, a gorgeous pool area, challenging golf course, an accommodating tennis pro with night-lit courts and a smiling and friendly staff. The food was first rate, too. The only negative was the painfully long time it took for food to be prepared. The waitstaff was aware of the problem, which was apparently a consistent complaint. If you don't mind waiting an hour and a quarter for an egg, this is a first rate resort.

Reviews.Title: “St. Regis”
Reviews.Author: dinamel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our two kids and had a great time. The staff are so friendly. The beach does have some trash, but overall it's beautiful. The house keeping staff needs some work. We ran out of toilet paper and I had to call to get more. That was unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Audubon Certified Gold”
Reviews.Author: rcmimages
Reviews.Content: I have to start off by saying that I stayed at Bahia Beach Resort before the St. Regis Hotel had been completed and when there was only one restaurant functioning, "Molasses." Oscar De La Hoya's 15 million dollar home had not been completed yet; however, MLB player Carlos Beltran formerly of The New York Mets was living there in a beautiful house (see image) . The property had been visited by many celebrities including Jennifer Lopez, Marc Anthony and Bill Cosby. I stayed in a residential 3 bedroom/ 3 bathroom suite in the "Las Verandas" section of the 483 acre property. The suite is gorgeous and has everything including a laundry room. I stayed in September and the ocean was very calm and swimmable. I found Molasses Restaurant and Chef Luis Guzman to be very consistent and good. The grounds are the highlight of this resort. It was designated as the Caribbean's first and only "Certified Gold Audubon Signature Sanctuary" on October 23, 2008. My fiance and I had a lot of fun driving around the property filled with frogs, birds, lizards and iguanas in our battery powered golf cart. The atmosphere is very serene and not so much for partiers, but for newlyweds and couples seeking tranquility. Try kayaking through the mangroves and if you go to El Yunque National Forest, don't expect very much. I could not find any sign of fauna there; no birds, no lizards, no frogs, nothing. I was very disappointed. The views were great and there are some nice flowers scattered about. It would like to stay at the St. Regis Bahia Beach Resort again one day and see all of the additions and changes.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: Seehund
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week at Bahia Beach. Overall, we enjoyed it, but given comments regarding beach / ocean below and relative cost, would not return. Pros: - The staff are excellent. Everyone of them seemed to be very focussed on making guests feel welcome and happy. Nevertheless, dining service (particularly breakfast) was slow at peak hours. We found that getting a free cup of coffee in the lounge was an effective way to make the wait for a table and cup of coffee at breakfast manageable. - Rooms are very clean and attractive. We had two rooms on the third floor of Building 7--would definitely recommend third (top) floor for privacy and some elevation above the ground level humidity. They had comfortable and private balconies. - Food was good, though Molasses was out of two of the somewhat limited selection of red wines on their list. Fern, the fancier restaurant, was quite good, though filled with loud children even after 8 / 9 PM. (This is not the hotel's fault, of course, but was unfortunate). Query whether kids meal policy is a factor, though? If kids had to pay at Fern (rather the eat "free" as part of meal plan), my guess is that ferm would quickly become an adult restaurant. Cons: - The beach is an utter disappointment. The water is rough and there are no lifeguards, which means swimming in the ocean is basically out of the question--at least during March; perhaps it is calmer in other months. This really detracts from the value of the property: There is a "two mile" beach but its effectively unutilized because the water is unsafe. One consequence seems to be that the pool is overcrowded. Even if it weren't however, what is the point of going to a beach resort if one can only wade in the water up to their waist without fearing for their safety? - Because there are no beach activities (sailing, paddleboarding, etc.), watersports are conducted at what is effectively a murky pond safely inland from the ocean. - Housekeeping service was, all things considered, poor; little things really but they sour the mood at a hotel holding itself out as exceptional: (1) staff checked our minibar everyday and itemized the consumed items but only replaced them when I happened to intercept them and ask for replacements. (2) We used the two bottles of mouthwash in bathroom over first few days of our visit and they were never replaced. Then we used the two in our kids' room and they were never replaced. Same for soap and other toiletries. These items should be replaced every day at a hotel charging $1K+ per night. (3) One day the toilet paper in our bathroom ran out. Again, somewhat trivial but its never happened to me in even an economy hotel before. - Tennis courts / Molasses restaurant are far away from main building, though staff is pretty good about providing golf cart transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $”
Reviews.Author: E O
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the St. Regis Bahia Beach for a week with our two young boys. Although there are many wonderful aspects to this property, I would not return again -- at least not at these prices. I have to confess that the weather was pretty terrible while we were there (rained a lot), but I think I can still be objective. Pros: Beautiful 1-br suite facing the ocean; huge master bathroom with deep soaking tub and rainfall shower; (mostly) friendly service; Fern (main restaurant) was superb (especially the tasting menu); absolutely gorgeous, meticulously maintained grounds, beautiful pool, children's club (which we only used once); lots of families (so we felt comfortable being there with our 2 boys); very private beach (no other resorts nearby); the spa is incredible -- get there early and spend some time in the waiting area, which is breathtaking -- and the prices are not out of line. Cons: expensive (we were not using points); butler service is silly -- I never met the "butler"; hotel is pretty isolated so there aren't a lot of options for eating out; Molasses, the restaurant at the golf club, is only so-so; ocean is not the calm, aquamarine water you might be used to in the Caribbean -- it actually looked brown for much of our trip (tho this may have been due to the weather); pool got very crowded and we were unable to get seats one morning (towel people told us to come back in 2 hours! Fortunately it did not take that long) -- meanwhile the cabana chairs went unused b/c barely anyone was willing to shell out $300 for the cabanas; beach "beds" were $300/day -- ridiculous!!!; there was definitely a lot of "nickle and diming"-- for instance, I asked for some steamed broccoli to come with my son's room service order. The charge was $9! They sold diapers in the gift shop -- individually wrapped for $3 each -- don't plan to buy diapers there. Also, our first-floor suite seemed fine when we arrived, but by the end of the week it had a distinct musty odor -- I think they have a humidity problem. All of our clothes, the sheets on the bed, even our passports were limp by the end of the week. Overall, I was disappointed in the place. We've also recently been to Little Dix Bay in Virgin Gorda and Carlisle Bay in Antigua. I liked both places much better. The St. Regis is just, well, too... corporate. You just don't get a beachy, relaxed vibe there. I guess I just prefer a more casual vacation, so maybe the St. Regis was the wrong place. I really disliked the main building, which was frigidly cold. I like resorts where the reception is open-air. Also, the place lacked a community room/library. Most beach resorts I've been to have some kind of library where you can leave a book and take a book. It's not a big deal, but this sort of thing makes it feel more personal. The lobby/bar at the St. Regis was filled with coffee table books that seemed to have been selected by someone at corporate headquarters. So impersonal.

Reviews.Title: “The most memorable stay of your life.”
Reviews.Author: HREAM
Reviews.Content: Magical. Wonderful. Unbelievably beautiful ... this is the resort that all other resorts are jealous of. Without a doubt, the best resort/hotel we've ever stayed at. Our stay was almost entirely paid for by SPG points (had one night of cash+points) and thank goodness for that. It's expensive, absurdly so. But if you can stomach the cost, you'll be rewarded with an utterly amazing stay. Upon our arrival, we were upgraded for free to a "Luxury Suite," a nearly 1000 sq. ft. suite that made us feel like millionaires. Ocean view, gigantic living room & bedroom, two full bathrooms, massive porch that spanned both rooms and overlooked the ocean. Simply breathtaking. Everything felt brand new and 110% maintained. We had (delivered and complimentary) french press coffee each morning on our balcony while enjoying the sunrise and ocean breeze. The best part were the grounds themselves ... wooden pathways winding through a rain forest while you walk to/from your room. I've heard some people talk on other forums about it being too far to walk around and that's simply ridiculous - this is a vacation destination, why are you in such a hurry? We stayed in the building furthest from the main office and it took mayyybe 7 minutes to get from one place to the other. And that's walking super-slow so we could enjoy the beautiful scenery and listen to the coquÃ­ (tiny frogs). If you don't like walking a few minutes in the ultra-safe and calming rain forest, either (1) don't stay here, or (2) have the butlers drive you around in the golf carts. We were amazed at how secluded everything felt despite full occupancy ... they really succeed at making us feel like we were special and appreciated. Anyone who isn't absolutely stunned by this resort is a generally unhappy person, the spoiled child of a billionaire, or both. If those characteristics don't describe you, then find a way to get to the St Regis Bahia Beach Resort for the most memorable stay of your life.

Reviews.Title: “bahia blues”
Reviews.Author: john v
Reviews.Content: St Regis where have you gone wrong! From our exemplary service in Princville we had grand hopes for our return to St Regis puerto rico style! Upon arrival the setting was nice but once we hit the pool the troubles began. No seats except the ones by the cabanas and when we sat down we were rudely snapped at that it was not allowed, come back in two hours! From there the extremely overpriced and extremely slow service and extremely poor quality food on resort from fern to sea grapes to molasses. Nothing was good and i am not exaggerating. We had toilets plugged and overflow (45minutes to have plunged out and 1.5hrs for housekeeping to clean), diary served to my dairy allergic daughter daily (despite our account being marked non dairy .... and her allergy isn't lactose intolerance), 1hr 40 minutes for luke warm room service that was more expensive than eating at a five star restaurant in new york, we were told we couldnt have more towels at the pool after rain soaked the ones we had and when he begrudgingly gave us two towels for four people we were told not to get them wet?, we had our robes removed from the room, my camera taken in the bed sheets (returned) no shower supplies restocked, no toilet paper restocked, never enough towels, and we were told our coffee could not be delivered as the butlers had all the french presses (despite having a standing daily order for same). As i right this we have called twice for room cleaning and after 2 !/2 hours they showed up. EVERYTHING HERE COMES WITH HORRIBLE SERVICE. As you can imagine after all this i finally complained and what did they do.... they sent milk and cookies to my dairy allergic daughter! Not such a big deal unless you have a non dairy allergic son eagerly gulping them down in front of her. If they didnt have so much of my money ( as i prepayed for 90% of the trip) i would have checked out and gone elsewhere. Instead we choose to leave this hotel every chance we could. The resort executive emailed me after i emailed the St regis. He wants to personally apologize for our trouble. I responded no thank you as all ive heard from the staff here is we are so sorry for your trouble. I and my family travel a lot, just never again to the St. Regis bahia beech or any st regis for that matter! The only saving grace for this horrible trip was breaking away for a mini vacation within a vacation to Culebra where the rooms are modest and the service is superb! The positive.... the beds are comfortable and the rooms are nice.

Reviews.Title: “There are pros and cons.”
Reviews.Author: sunfun18
Reviews.Content: Pool and Ocean- We were here during a school vacation and it was very crowded. You had to put down towels on chairs by 7:30 am to reserve a seat. Even then, your seat was in the midst of many, many noisy children. Not that relaxing. If you don't get a seat by the pool, you can sit by the ocean, but the chairs are less comfortable and most people don't actually swim in the ocean here. This is for a few reasons, the beach sand and ocean floor are not great. The water is cloudy and full of seaweed and the waves are strong with an undertow. So pool seating is preferable, but harder to get. At one point two pool chairs opened up and I went to sit down, but the pool attendant told me she was reserving these chairs for someone. I came by an hour later, no one had ever sat there and a different attendant was removing the towels the first attendant had put there. I asked him if I could sit there and he said sure. I told him that the other attendant told me that she was saving them for someone. He said that's not allowed! I guess someone should let everyone know that this is the rule. In addition to the difficulty of getting seats by the pool, the seats are all lined up together and it is hard to position your chair if you want shade or sun, the chair basically stays put. You are right on top of your neighbors. Pool food service is pretty slow, but the food (from Seagrapes) is good. The pools are pretty, warm, and nicely landscaped. Occasionally the iguanas will go for a swim, but they are harmless. The bathrooms by the pool were always dirty and wet. It didn't seem like any one was taking care of it. Room- We had a third floor garden view room in building six. This is close to the Plantation House, the pool, the spa, the fitness center and Seagrapes. It is far from the convention center, Molasses and the Boat House. I thought the location was perfect for our needs. The room is beautiful It is spacious and well appointed. The bathrooms are large. The only real negative with the rooms is that it is hard to adjust the temperature of the shower. It was either burning hot or freezing cold. Otherwise the beds are comfortable and the technology is good. Spa- The spa is lovely. I had a massage and facial. They were average in quality, but a bit on the expensive side. Fitness center- The fitness center has 3 ellipticals, 4 treadmills (one broken), and a few other cardio machines, bicycles and weight machines. It has towels and water bottles and an exercise room. It is very nice. Food- The food is well above average. Fern is extremely good and Seagrapes is excellent for a poolside restaurant. The food and room were the two best features of this hotel. Activities/location- There are no water sports at all. You have to go elsewhere for that. We took a sailboat excursion, but the marina is a good 45 minute drive from the hotel. The hotel seems far from most activities and 45 minutes from Old San Juan. On the premises is a boathouse, but we were told since it was so crowded that it would be hard to get kayaks or bicycles. We took the nature walk and it was nice. Butler service- We were supposed to have butler service, but every morning when I called down for coffee, they told me I didn't have butler service. When I asked them to check, they came back and said oh you do have butler service, what would you like. The coffee came very quickly and was very good. Fern's restaurant- We had a reservation for 8 pm on the first night of our arrival at the hotel. It was the only time available on Opentable. We were starving and called over and asked if we could come earlier and they told us we couldn't. When we arrived at 8 pm, the place was empty. I don't know why we couldn't come earlier. Then for breakfasts each morning, we requested outdoor seating. Each day they said no, despite the fact that there were many empty tables outdoors. I just don't understand this approach to customer service at all. Would we return?- I would have to say probably not. The pool is too crowded, the beach is not inviting and there are no activities nearby. It feels like a pretty and new hotel in the middle of nowhere. There is a ton of construction going on around the property. They are continually building more and more condo units all over the place. I don't know if the condo owners use the hotels facilities, but if they do, it will be even more crowded. In addition, the service is friendly and polite, but not efficient.

Reviews.Title: “St. Regis Bahia Beach Resort”
Reviews.Author: likestotravelalot053
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a wonderful week at the Bahia Beach Resort. Highly recommend Shawn for airport tranportation to hotel. He was waiting for us upon arrival and even stopped at the supermarket on the way to the hotel. Car is immaculate and he speaks perfect English. His numbrr is787 513-7685. I booked him before we left. The hotel is terrific and everyone goes out of their way to be polite and helpful. The rooms including the bathrooms are large and beautiful. The golf course with some holes along the water is really fun to play. The course is in great shape and there is a reduced rate after 3pm. The beach is great for walking and if you are not a beach person, the pool is tremendous. There are always chairs available at the beach or pool. It was a great vacation and we hope to return again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Very Positive”
Reviews.Author: Karan1000
Reviews.Content: Overall, very good stay. few key comments 1. Room was very nice 2. Overall property is spectacular 3. Service is subpar at the pool but above average overall 4. Beach is nice, not amazing by any stretch 5. If your expectation is there wont be a lot of kids, think twice. a lot of little kids there 6. Main restaurant, Fern, is excellent

Reviews.Title: “Don't Expect Service at a Four Seasons / Trump Level”
Reviews.Author: MWG630
Reviews.Content: This had to be one of the biggest disappointments in many years of travel. In the past, we've stayed at other St Regis properties and found them to be comparable to the FS / Trump for service, cleanliness, grounds and attention to details. To explain the level of poor service, is difficult to begin to even put it into words. The staff seemed to be enough, even for their "high" season. Instead, you had staff standing around watching the guests and enjoying their own side conversations or taking time to "text" while they were "working". The beach was less than expected and some of the staff could have easily spent time cleaning up the trash and plastic bottles that could be found on several of our walks on the beach. Yes, there were several broken pieces of glass we frequently threw away or even picked-up the plastic and placed it in the trash cans. For a "top-end" resort with potential, my wife and I joked it may be time for an under-cover boss episode by the President and CEO of Starwood. It has potential, but we'll pass and head to another Four Seasons or Trump property. If you are looking to spend time away and unwind...this in not the place to spend your limited time away from reality and the office. We will not be returning to the St. Regis in PR and will share our experience with our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay -5 Star All The Way!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights with our 8 month old son this week and had a phenomenal time. The hotel is beautiful! The lobby is lovely, our room was perfect and the grounds are perfectly manicured and simply gorgeous. I had read mixed reviews about the staff and property itself and was a little apprehensive at first and now that Ive experienced it myself, I honestly don't know what those people were talking about! Everything really exceeded my expectations (which are high). The entire staff was so very friendly and could not have been nicer. I never walked by a member of the staff without being greeted and asked if I needed anything- everyone was always willing to jump at any request. Rosie, our concierge was amazing and went above and beyond for us. She really made our stay extra special- be sure to ask for Rosie when you go! The pools are fabulous and the restaurants are all really nice and food is great overall. My only request to management would be to keep Seagrapes open every night for dinner or to open Molasses or Fern an hour early so there is a place to go for dinner starting at 5. With a baby, the earlier is obviously better and since there were so many families there, I would think they would have had that in place already. Overall we really had a wonderful stay and definitely plan to return again soon! I highly recommend this resort- you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 2nd Babymoon Vacation”
Reviews.Author: TraciJD05
Reviews.Content: Apparently a lot of other pregnant women shared my same idea and decided to visit this resort in the middle of January! We stayed at this property for 4 days and 3 nights as our last vacation before our 2nd child arrived. My husband, son (4 years old) and I LOVED this resort. We felt truly pampered and not over crowded. We stayed in room 414 (or 416?) I believe ----- it was the ground floor room right next to the plantation house. We enjoyed our private deck and very short walk to the beach. Upon arrival our room wasn't ready, which was fine. The employees took our luggage and promised to have it at the room after we finished lunch by the pool. Highly recommend the restaurant by the pool - it had a great breeze, was the most reasonably priced, and good selection of food for kids. Speaking of kids make sure you use the kid meal pass. As a pregnant woman it was nice to have him order a ton of food and when I finished mine I could eat his too :) Our room was amazing - very large and spacious and more than enough room for the 3 of us. During our stay we went bike riding almost every day and spent all of our outdoor time at the beach. The pool looked amazing, but being from Atlanta we came to experience the beach not the pool. The water was a little choppy but none of us were doing any major swimming so it didn't bother us one bit. We tried Molasses which was ok - we went one night but didn't return back and I wouldn't recommend it. I would recommend Fern for breakfast --- it was amazing! We loved the french toast and fresh smoothies and any breakfast item I wanted which was made to order. Also I noticed the dress code was relaxed for breakfast, but did noticed that people were more dressed up for dinner. We also ordered food at the bar at night for dinner and ate on our patio. The first time we did this we were told there was no kid's menu, but the subsequent nights we were given a kid's menu so make sure push for one. We actually never left the resort as this vacation was all about eating and relaxing and slowing down and it was perfect for that. The resort definitely has enough space to wander and walk, but they also provide golf carts for easy transportation around the property. Unless you are HYPER picky there is no reason not to enjoy this property. Yes you will shell out some $$$ (especially for food and tips) so if you're not prepared to do so I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - great pool- natural surroundings”
Reviews.Author: NeedRelaxin
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 days 4 nights. Great food. Nice staff. Great service. Beach is beautiful, not white sand but natural. If you like looking at palm trees while on the beach instead of high rise hotels this is your place. If you want to party and dance until 3 stay closer to hotel row near airport in San Juan. Food was fantastic and one of the most magnificent golf course views you can find. Stayed in King room, great huge bathroom nicely laid out and plenty of space. If you want to go someplace and truly relax in comfort this is it. Negatives: food is very expensive. Drinks very expensive. $18 for specialty drinks? I think since this property under 2 years old, they are still trying to recoup costs. Shopping on site....basic stuff but expensive. Wife went to get beach coverup cheapest one she could find was $200. Bring earplugs frogs are noisy at night!! Overall great place.

Reviews.Title: “Best Overall Property I have stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Cahaba244
Reviews.Content: Well, I booked this not knowing what to expect of either the property or Puerto Rico. I have stayed at a St Regis in Atlanta and thought I kew, within reason, What to expect. The St Regis is a luxury brand that is really well appointed, in the cases I have seen at least. I saw the pictures and the ratings people gave it and was actually on the fence as to whether to book it or not. I can be somewhat of a risk taker and felt a little nervous about statying here. I shouldn't have been so concerned. I do like the finer things in life to a certain degree. Namely the food and atmosphere are what I am typically drawn to in a resort. With the furnishings and designed experience coming together as well as it did i was pleasantly surprised. Some of other reviews I read about the propperty have described it as "too far out, from town". really? There is a Ralph's not 10 minutes away ( I have never seen one of those in the countryside, anywhere! ). Also too far from San Juan! We coud be in San Juan in 40 minutes without any major traffic. "over priced and over-rated" was another reivew. I am not wealthy but i do splurge on travel sometimes so keep that in mind with this review. The place was a little pricey but if your not a "big drinker and don't care for the all inclusive get as full as you can and drink as much as you can, to get your prepaid money's worth then maybe this is the place for you. I was looking for a great family vacation spot that would be something my children would remember and look back on with a smile. My wife and I had some of the best food i have eaten outside continental US. First the Best meal I had was at Fern, above the lobby restaurant ( Jean George's, whom I had never heard of prior to this trip ). Appetizer: Avocado Pizza: Exceptionally good and Steamed Shrimp Salad very tasty and sweet, Main Course: Roasted Grouper with Black beans ( best fish I have ever eaten ) and Parmesan encrusted chicken ( My oh My was that good too ), Dessert: Carrot Cake with Cream Cheese Ice Cream ( wanted to lick the plate when my wife turned her head, but i didn't! ). Molasses was the next restaurant ( Puerto Rican Food at the Golf Clubhouse, I had never had Mofongo before, wow! ) Appetizer: Pork Belly ( enough said, it was great ),The Mofongo: ( Plantains and Beef with Creola sauce ) was beef roast and "potato like" flavor on steroids. So full i didn't order a dessert. Seagrapes was the poolside bar/restauranta that you generally eat lunch at. We did so every day at the pool and were never dissapointed. The sweet potato fries were the whole family favorite. I can honestly say that the food was not a let down at any of the meals we ate there. The food is not cheap! But the food is exceptionally prepared and well thought out, not fru fru but nicely presented and prepared. The sushi appetizers, Pizza & Egg Rolls at the pool were really good. The most important ( next to food ) element in "my" good vacation is people and how they treat you while in their hometown. The people we encountered at the property and off were amazingly helpful, courteous and giving. A few to mention at the resort were Efram at the lobby as a fantastic front man with a easy smile for all people, Dalesse at Seagrapes was very helpful as was Clarrissa, Ettiene at Fern was always on the spot with anything you needed and very easy to talk to. Off property the best things were the Old San Juan tour and especially the Segway tour to El Morro. Miguel was great but his partner needs some rough edges polished. The segway was so easy to get the hang of and fun too. I was shocked we could jump on it after a 5 minute lesson and ride it for several miles. it was really fun to learn that and all the history of Old San Juan. We ate at La Bombonera in Old San Juan. Red beans and Rice, Mallorca was excellent ( Bacon, Egg and Cheeeeeeeeese on Mallorca bread ) really good if you like a cheese toasty sandwhich with Egg and bacon. We will be back to San Juan and St Regis at Bahia Beach. Best trip with the family i have had. The Price point is a higher than typical and so was the delivered product. Carl Gavine, the tennis pro was very helpful and a talented teacher. Karla at the spa is a great masseuse also.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars - Top to Bottom”
Reviews.Author: JK1LongIsland_NY
Reviews.Content: Spend 6 Days 5 Nights at the beginning of March. This resort is a Five Star Resort. From the Resort to the Staff you are treated like VIPs. One of the best kept Golf Courses in the Caribbean. The beach is nice (There were comments about the Surf being rough) anyone used to waves from beaches on the east coast of the US would find these waves small). The Restaurants and Bars are top notch. (Prices are expensive, but no more that an major city would be within the U.S.). I would highly recommend this resort, and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Property - Skimps in Some Areas”
Reviews.Author: Pammy C
Reviews.Content: Love the room - the views - the pools and restaurants. The spa was magnificent. But $$$$$$$ for what you pay you would expect a little more. Come on....they urged us to go to the sabering of the "champagne" at 6pm. Yes, we went - watched the quick ceremony. The top of the bottle was cut off and the bartender walked off with the full bottle of Proseco while everyone stood around waiting for a taste and cheer. Nope if you wanted some....get out your credit card. It will cost you $18 for a glass. That is pathetic. Only thing that was free was the thimble of ice tea that you got at the pool at noon. $60 a day for internet and towels at the pool. Wait we never went to the pool but once. They should take a lesson from the Four Seasons. Unfortunately we will not be back. :(

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but still not up to St. Regis expectations!”
Reviews.Author: kimmariec66
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this was our 2nd visit to this property. We were very happy with our stay the first time and the same holds true this time except for the things I feel I must mention below. The property is amazing and very well kept! Even after a years time we found everything to be just as nice as the year before when it first opened. The staff is excellent and very willing to please except for some basic service offerings which keep it from meeting 5 star St. Regis standards. When the Property first opened, upon check-in your were offered a glass of Champagne, now it's rum punch. From there your Butler would escort you to your room and offer to unpack your clothes and make you a fresh mojito. (which by the way I did not except last year) This trip that never happened! Last year upon your request you received french pressed coffee to your room every morning. This year I was told that was now reserved for Supreme rooms and I had to go to the plantation house which is their main lobby for my coffee and a little walk from our room. I don't have to leave my house to get coffee in the morning, why would I do that when I am on a luxury vacation? Mind you we had two rooms one for my Husband and I and one for our Children at $1000.00 a night each. I don't care what room I'm in there should at least be a coffee maker in my room, which there wasn't. Also gone was the free pressing of your clothing which again I was told was reserved for the supreme rooms? The only problem with this hotel is consistency!!! There were many complaints last year about this hotel not meeting a 5 star St Regis standard and it is only getting worse. We are not snobs, but we are used to staying in luxury hotels. When you are charging top of the line prices for the rooms, food & drinks plus a $60 a day resort fee things like free coffee, having your clothing pressed and a glass of Champagne upon arrival should be STANDARD!!! This is not asking much! We were there on points like most of the guests in the hotel and I think this is truly the problem. Even though we are well earning our hotel stay with our spending power you get the feeling that the management looks at it like you are staying for free. They need to become consistent with what they offer and not nickle and dime you over a cup of coffee and pressing your clothes. It left me with a less than luxury feeling this time and with a new property opening for the Ritz this year in Puerto Rico I feel like they should step up their game and become a true luxury property! As a Business owner I know that it is the little things that make a guest feel special and continue to be a repeat customer. Take note St Regis!

Reviews.Title: “Would give it a 5 but doesn't meet that standard”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the St. Regis for our mini-honeymoon after getting married on St. John. First let me say that this is an extremely beautiful resort. We enjoyed our time at the St. Regis. Here are the pros: 1) great service, 2) amazing guest room, 3) lush well maintained property, 4) excellent food. Cons: 1) a long drive from San Juan (but is secluded and private), 2) beach does not compare to other beaches in the caribbean (i.e. St. John, St. Croix, BVI), 3) very expensive (we used points for one of the nights). I have been fortunate to have stayed at other high end properties like the Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons and the St. Regis does compete with said hotels, however we could have stayed at the Ritz Carlton in San Juan for less money (However, Ritz Carlton not as secluded). Personally, I had to give the St. Regis a rather than a 5 because they did nothing for my wife and I upon arrival for our honeymoon. It wasn't until I pointed this out the following day that they arranged for a bottle of wine and a bubble bath. When you pay as much as you do for such a resort you have high expectations and even higher expectations when it is a special occasion. They fell flat on their face in this regard. In the end a wonderful stay, but not perfiect due to their mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit, same comments.”
Reviews.Author: ekgzeid
Reviews.Content: Visited in April 2011. Review from last year still valid. Nothing has changed (good in some respects, not so good in others). 1. Transportation. Do not rely on the resort to get you anywhere. My husband was stranded at the nearby Trump golf course for over 2 hours (and remember the Concierge never answers the phone so you are a bit helpless). Go to TOURSANJUAN.com. Francisco takes care of all your transportation needs, to and from the airport, golf trips, tours etc. He shows up, always on time, in a beautiful, clean vehicle and he is a wonderful source of info about Puerto Rico. As posted at the airport, a cab to the resort is at least 65$, so Francisco is well worth the few extra dollars. He confirms your reservations and has a nice website too. 2. The Concierge desk. Check in is always a crap shoot. There are only 2 people manning the station and there always seems to be a crowd hovering, they clearly need to hire more staff. The phone is never answered (which I guess is a good thing because when I finally have the full attention of the Concierge, I don't want her taking a phone call to help someone else). Although the Concierge staff is very nice, they are clearly overwhelmed. 3. Confirmations. You will receive a nice email greeting after you make your reservation which asks what reservations (dinner, tee times etc) you would like to make and any special requests. You can email or fax your requests but you will never hear back so save yourself the headache and just make the reservations yourself. Call the pro shop and make your own tee times. Go to Open Table and make your own dinner reservations. Things go much more smoothly if you just take care of it yourself. I know, not what you expect from a luxurious resort but it is what it is and based on the comments, the St. Regis HAS to be aware of their shortcomings but does not care, they do not change a thing. 4. Butlers? What butlers? Still waiting for our butler from our April 2011 visit to introduce himself. Forget about it. 5. The rooms. Housekeeping is incredible. Rooms are amazingly clean and well appointed. Turn down service is always done at the perfect time. The bathrooms are amazing and all the little nice touches you would expect at this price are there. 6. Restaurants. Food is very good. If someone is going to complain or comment about the price, they have not done their homework. Typical resort prices (that does not mean that I think a medium size bottle of Fiji water at the pool should be 10$). Both Molasses and Fern serve great food and the service is always excellent. As it is at the pool restaurant. All of the food staff are so nice, helpful and genuinely concerned with making you happy. Even when they are being treated rudely by guests who clearly do not how to smile or thank you. You know who you are! The breakfast bar in the lobby is a great touch. 7. Golf. Traveled with a "real" golfer. He played the resort course last year and was a bit turned off by the unresponsive staff and snooty attitude of the members (it is "their" course after all). Big change this year. Staff was great, helpful and friendly and the members were a little less chilly to resort guests. Course itself is difficult but not very interesting. He played Trump (very close by) and liked that alot more. 8. Resort grounds. Very well maintained and beautiful. Paths could be a bit more illuminated at night but no complaints. Pool area is always spotless. Lobby is warm and inviting and comfortable. Truly, a stunning resort. Those people who commented about the resort being "away from it all" should learn how to read a map. Did they think the resort was in the middle of San Juan? Their ignorance should not be manifested as a complaint against the resort. Do your homework! 9. Glitches. Little things that are annoying? Calling in advance to request an early check-in and waiting til an hour and a half AFTER the standard appointed check in time of 3pm to get into our room. In the resort's defense, they did upgrade our room and store our luggage after we managed to get bathing suits out. On check out day, we were begrudgingly give an extra hour and a half to check out (they figured that was fair since we had to wait that long past check in time to get into our room). But we were able to use all the facilities and showered at the spa (for a fee) so it was fine. Showers are also available for free at the golf course. So no real glitches but remember, I made all my reservations myself to avoid any problems. Overall? We will probably return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort!”
Reviews.Author: LMLG31
Reviews.Content: What a perfect setting for our first trip to Puerto Rico! The St. Regis is a stunningly beautiful resort with outstanding service and plenty of amenities. We stayed at the resort for 5 nights the week of February 13th, 2012. We booked the hotel using Starwood points and my husband also had platinum status. We rented a car at the airport and after 1 wrong turn arrived at the resort after a 45 minute drive. Upon our arrival we were greeted by several staff members and given some rum punch. We were upgraded to an ocean front suite. The suite was spotless and had a wonderful patio where we could sit and listen to the ocean. The suite was very spacious, from the 2 full baths, large foyers, walk in closet, and comfortable living area. We only used the butler service a few times but they kindly called each day to check in with us. The pool design is great as it allows for a bit of privacy. During our stay the resort was not full. There were always plenty of chairs and umbrellas available around the pool any time of day. The frozen grapes and signature tea the staff brings around throughout the day is a nice treat! The beach was beautiful and we walked quite a distance in both directions and never saw any trash along the shore. The staff was always eager to please and went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable and that we enjoyed our stay. I can't say enough positive things about how attentive everyone was to even the smallest details during our stay. We dined at all 3 restaurants and had enjoyable experiences. We enjoyed the tasting menu at Fern and the skirt steak mofongo at Molasses. Seagrapes had a good turkey wrap and nachos. We had wonderful massages at the spa and used the free kayak rental to check out thd lake. Off of the property we did the bio bay kayak trip, we went zip lining, hiked in the El Yunque rain forest (swam in the waterfall), and spent an afternoon/evening exploring Old San Juan. The resort was $$$, but nothing that I would consider outrageous for an island resort. Weare already planning our visit back to the St Regis next year! Pros Beautiful resort in an amazing setting! Very attentive staff Clean and spacious rooms Large pool and clean beach Cons Terrible directions on the website from the airport to the resort. The location of the resort is a bit isolated from a lot of activities on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but whoa boy is it costly”
Reviews.Author: JeffersonsMom
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at the St. Regis. There was a huge need for this kind of property in PR and I'm glad it's here. The grounds are lovely, the rooms are great, and the staff was overall very good. (And that's saying something because service overall in PR can be quite lousy.) The restaurants are also lovely - a particular highlight was breakfast in the main dining room, and the mofongo at Molasses. With that said, just a few things to keep in mind when you book here. First of all, you will drop a TON of cash when you come. Even with the $25/day per kid meal plan, we were routinely dropping $50-60 just for breakfast for me and my husband. How is that even possible? However, we did book on points and so we were prepared that all these costs were just the price of the vacation. Another major disappointment for me was the lack of availability of chairs at the pool. Basically if we wanted a chair, we had to be up by about 6:30 at the latest to reserve them with towels. And most of the 'reserved' chairs sat empty for the majority of the day. Granted, we were there the week between Christmas and New Year's, but for the prices many of the guests were paying to stay, I would have expected St. Regis to come up with a better system. Frankly, they ended up losing revenue - there were many times when I would have loved to sit out by the pool with a cocktail and watched my kids swim in the pool, but there were no available chairs because they were all 'reserved' with towels. So the chairs sat empty, I stayed thirsty, and the hotel missed out on the price of an expensive cocktail. All in all, I would not hesitate to return! But a bargain it is not.

Reviews.Title: “good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: treefreak
Reviews.Content: we went to this resort with high expectations, but they just were not met. yes, we did use points to stay here, but even with the points it was expensive, especially considering the number of points to book. pluses: beautiful grounds very friendly staff negatives: room never cleaned unless we complained deck behind room always flooded long walk from room to get anywhere chaise lounge chairs "reserved" by guests by 7 am for a new luxurious resort i guess we were not that impressed. we have stayed at the rio mar a number of times over the years and we will go back to it. not as luxurious, but all the bases are covered for much less and it is definitely easier to navigate. steve

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Vacation! Will Return”
Reviews.Author: Indot081
Reviews.Content: We've been to PR before but had a so-so experience and we were very excited to see that the St Regis had been build there. After reading some of the earlier reviews i was concerned about the service and some of the "hiccups" (if you will)...that the resort was having in the beginning. Well, we were pleasently surprised to find that the service was excellent during our stay and it was a very enjoyable experience!! We will defintely return! Pros: First, the grounds are gorgeous, the golf course is pristine, the lakes, tennis courts, nature walk are all amazing. The people at the resort were all so nice and we wanted for nothing Cons: They could use more of a variety of dining options, also having a coffee maker in the rooms would be nice considering it is a bit of a walk first thing in the AM to go over to the restaurant Overall, as i mentioned we had a gret time and fell in love with PR again!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Grounds”
Reviews.Author: Milo911MD
Reviews.Content: The resort and the grounds were absolutely gorgeous. The rooms were nicely appointed and top notch. We had excellent service. Everyone was very friendly. We did not experience any service short comings. We felt the price of the food to be comparable to other resorts of the same caliber and in line with nicer restaurants in the city. The pools were very nice. The location was little too far away from the city and remote >> which probably lead tot he stunning setting. We ended up going to Culbera and Vieques for our beach days. We had a car for the duration and used it a lot. Although the beach views looked good in the distance, we did not care for the beach ( hardly anyone was using the beach either). Fern, their signature restaurant was not up par with other Jean-Georges establishment. The food on their other restaurant Molasses was very similar, and we actually found the setting and ambiance nicer there. Pros: The Grounds, the setting, the rooms, pool and the staff Cons: The Beach, The distance from everything else, food choices ( very similar at both restaurant. It would have be nicer if they change one restaurant to a signature steak/ Sea food place , such as BLT in Ritz)

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: sharkoss
Reviews.Content: We went on christmas vacation. We loved trying a new resort. It is only a year old and ridiculously expensive. We had a two bedroom suite that was one of the nicest rooms on the property. It was suppose to come with a butler. It did the first day. When you go away your room should be cleaned and bathroom tidied up and night table . It wasn't. The room smelled of mildew. Had to call for fresh towels. The service poor. The service in the restaurants was pathetic. We ended up calling our order in and taking it to go because the wait was so long. Lunch we ate at the no frills cabana. We found at people came on points and were paying a quarter we of what we were. Christmas points? The overall food was not good. You need to take a 45 minute ride to go to San Juan for dinner. If the food was good we wouldn't have had to leave 5 times. The girl when we check it was very unwelcoming! One of our family members is in hospitality she couldn't believe the unfriendly welcome. In most resorts there is music playing . Whether it being a reggae band or just plain music. Nothing! New years eve? no flyers when around it was word of mouth for the most discussing meal. We ended up at the pool bar eating pizza.A guest had to bring her i phone and hook it into speakers for music New Years Eve. All I can say is that the hoel needs A lot of work. Been to St. Reigis hotels before this one was really a major disappointment. There is a new manager and new concierge that were really nice and hopefully they will change the operations of this hotel/

Reviews.Title: “It is very good, with a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: curlsgirl
Reviews.Content: When we got to the St. Regis, we were greeted with a great rum punch. Check in was easy, and then we went to our room. Our room is on the ground floor was building three, and it is beautiful, and it has a very nice bathtub. The beach is not for swimming, but is nice to go in. The pool is good for a whole day of rest with waiters bringing the good food from the restaurant by the pool, Seagrapes. Our butler, Juan was very good to us and was always ready to give us a tip about the area. Molasses, another restaurant was alright, not amazing. At Fern, the food is nice however the service is not. For breakfast we waited a half hour to get seated, even though plenty of tables were there, with just food from a party an hour ago, sitting on it. The matre'de was not great, he canceled our reservation when we showed up at 7:03, not 7. The remede spa gave me an amazing customized massage. Besides from the service at Fern, the hotel is a gret place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “One Year Later...”
Reviews.Author: BeachE14
Reviews.Content: This is my second review of this property.We returned exactly 1 year later.My husband and I came back with the same couple and another joined us too.We all were upgraded when we checked in, so we thought we were off to a good start! We were given ground floor 1 bedroom suites.The suites were beautiful.However in our friends suite they detected a mildew odor.They thought this may have been normal but it got worse .They were given humidifers so for the first 3 nights they spent emptying them out .Finally they were switched to another room.The service in the only restaurant offering breakfast Fern was very spotty.The staff although friendly and genuinely wanted to please just couldn't understand simply requests. For example I ordered poached eggs well done it came back undercooked twice.I ordered a side of smoked salmon and I got a side of raw uncooked salmon! My friends husband ordered flowers for Valentines Day for his wife and card should have read Happy Valentines Day with her husbands name.Instead the card said Welcome to the St Regis signed The St Regis.The second night of our stay our room was completely skipped for turn down service.We had no fresh towels or water plus I has to turn down the bed myself.The Gym is very small for a resort which is on so much property.They do not offer classes nor do they have weights less than 5 pounds.There is no staff person in the room.Another complaint the beach chairs are extremely uncomfortable ( no cushions)I also have to mention the beds and pillows are uncomfortable as well. Having said all this I don't think I have been to a prettier resort the grounds and fauna are just magnificent. The golf was great and my husband got a wonderful massage.I just thought after 1 year they would have gotten their act together by now.Unfortunately thats just not the case.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property But Overpriced and Lacking in Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: emnolan4
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the St. Regis Bahia Beach for a long weekend in December. The hotel is about a 30 minute drive from the San Juan airport so renting a car or hiring a car service is necessary. Be forewarned - valet parking is $45 a day and since you don't really need a car on the property, using a shuttle or car service would be much more economical. The property is very spaced out but if you are not up for walking, there are bikes to rent during the day chauffered golf carts (two of the few free things at the resort) that can take you anywhere you want to go at a moment's notice. The property is gorgeous - lush landscaping with lots of shade and a boardwalk that leads from all of the villas to the main lodge. We literally feel like we were in Jurassic Park and a dinosaur was going to pop out behind a bush at any moment. In reality, the property is swarming with lizards so we did need to watch out feet! Our room was a short walk from the main lodge and while it did not have a view at all (we looked into the trees and down to a dirt walkway towards the pool), we were very impressed with our room. It was spacious yet cozy and an extremely calming atmosphere. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom had a double vanity, massive soaking tub, and rain shower head. Every room has a covered patio with a loveseat/chaise and table where we would have breakfast in the mornings. We dined at both restaurants on the property during our stay. Personally, we liked Fern better than Molasses. Both were expensive but not outrageous. Since the hotel is very isolated, you had better like the menus at both restaurants if you are planning on staying for two nights! Otherwise, it is a long drive to Old San Juan or other places to eat off property. The biggest dining disappointment was Seagrapes, the restaurant at the pool. The food was overpriced (think $20 for a plate of rotten raw vegetables and dip), not good and the service was terrible. We waited over 45 minutes for our drink orders one day. The manager was understanding of our situation and did comp our food/drinks that day. Hopefully they have worked out the kinks here. The beach was disappointing but the pool was nice but very crowded. Lots of sunlight/shade options and umbrellas for almost every two chairs. Despite a lot of chair saving that seemed to be going on, we always found a place to sit that satisfied what we were looking for in terms of sun/shade/location. The pool attendants are quite eager to clean up chairs so if you are leaving your seat even for a few minutes, leave something on it so they don't get rid of your stuff! I learned that lesson the hard way... We were most surprised at the number of children at the property. It definitely isn't a kid-friendly place and there weren't really any child-focused activities. Perhaps because there are so few common areas on the property, the number of children seemed intensified. This is our second trip to Puerto Rico. Last time we stayed at the W Vieques (also a Starwood Property). If we are to return to Puerto Rico, we would definitely choose the W Vieques over the St. Regis Bahia Beach. In terms of value, location, activities, the W Vieques has a LOT more to offer. It's not as luxurious as the St. Regis but we also didn't feel like we were getting robbed every time we ordered a cocktail at the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Laying back island style”
Reviews.Author: riversideview
Reviews.Content: When we arrived Daniel received us with a warm welcome and a friendly smile at the hotel reception. But the best part after a long flight he refreshed us with a delicious exotic drink. We went to the room and it was beyond our expectations. So comfy i could stay there all afternoon.
