The sound of the ocean and the scent of nature coming thru our door was breathtaking, exactly what we needed. We ordered private dining it took forever but well worth the wait. Next day we were so relaxed we did not step out of our room until the afternoon and decided to stop by the spa because we heard great reviews about it. From the moment we walked in it felt like an ashram, so calming. The receptionist Krystal greeted us with an enchanting smile. We had no idea which treatment we wanted but she definitely helped us with all the information. She was very patient and help us find a last minute appointment. She even explained the products according to the treatment she described. The massages were phenomenal and the spa was exceptional. We had to thank the receptionist when we signed out because of the incredible experience. We took a shower and headed back for our reservation at Fern. We decided to stop at the St. Regis bar to see the Champagne Savoring. We ran in to the bartender and he escorted us outside for the ritual. He explained the entire story about the savoring and ended up teaching us how to do it step by step. It was a whole experience. We sat at the bar and he recommended to us a cucumber Martini and a ginger margarita, which is a must. Then he explained to us a fascinating story about the mural behind the bar. We had such a great time with Elvis that we decided to asked him to call Fern and cancel our reservation so we could have diner at the St. Regis Bar, which actually has the same menu as Fern. We asked him about good stops to eat and visit, it felt like we had our own personal concierge. The golf course was one of the best we've ever played on. The pool was beautiful. The beach was not the best but very nice for strolling around in the afternoons. The trip was all around amazing. We will definitely return in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “average but pricey”
Reviews.Author: northerner473
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis is on beautiful grounds and the rooms are large and spacious with a bathroom big enough to be a bedroom. There are no windows that open for ventilation but there is a nice patio with the rooms. The pool is very pretty and spacious. The beach is not pretty and if you take a walk on the beach you quickly run into significant garbage on the beach whether you go right or left. This detracts from any aesthetics of a nice beach walk. The food at the restaurants was good however service was very slow. It's best to order lunch by the pool or beach to avoid the long table wait. The food is also very expensive for what you get. We felt nickel and dimed at this resort. For instance, to get a single cup of coffee, you need to go to the main building of the hotel otherwise they will charge you for a single morning cup of coffee at the outdoor restaurant. Also, at lunch, some people near us asked for some bread and inquired about price- it was $3 for a few pieces of bread so they decided not to order bread. For a luxury price, we did not feel that we had a luxury experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Paradise in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: LUISMOLINARY
Reviews.Content: As a resident of what we call our Paradise, Puerto Rico, we usually visit our local hotels for meetings, conventions or occasionally just to enjoy a weekend. I have the opportunity to visit this hotel for the first time for a medical meeting and it's just amazing. Excellent for couples and golf lovers. Never imagine we can have another Paradise, inside our Paradise....

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely gorgeous resort”
Reviews.Author: Cloring
Reviews.Content: The resort is about 30 minutes from San Juan and you should have a rental car to take advantage of its proximity to other sites such as the rainforest or bio bay in Fajardo. Their is a resort fee and charge for parking. The grounds, rooms, restaurant, and amenities are beyond comparison and you will truly feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort; service could improve”
Reviews.Author: JktJen10
Reviews.Content: The rooms and resort grounds are unlike anything I have seen before. I never wanted to leave the St. Regis! The staff was friendly and pleasant and we appreciated the efforts, but at the end of the day when you are paying as much as you do to stay at the St. Regis, service should be outstanding. We unfortunatley did not experience that. As mentioned, they were pleasant, however it seems that management needs to get more involved and help them step up their game.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: KatbAdelaide
Reviews.Content: This hotel and it's grounds are utterly stunning! The staff are sensational, the food superb, the pool gorgeous. I cannot fault this hotel. Going Kayaking around the lagoon is great practice before going on the Bio Bay tour and bike riding around the grounds is a beautfiul way to work off those cocktails! The beach is gorgeous and whilst it was quite choppy whilst we were there, it was lovely just to be able to stroll along it. The rooms are beautifully appointed and having the lounge on the verandah was a nice place to sit and look at the gardens before heading off to dinner. It might not be a true reflection on how the majority of Puerto Ricans live, but it is a beautiful resort to go to and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “overview”
Reviews.Author: strategy543
Reviews.Content: My husband and I met Lisa Gelabert when we entered the St. Regis resort, and were given a thorough tour of the property. The room we visited was everything on our wish list and more. I liked the configuration of the pool which allowed little private like areas. We had great views of the beach during our lunch by the pool. The resort offers a multitude of activities. We will definately book in soon.

Reviews.Title: “New, Gorgeous, & First Class Starwood Property!”
Reviews.Author: BOLDMissionHills_KS
Reviews.Content: We just completed a five night stay at the St. Regis in Puerto Rico, January 2012. Over the past year, we have been fortunate enough to stay at St. Regis Hotels in DC, San Francisco, Monarch Beach, and Florence. The St Regis Bahia Beach is truly the most beautiful of these properties. This hotel is also your best Starwood choice when visiting Puerto Rico. We recommend it "slightly" over the W Hotel - Vieques, where we stayed last year (read our review). Here's why: Property/Grounds - The hotel was built on a former coconut plantation. Even though the property is only about a year old, the gardens are mature and magnificent. The beauty of the resort primarily comes from the trees and plants that surround you. Our daily walks along the golf coarse and river felt like having your own private botanical garden. The hotel has twelve separate guesthouse buildings. Buildings 1 & 2 are located on the golf course while 3 through 12 face the ocean. All are beautifully situated, but if you want to hear the ocean sounds, chose from buildings 3 through 12 Rooms - We were fortunate to be upgraded to a suite in Building 6 on the second floor. This was one of the best Starwood hotel rooms we have stayed in. The bathroom was luxury perfect which included a 6x6 rain shower, king size tub, signature TV in mirror, heated floors, and double sinks. The living room included a 42 inch TV, Bose Audio/DVD system, comfortable sectional sofa, refrigerator, tray ceiling & wet bar. All was beautifully decorated. The outdoor terrace was spacious and comfortable for morning coffee or in room dining. Remember free in-room coffee is include with butler services. If not, complimentary coffee/tea is available in the Plantation House each morning till 10:00am. Pool/Beach - The pool area is spectacular with ample space for all. Cabana's were available for an additional fee, but not needed since the design of the pool area naturally provides individual spacing. For those wishing to sun by the water, chairs, towels, and umbrellas were readily available. The beach is great for sunning/relaxing, but the water was rough and not swimmer friendly. Dining - The St Regis is home to three restaurants; Sea Grapes which is basic pool side food. Molasses which is located at the golf club which specializes in local food, and Fern which is located on the second floor of the Plantation House. All are very expensive. Our best meals were not at the St. Regis. Customer Service - The customer service was very good. From the moment we arrived we received first class treatment. Butler services were included in our suite room charge. Concierge, butler and maid services were outstanding. All staff made it a point to greet you with a smile. You could tell a few servers were newly hired and were still in training. Amenities/Resort Fee - The hotel charges a $60 resort fee in addition to your daily room rate. This type of fee as been instituted by Starwood at all of their resorts. It just another way to help the hotel make a profit, similar to the airlines charging for luggage. Unfortunately, the fee does not cover parking, which is another $22. Your resort fee covers Wi-Fi, gym, pool, and non-motorized equipment. Boche ball and croquet are also available. Overall, we loved staying at the St. Regis Bahia Beach. The property is new, gorgeous and first class. This hotel is about relaxation. The palm trees, rooms, beach and acreage lends itself to decompressing from the corporate world. Bring your best resort attire and pretend your last name is Trump or Kennedy. You'll have the time of your life. Helpful Hints - 1. Rent a car. This property requires your ability to come and go as you please. 2. Eat off site whenever possible. The food on site is average and over priced. 3. Stop a Ralph's Grocery for miscellaneous items to save a few bucks. Red Box also available. 4. Day Trips- if you're looking to occasionally get out of the resort visit the rain forest, Old San Juan, and Ponce. There's even an outlet mall about 15 minutes from the hotel for those rainy days - Route 66. 5. First Day - Spend the first day of your stay on site to acquaint yourself with all the St. Regis has to offer. This will help you determine how much extra time you'll have for off-site activities. 6. Morning Walks- Get up with the sun one morning while walking on the beach. You'll remember the morning for years to come. 7. Bring your best resort attire - This property deserves your respect and for you to look your best. Helpful Hotel Suggestions - 1. Why charge a separate fee for parking? Just include it in my resort fee. It just feels like you're nickel and diming your customers. 2. Your Sunset toast is very odd. You invite your guests to watch/listen to a champagne tradition. You open a bottle yet don't provide any complimentary drinks. That's like inviting someone to dinner and then ask them to pay for it. Where are your manners? 3. Beach Front Needs Work - The weakest part of your property is your beach front. The sand and area for your guests is not well kept and feels more like staying at the Sheraton rather than the St. Regis. It's high time you hire an architect and designer to improve this space. It should look like a picture out of a magazine. 4. Beach Lighting - Some of your guest have compared your resort to the Four Seasons in Hawaii. This is a huge compliment. One of the things they do at night is light up a small section of the oceanfront at night. It provides a reason for your guests to come out at night before retiring for the evening. We recommend you light up the estate lawn looking out to the ocean till Fern closes. It's a gorgeous area that disappears after the sun goes down. 5. Plantation House/Fern - Fern is definitely the best restaurant on the property. It deserves white table cloths and better lighting to accent it's importance. We also believe the second story front balcony is a special place that should be used as a sunset bar or after dinner gathering place. Most of your guests don't even know it exists.

Reviews.Title: “Grand experience with small flaws”
Reviews.Author: Rufenacht
Reviews.Content: Selection of restaurants is limited in in available as to the hours of the day. Molasses, at golf course, is better food than main resturant, Fern. Staff & food. Great hot tub somewhat hidden by pool area. We stayed in standard deluxe room by golf course was quite great size for two of us, very pleased. The grapevine resturant by pool is very average food & service, over priced as is and closes early around 5 pm. Grounds and trails are wonderful. They do have villas and town home available to rent. Great week.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the St. Regis”
Reviews.Author: geejay123
Reviews.Content: My family spent a week at the St. Regis in December. The vacation exceeded our expectations! The property is huge and beautiful, and very well-maintained. Rooms are spacious, comfortable and beautiful. The bathroom in itself is a place to hang out in. The staff all genuinely aim to please. We took advantage of many of the property facilities so I'll give you a little summary of our highlights. Plusses: Gorgeous property, beautiful nature everywhere you look, iguanas running around, it's spectacular. Staff are great, sincere, helpful, and happy to drive you around the property in golf carts whenever you need it. So much to do on-property: golf, tennis, great pool, nice beach, bird sanctuary, bicycles, sailing on the lagoon, Beautiful golf course, nice driving range. Nice gym facility too. Good food at the restaurants. GREAT Iguana Club (kids club). Our kids were very hesitant at first, but the staff there were very special and made the kids want to go and stay there every day! Great buffet breakfast by the pool every morning. Also very close to El Yunque, so an excellent family-friendly day trip from the resort. Small minuses: Only 2 tennis courts. This disappointed because it was sometimes hard to get a court time. The golf carts driving around on the property around the rooms were sometimes annoying when you are walking around to the main building or to the pool and back. The staff always stop to let you pass, but still... The resort is very secluded. Which is a big plus in my opinion, but it is nice to get out once in a while. We got tired of the food offerings at the resort after the first few days. So you either need to rent a car or take a taxi anywhere you go, easily adding at least $75-100+ to your outing. Just so you know. Bigger minus: The week before we arrived, the hotel sent us a form asking about our preferences, restaurant, tee-time or court reservations etc. We were impressed! We have food allergies and intolerances (gluten) in our family. So this was important. And we sent them the details of those allergies. What impressed us more was that they sent us a follow up form the following day asking for more detail. This was a first! However, when we arrived to the hotel and asked about any special foods at mealtime, nobody knew what we were talking about! So they asked but didn't deliver, quite disappointing. Luckily I never travel without bringing our own food.

Reviews.Title: “A true get away!!”
Reviews.Author: traveljunky_12
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay. You feel so removed from daily life in this beautiful resort. You feel you are in a different world. The people were super friendly and they were so kind to upgrade us with our american express program. Only comments I have are the parking fee and drink prices. However staying at an upscale place like this, it is to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “could not ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: janiemiz
Reviews.Content: splendid stay. need a car for off premises fun,but that was part of the fun!

Reviews.Title: “best place in puerto rico”
Reviews.Author: RELAYSTAR
Reviews.Content: Returned home on tuesday 1/17/12, had a GREAT time. The place is visually beautiful,it was like being in jurassic park, love the privacy. Let me start about the golf course its fantastic anyone who plays will appreciate this course and with a starwoods membership you get reduced rates still expensive but better. We stayed in room 733 third floor walking distance to pool and beach loved the balcony could hear waves crashing but couldnt see the water that was fine gave us more privacy. Ate at all three resturants, Fern was delicious had the wine pairing, portions alittle small and it was expensive but really good, did it twice. Ate at molasses once would not do that again, had lunch at seagrapes very good food and service.The pool area was relaxing and beautiful, the beach the water the waves the sand all BEAUTIFUL I saw nothing wrong and went swimming several times loved it and you could boogy boardhow great is that most of the other resort beaches in the area have no waves. The tennis courts while only two they were new ingreat shape and in a great setting loved it. The third floor room with cathedral ceiling and sliding glass doors out to the balcony with in room wet bar and refrig was wonderful loved to open the door and hear the waves crashing. The grounds getting from one place to another and the building were all beautiful. My wife and I rented a car and drove around to the other resorts in the area Trump, RioMar, and The Ritz Carlton none of them in my opinion were as nice. We also drove to EL YUNQUE rain forest its close and worth doing but go early before the bus tour crowd you can do it without the tour no big deal. Last about the service everyone was very nice and pleasent they really try hard and are very nice I think not all of them have the experience they need just yet but even those who dont try hard. If you like to drink like us stop at Ralphs grocery store pick up some wine beer vodka and some snacks and mixers its more convenient and saves you some money there is some room in the refrig. If you stay here you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Review on Suite”
Reviews.Author: vionnets
Reviews.Content: First off, I got engaged here and it was more than I could have dreamed of! PROPERTY: Though I have stayed at other, more beautiful St. Regis properties, this one is still stunning and serene. Like many exotic St. Regis locations, the lobby is amazing, and once you walk in the front door, you can see out the back and admire a long lawn leading to a beach and the endless ocean. It is breathtaking, and it's where we watched the sunrise when my fiance proposed. The entire grounds are well manicured and I love the few minutes of the jungle-like path when you are entering the resort. Love it. SERVICE: As usual, St. Regis service goes above and beyond most resorts. However, at this one in particular, something is a bit off with a few people -- I stress it's only a select few, but, it was enough to be frustrating i.e. the receptionist couldn't find a menu for an on site restaurant and told us to "just go check it out [ourselves] and see if [we] like it"... you pay up for service and she should have figured it out considering she lost the book that was at her desk in the first place. Further, she was useless when we asked about things to do in the area. The bartender on the other hand was very informative and we took his advice to explore the rainforest and check out the waterfalls nearby. Also, as I mentioned, I have been to other exotic St. Regis locations and the service here is not up to par with them. BUT, because we'd just gotten engaged, I must say, the resort took amazing care of us -- they worked with my fiance in advance to let us check in early, upgraded us to a suite, and after our engagement they sent us strawberries and champagne, offered to run us a romantic bath with rose petals, and sent us champagne over dinner. That's great communication and really touching when they do these little things. FOOD: We had a couple of meals out by the beach club/pool area, which in our opinion wasn't that great though the view was beautiful. I have to say, we loved the restaurant upstairs in the lobby (can't remember the name) so much, we didn't bother eating dinner elsewhere. We had some dietary restrictions, and our server didn't hesitate to get the chef to speak with us directly about our needs. This is major for those with food allergies, and this a big plus on their part, as even some top restaurants in NYC don't do this for you. We did have some in-villa dining which was also amazing, and we once asked the server for hot sauce which he returned with in under five minutes -- solid. We had brunch outside in the garden one morning which was also beautiful, though a few creatures and birds did start hovering and we had to move indoors. ROOMS: my, oh my! The suite we stayed in was facing a garden and it was beautiful. You enter the room to find in the foyer a bar and the first of two bathrooms. Then you enter the living room which has sliding doors to go outside, a tv, a bose sound system to play music while lounging in there, books and magazines. After that, you find the entrance to the master bedroom, also overlooking the garden outside the sliding doors. The close is spacious enough. The bathroom is fantastic! Two sinks, separated bathroom, and a rainforest shower and bathtub area. The mirror in the bathroom actually has a TV within it! It's impressive, but we didn't even use it once. Room service was prompt and kept everything clean and organized. Overall, we really loved this resort and enjoyed our stay. The engagement went perfectly, and the service that followed was lovely. With the exception of a hiccup here and there (it happens, whatever), we will be back. There's a reason celebs enjoy this place (a few of which we saw!)

Reviews.Title: “Great resort that needs to step it up a notch”
Reviews.Author: ksummerlee
Reviews.Content: I'm going to join in on the "service needs to improve" bandwagon that seems to be the theme of many reviews here. However, although I believe the St. Regis can do better, this is still a VERY fantastic resort, and we absolutely would go back. My Take on the great and the not so great: * Upgraded to a HUGE 1 bedroom suite upon arrival thanks to our SPG status. I will note that because of a lot of reviews here suggesting a room close to the plantation house, we almost missed this opportunity because we made the request on our pre-arrival form. I don't quite get everyone complaining on this site about the size of the grounds. Even if you do have to walk, what a wonderful walk it is on wooden paths through a rain forest. 10 minutes max. You are on vacation in paradise people; enjoy it! Otherwise, golf cart service was fine for us when necessary. * Communication needs to improve amongst all areas of the resort. This is the key to better service. For example: Because of our upgrade, we were given free "butler service". We are told our butler would come by the room to introduce himself to "just call, whatever you need, the Butler will handle." The Butler never came by and, when we called for various things (reservations, etc.) we were always transferred to handle the changes/requests ourselves. Also, I avoided getting coffee service in the room every morning because frankly, just didn't want to keep spending more $$$. How annoyed was I when I found out upon check-out that was included free of charge! Every morning I got dressed and walked up to the plantation house lobby for coffee when I would have much rather been relaxing on our balcony. Finally, you apparently need reservations for every meal. We made a reservation for new years on our pre arrival form but often ended up waiting to eat because we had no reservations. Again, told one thing by butler service and found out otherwise once we arrived to dine. We just couldn't figure out what the butler service really did that made it special. * Spa= awesome facilities but SO expensive. I stuck with a facial and it was really great. However, while waiting for my treatment in the relaxation area, there were no clean glasses for water or tea and, I never saw one person in that area beyond checking in. * The pre-arrival form seems to be nothing but a novelty. No idea why we needed to complete in advance because we ended up having to remake all reservations for dinner, spa, etc. I actually made my own spa reservation online even though I'd requested one of the form. * Food. Everything is expensive and some of it is NOT worth the price. All meals at Fern were excellent and Molasses was good as well. But, Seagrapes is pretty average for what they're charging. Across the board, ingredients missing more than once, or included in things that weren't listed on the menu. (No whip cream with waffles from room service, no olives in greek salad at pool, tomatoes in sandwiches that weren't listed on menu, "crispy" shrimp coming out as steamed. ) Not enough to complain but a 5 star resort should be getting this right every time. * Pool was awesome but just be prepared to spend $18.00 for a Pina Colada. Ouch. * Beach is still beautiful even though it is more murky than expected. * We screwed up and did NOT stop at Ralph's before the turn to the road to the resort like others suggested. We regret that because after 5 days without leaving the resort, those $5 Diet Cokes and $18 cocktails add up. Make sure you do this to stock up on wine, drinks, etc. Otherwise, you'll pay for it. * The resort is really isolated like others suggest. We didn't mind this but if you have big plans for exploring Puerto Rico, I might stay elsewhere unless you rent a car. This is an amazing resort that will get it completely right soon; the staff is very friendly and wants to please. Even with the above, we'd go back because it is such a beautiful, luxurious, relaxing place worth a high price tag.

Reviews.Title: “We had a very nice time at St. Regis Bahia Beach”
Reviews.Author: TooFrequentTraveller
Reviews.Content: We went in between Christmas and NewYear's, several couples, with children of all ages (2-18). The stay was very nice, we enjoyed it; it was not perfect but a very good place. Did see some famous people as well. POSITIVE: - very expansive grounds, lots of space - relaxed - big rooms; nice amenities (we were in a Casa Atlantico - definitely the place to be - SandDollar beach - a bit further down, but very nice, no algae - we enjoyed the food at both Fern and Molasses (separate reviews) - the spa was very nice - but very expensive Issues: - as many reviewers pointed out: service has room to improve for sure - it's far out - either you stay there more of the time; or have a rental car if you want to get into San Juan or explore the island. Staying in the resort was just fine with us. - a number of apparent NewYorkers sitting/walking around the pool area on their cell phones, complaining about too many things while on vacation - the occupation of pool chairs should change; all chairs are taken, but rarely are more than 25 % ever occupied. Guests arrive early in the morning, mark chairs as theirs and then disappear. There should be a mechanism that chairs not used for 90 min should be freed up

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort and outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: simplecity
Reviews.Content: This resort is a gem. The grounds are gorgeous and the staff is very helpful and friendly. There are a few restaurants in the resort that are delicious, really enjoyed the brunch at Fern and dinner at Molasses. The room service is pretty good too. We were upgraded to a beach view suite for SPG status, even on a holiday weekend, this was a treat. The butler service with unlimited french press tea and coffee was a dream! A negative was the beach, because the water was very murky. This was due to recent hurricanes and the location of the beach because at the same time in San Juan, the water was blue and swim-able. Also, be sure to make use of the resort amenities, like bike rentals and kayaks, as they are included in the resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Best in class service, breathtaking resort, and beautiful large rooms”
Reviews.Author: BDeen22
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week long stay at the resort. From the moment we got to the large stunning resort we truly felt taken care of. Here are brief breakdowns on our stay: Rooms / Bathroom: We had a suite in which there was a sitting area that connected to a room with a king size bed. The rooms were immaculately cleaned and they opened up to a very generously sized balcony. The sliding doors opened up and make the room even larger and also allowed us to view the gorgeous scenery. There was a table and couch outside that's perfect for reading a book and relaxing. The bathrooms are stunning! Not only are their TVs in the mirrors but the shower is literally the size of a small room. There is also a large soak tub by the shower. Food: I had read a previous post that said there wasn't a breakfast buffet but there was one when we stayed there at SeaGrapes. The buffet was good but the breakfast at Fern was absolutely amazing. Their french toast is literally the best I've ever had. The service was also top notch. We also had a great dinner at SeaGrapes (highly recommend the skirt steak) as well as a great Christmas meal at Molasses. Room service was good and was delivered in less than 30 min. Kids: When we got to our room there was a crib set up for our daughter which is something I requested before we checked in. Even though we were traveling with 2 small children we always felt like there were things for us to do. As previous people have mentioned the property is set on over 500 acres and you can get bikes from the boat house and enjoy the beautiful scenery. If your kids are to young to ride a bike they have attachments so that they can sit behind the bike. This was a great way for us to explore the whole resort. They also have a kids club called the Iguana Club. While my daughter was to young to stay by herself, we were allowed to use their facilities. They have a basketball court, play ground, video game room, craft room, movie room, and reading room. It was great!! I would 100% recommend this hotel/resort. I can't wait to spend time there again.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: eog424
Reviews.Content: I just arrived home from a weak of bliss at the st. regis. Our original expectations was a snobby expensive place with bad service. Our experience was not! Room: The trip was expensive, but worth every penny. We had a second floor garden suite, which was great. We loved the interior decor which was tasteful and sophisticated yet kid friendly and comfortable. The highlight of our room was the deck it was large with a couch and table that seats four. The bathroom (s) were clean and spacious-and one even included a t.v in the mirror. Service: Wow!!!!! not only was there an extreme population of staff but each and every one would do anything and more to make your stay incredible. I didn't come across one person who wasn't overly kind and enthusiastic. Food: The food was extremely expensive and not always worth it. Molasses is super expensive and not worth it at all. Skip molasses! Sea grapes was average and a great casual option with kids. Fern is worth every penny! The food is out of this world! Not a hotel restraunt at all! I would highly suggest going to fern more than once (or twice, or three times). If you are looking for a low key option try room service on you deck- it's awesome. Activities: golf,paddle boarding, kayaking, nature tours, sailing, biking, pool, beach, spa, fitness center,yoga. The possibilities are endless the concierge, (and everyone else) are great with helping you book and schedule. Off campus ideas are bioluminesent kayaking,hiking in the rainforest, and food tasting tours in san juan just to name a few. Property: The resort is smartly designed. The way the paths and layout is designed you feel as if you are the only guest. The pool area is great and the beach is nice- but not exactly white sand, calm blue waters. One complaint there is music playing everywhere, you walk through the rainforest, there is music you are relaxing at the pool, there is music. It ruins the serenity. All in all despite some negatives i would recommend the st. regis, just don't come on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Privileged luxury”
Reviews.Author: Mail4luis
Reviews.Content: Im presently staying in the governors house as its called. First, the people,staff, service are excellent. The food is seriously delicious and some plates like the mofongo and red snapper at molasses are transcendent. The bartender, Ricardo, is a riot and ambitious, he won't be shy about sharing his latest personal cocktail invention. The food is pricey, but this is not a place for budget conscious visitors. The quality of the meals and drinks and firendliness of the Staff are forgiving. The landscaping is gorgeous and the beach is so wide and magnificent, I almost feel guilty that more people aren't there to enjoy it. I invited family to enjoy the stay with us, and the hotel invited them to attend a traditional musical number simply because they were guests of mine. My baby was accommodated every step of the way, they provided a crib, stroller, and warm water for bottle feedings.

Reviews.Title: “Great escape, beautiful rooms, and top notch service”
Reviews.Author: TC4chow
Reviews.Content: This resort is so incredible! The rooms are very clean and comfortable. We stayed in a beachfront cabana, although the trees are preserved between the room and beach, but you can see the water through them. The bathrooms are HUGE and they provide plenty of towels. Butler and other services were superb. Food was tasty, although there are only a couple place to eat on the property. Transportation is VERY expensive, to / from airport, if you plan to leave the property, and hired cars (with driver) are pricey. It is best to pay the approximately $200 for their scheduled service and stay on the property. There is a great walk path through a sanctuary, gym is good, and pools nice. The beach is windy but we sat there each day anyway. Beach assistants quickly put up an umbrella and place your towels at the spot of your choice. It is a very nice escape in quiet luxury. It's a little like going to the country, but at the beach. Great for a romantic couple's get away. We will go again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, Gorgeous, Gorgeous!!!”
Reviews.Author: arp1997
Reviews.Content: I had the privilege of staying at the St. Regis in October for a girls getaway. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous! Service was impeccable and the pool area was fantastic. Our rooms were amazing! The beach was very private and a little small for my taste. The food was above average but very pricey. In addition, drinks at the pool were up to $18 for a frozen daiquiri. Despite the high prices (room, food, and drink), I plan to return!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew_Destin
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed in Sept 2011. SPG Gold ment an upgrade to a large suite. The grounds were unreal! Lush & well kept. Check in was a++. Our suite...was HUGE and perfect for a few days without the kids. Walk in rain shower, soaking tub, sept. beadroom, living room, huge balcony, etc... The butler service was a nice touch. The pool resturant service was spot on. In fact some of the best pool side lunch service we have ever had. Listen...this is an island and i normally expect "island time" service and was very pleased. Pool was also very nice. Only downside was the food prices. coffee service, irish cream, choc. martini...was say...around 55us. The food is excellent...just not cheap! Thanks, and hope this helps. Also...i really believe this is the best of Puerto Rico! Andrew

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the room you get”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: While the property is an amazing setting I probably would never stay there again . As you enter the gates of the property you think you are entering Jurassic Park . The vegetation is lush and green . A very beautiful setting . When I arrived at the main building ,and plantation house was truly am impressive setting . While I was staying on an an award stay I didn't think I would I would be given a room that was not habitable . We were shown our room and when I walked in the door There was an strong smell of must and mold . Not a healthy situation ..I had asked for an upgrade when I arrived , but was told there were none . We stayed in the room overnight but the stench did not disappear . The next morning I called the front desk and they sent a service person to come and see about the problem. he agreed there was a bad smell and would put a machine in the that would take out the odor . When I came back to the room in the afternoon ,the smell was still there . I called the front desk . They were not pleased that I was still upset about the smell . They would have to send the engineer back to check on the problem . When I met him at the door once again i asked if he could smell the musty smell ? He agreed he could . he said he would take care of the problem .It was amazing how they found us a suite ,when there were no upgrades available . I guess the hotel felt that because we were staying on an award they could just pawn off an inferior room , Somehow I expected much more from the St Regis . Later I found out from some of the staff that this has been a problem for the St Regis . What I guess I didn't appreciate was the fact that the front desk acted as if I was making this up . The hotel still has problems to work out . Plan not to stay in Room 811 .

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings Part 2”
Reviews.Author: jac31072
Reviews.Content: While I have no connection to the previous reviewer, I couldn't agree more about this property. My husband and I were celebrating our wedding anniversary and we chose the St. Regis because it looked amazing and *we had enough points to stay here for free for 4 nights*. This is key -had we paid to stay here I think we would have easily been taken for a ride and very disappointed. As others have pointed out, "Bahia Beach" is situated on what used to be a sugar plantation. It has tremendous acreage of lush green rain forest and it is very beautiful. There is a walking/jogging path, a boat house where you can rent paddle boats, kayaks, and bikes, an herb garden and access to a man made river which is not easy on the eyes. There is a spa which we did not use, a gym which we did, and it was decent, although out of 4 treadmills, only one was working. There are also a couple stationary bikes, elliptical machines, weights and a yoga studio. They have apples and waters available too. The pool area is definitely the highlight. It's shaped like an infinity and there is plenty of room to spread out on lounge chairs without feeling like you are on top of people. But the service was S-L-O-W and I do mean slow. This wasn't a huge issue for us, I mean we're on vacation, it's not like we were in some big hurry. But from the time we ordered lunch to the time it actually arrived over an hour went by. It was a grilled chicken sandwich by the way, and it was OK. They should do away with the cheezy muzak consistently pumped in from speakers located in the foliage. I think most guests could do without it. If the beach is your thing: go somewhere else. Again, as others have laid it out, (and you can see in the photos) due to the runoff, the ocean water is brown. It's clean and you can swim in it, but it is not very inviting. The sand, also brown. I should mention that we rented a car (which I highly recommend if it's your first time in PR) so we were at the very least able to drive to other beaches (Fajardo, Punta Tuna, Punta Guilarte Beach in Arroyo) which were lovely. Day 1: (It's a 25 minute ride from SJU to Rio Grande via Route 3) When we arrived the staff were quick to welcome and greet us. Our experience with the staff was very positive. They were friendly and helpful, although as other reviewers mentioned, service can be slow. Upon check-in we were led to the main plantation house and told that someone would be right with us. Of course, a half hour and 2 pineapple mojitos later we had to flag someone down to check us in. It seemed like they forgot about us. It took about 20 mins to check-in, which I think is a little much. We had Casa Santuario 612 which is close to the plantation house and pool, so we were able to walk rather than be whisked around in the golf carts. When you walk in to the "casa" it's actually a suite, so you step into a large shared vestibule, as there is another room across from yours. Our neighbor across the way must have played golf each day because like clockwork 3 days in a row the loud slamming of the door woke us up at 6:30 in the morning. 612 is a decent room, 2 double beds, large entryway with bar area (which we thought was a total waste of space as there is no seating area), closet, HUGE bathroom with huge shower area, soaking tub, two sinks, and separate small room with toilet. There is a desk with a chair and sliding glass doors that go out to a small patio overlooking the garden. They did bring us a bottle of champagne for our anniversary which was definitely a nice touch, but I will say that we have had better "nice touches" at other Starwood properties. That night we ate at Fern and our experience was a good one. We sat outside on the porch overlooking the ocean, the service was very good and our food (steak and grouper) was tasty. We also ate breakfast there one morning. The French Toast was delicious, the eggs were also very good and we had a fruit bowl of pineapple, kiwi, and strawberries which was excellent. Day 2: Weather terrible. Pouring rain so we decided to drive south. It was sunny on the carribbean side of the island so we stayed there all day. Went to Fajardo where the ports are and Punta Guilarte Beach which was beautiful. It's about an hour and half drive. Stunning. Water was lovely. We ate on the road in Ponce. Road side kiosk. Food was cheap and delicious. It was nice to get out and explore. Day 3: More rain. Went to Old San Juan. Ate at Metropol in San Juan. Food was delicious (get the stuffed cornish hen). Marmalade in Old San Juan is also an excellent choice for dinner. Day 4: Still cloudy and rainy. Walked around the property. Had room service. Food was very good. As far as the prices, depending on your expectations, everything is available on the property if you don't feel like exploring, and so you will pay for that. 2 pineapple mojitos, 30 bucks. Dinner At Fern: $150 for two entrees, two glasses of wine. I am ashamed to admit that we paid 3 bucks for a banana the morning we left. No matter how much money you have, how do you justify that? Room service also ran us over 60 bucks for 2 burgers and 2 ginger ales. You can go to the large chain grocery store, Ralph's on Route 3 and stock up if you don't want to pay the resort prices, as there are refrigerators in the rooms. Having a car was great and allowed us to explore and escape crummy weather, but it's 22 bucks a day to park at the St. Regis. We did sign up for snorkeling and the Bio Bay Tour, but each day they were cancelled due to the inclement weather. I doubt we would stay at this property again. It was very beautiful, but I can't say it was exceptional. My overall perception is if you paid $800 and over to stay here, sadly you paid too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Average Service”
Reviews.Author: arthursiew
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis Bahia Beach Resort is a very large resort that was beautiful. It was so large that a golf cart is necessary to get from one place to another. We were upgraded to the St. Regis Suite and the room was very spacious and comfortable. The view was decent due to the brown watered ocean in front of us but the trees and greenery helped solve the average ocean view. The resort fee is pretty expensive ($60/night) and I'm disappointed that the parking is not included ($22/night). However, the boat house was included and featured kayaks, bodyboards, and so on. The pool was good too. The main problem with the resort is service. The service was great but it was the speed that was disappointing. I did not experience one hour wait times but it took far too long for a resort of this class. We called for someone to pick us up from our room to the Plantation House and it took twenty minutes one time. Just be sure to call in advance to get your golf cart if your room is not too close to the lobby. Overall, our stay was very good. Although the service definitely needs work, if you can look past that... I believe your stay will be equally as great as mine.

Reviews.Title: “Big price tag lacking memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: Gmichael315
Reviews.Content: I must admit, I did not pay $800/night to stay here. I used starwood free night awards, but if I had paid I would've been extremely disappointed. The property is gorgeous in a jungle like setting with a beautiful pool and rooms. However, you can find something similar for $300-$400/night. For the extra $400/night I was expecting stellar service, which wasn't there. Yes, everyone was extremely friendly, but I found myself waiting 40 minutes for toothpaste to be delivered to the room. Other times there was no one to assist when we needed pool yowl service. The resort boasted butler service, but when we requested our patio candles to be lit, no one showed. Are these major issues? Of course not. But for the pricey you'd expect something closer to perfect. Even at the advertised champagne sabering event they didn't even give us a drop of a drink for free. Overall a lovely setting but nothing memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Epicurean40
Reviews.Content: The resort is in on a beautiful setting, and the rooms are quite spacious and luxurious. The pool is very large and had shady spots, which was appreciated. However, the restaurant selection is poor. Yes, there is a Jean Georges restaurant onsite, but it is the only breakfast option, and our dinner there was disappointing. There are other restaurants but they have odd times, and we felt very limited, to say the least about our choices. The staff was warm, friendly and perfectly happy to help you with any request you had, but it just took a while. This is true for the food and beverage service at the pool. Placing an order often resulted in a wait. We would return but found it to be too overpriced. Yes, it very well may be the largest and most beautiful, but it is also secluded and costly. I recommend you see it once and feel you may share my opinion. We split our time between this hotel and the Ritz Carlton in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort Vacation”
Reviews.Author: keSabes
Reviews.Content: My family an I recently stayed at the St. Regis Bahia Beach just before the Christmas Holidays, and had a WONDERFUL stay. The property is brand new and absolutely beautiful. The rooms are HUGE! We had a king sized garden room and it was like a miniature suite. The restaurants on property were wonderful, Molasses standing out the most. We had dinner there three nights in a row. If you're looking for a relaxing, beachside, resort vacation, you cannot stay anywhere else than the St. Regis. The combination of the staff, the property, and the environment made this one of the most memorable vacations I've ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Five star facility, horrid service”
Reviews.Author: gwhite216
Reviews.Content: We are here now and unfortunately underwhelmed. The resort is beautiful but service has been horrid. Check in was smooth and we waited at lunch for the rooms to be cleaned. Lunch had mixed reviews as I thought my mahi sandwich was delicious yet my wife thought her chicken was lacking. As we got to our rooms they were very nice standard rooms. There were a few small problems as one of the sinks did not drain and the mixing valve in the shower was broken (could not control hot and cold water, either scalding or freezing). My wife noticed housekeeping did not give us shampoo and I called to request. It took over an hour for shampoo to arrive. As I was in the shower someone came and gave my wife 2 bottles of water. They did not ask if we would like turn down just handed her water and left. We had a 7:00 reservation at fern and before we were seated I told Daniel at the front desk about the problems and he said engineering would take care of the bathroom and housekeeping will turndown the room while we dine. Fern was average. Appetizers were good but entrees were not to par other than the veal Milanese. The Parmesan crusted chicken was greasy and dry (contradicting but true). Desert was good although the meal for 4 without wine was not worth the $360 price. I highly suggest bring nice wine from home. Wine list is extremely expensive and not very good (6 times retail on some bottles). Grocery stores on the island do not have much selection. Joseph Phelps Cabernet and Don Melchor Cabernet were the best selections at Ralph's. When we returned from dinner, no one had done anything with the room. I called down and the front desk said housekeeping would be right up(9:30 pm). We decided to go next door and have a bottle of wine with friends. At 11:00 we went back to the room and nothing had been done. I phoned down again and was apologized to and offered breakfast. I explained I do not want gratis, I want service indicative of St. Regis standards. This morning we woke up without towels, a shower that is still broken, and a sink that won't drain. Management is supposed to do something but they are fully committed. I hope this vacay get better fast! Day 2.... I woke up with a new day attitude and it was quickly spoiled. As we went to meet our friends for coffee at 10:15 in the plantation house. I was told the coffee was gone but I could have decaf or hot water. I asked if there is any place I could buy a cup. She insisted on the prior options 3 times until "giving in" and going upstairs to get a cup. Let me remind you I asked to buy a cup. I sat down with David, a manager and told him that Vanessa said he would contact me in the morning. I explained the loose ends from the night before and he told me everything would taken care of and told me he would call to follow up. I am still waiting on a call. The sink was taken care of but I think the shower valve needs to be replaced. We ate at molasses for dinner and it was good. I would suggest the steak or pork chop and dessert is a must. Today is sunny, so we had plans for the pool. We ate breakfast at fern and were again disappointed. They forgot a smoothie and another entree was prepared incorrectly. I think the new management needs to focus on service and clean house. We are at the pool now and it is beautiful! Probably one of the better resort pools I have been to. Still have not seen our "signature butler" but fingers are crossed.... To be continued.... In conclusion, check your expectations at the gate. Until changes are made you will be disappointed. This is a beautiful facility, but the service is not to par with a 3 star Mexican all-inclusive. Molasses is very good. Eat there and you will not be disappointed. Fern is underwhelming and frankly bad. There are not any breakfast option worth patronizing. The pool is great! The rooms are very nice. The beach is brown sand but secluded. The water is not the blue-green most expect in the Caribbean, but nice. The weather can be temperamental. All this said, service will make this your only trip here. Unfortunately a great resort was built without the staff to back it up.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a perfect setting!”
Reviews.Author: ABinChicago
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very tranquil and the rooms are spacious and quiet. The restaurants and in room dining are very reasonably priced and the food is fantastic. The hotel has wonderful amenities and a pristine, very private beach.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: adair578
Reviews.Content: A group of four of us (two couples) were only able to spend one night here due to late booking and an event taking place at the hotel, but we were so glad we came. The St. Regis was amazing! The staff was friendly and attentive, the rooms were clean and well appointed, and we loved the beach and pool. The food was overpriced, but we were expecting that and planned ahead so that we only ended up eating one meal at the hotel. I will definitely return to the St. Regis on my next trip to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: Ninjareview
Reviews.Content: Stayed here using points. Wife loved the hotel and thought it was one of the best hotels we have seen. Beac is private and service was great with food served (favorite was Mahi Mahi sandwich) Rooms were nice and modern with easy access to beach. Golf carts zip you around the hotel. Loved the bathroom mirrors that had tv embedded. Drinks can be pricey along with food but quality and taste were great. Loved the boat house where you can kayak and sail. Overall great time and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a Place!”
Reviews.Author: CASE-JC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best resort on the island. It is very reminiscent of the top resorts in Hawaii. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: phoebebobo
Reviews.Content: Among all the starwood category 6/7 hotels we have stayed, this one is by far the best. We LOVED it. We enjoyed the large and beautiful landscaping (I usually do not care about the landscaping in hotels, but this one is totally amazing.), the mini tour with their in-house marine biologiest helped us to see/understasnd lots of wonderful plants and animals in the resort. We even did several hours of biking along the beach, golf course, tennis court, lake, bird sanctuary and in between the palm trees. We also enjoyed the kayaking and standup paddling on the lake. and played tennis too. The rooms and lobby are sooo elegant (and again, I usually do not care too much about the decor and room setting/furnitures in a hotel, but this one totally made us feeling at home, an elegant home), we had a suite that can see the beach from bed. The bathroom is huge -double shower/rain shower and soaking tub. And there is a TV IN THE VANITY MIRROR (wow). The three layer pool is cool but I like the pool set-up in W @ vieques a little better. The beach has fine sand and relatively calm water, so that's a LOT better than the W. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Service was superb. It was truly wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent St. Regis Stay”
Reviews.Author: AF4ch
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at this beautiful resort. The property was absolutely huge -- spanning approximately 500 acres with the sister condos and such, and yet felt like a small boutique personalized 5 star hotel. Everything was first rate and I'd highly recommend -- although I'd caution I went on SPG points and do not know how much of a premium I would pay in cash versus another luxury hotel. I knew being a brand new resort it would be absolutely beautiful and it was. But I was most concerned with previous posts about bad service, and I have no idea what reviewers are talking about. We have stayed at St. Regises, Four Seasons, Ritz Carltons and others around the world, and the service, effort and attitude of the staff was really second to none. Food came quickly. Drinks came quickly. Rooms were always made up promprlt. Requests answers quickly. Doors were opened. Smiles were always there. Hellos were said. Except for one silly incident, the service was pristine. By far the best feature of the facilities was that everything was of course very well thought out as it was brand new. The pool had all different levels and mini enclaves, so that no one was on top of each other and everyone had their own "view". The rooms were all separated into 7-9 different villas (or casas), each of which held no more than 6 rooms per floor, each with private double door entryways. Everything felt like it was your own personal resort. If I could point out a few CONS just in the interest of full disclousre: 1) The property is really really large. So large that you'll be taking golf carts to dinner if you're going to the secondary restaurant Molasses. Or if you're going to the Boat House to gets bikes or boats, etc. This of course adds to the beauty of the place as it's expansive and beautiful - but at some point gets a little bit annoying. Like if you want to rent a bike, it's a whole production to get the golf cart, etc.. Or you can walk 15 minutes, which again, is no problem and beautiful, but obviously wastes a bit of time and energy. 2) My one silly service incident: we left some stuff (bottle of sunscreen, magazine) on our pool chairs to take a little walk and then a torrential downpour came while we were gone from the area. We expected, maybe, that pool staff would quickly collect all towels so they didn't have a disaster on their hands and our stuff would either be sitting their in the rain or be collected. When we made it back to the pool after the rain died down, our suscnreen and magazine were gone, and not with the pool staff, and the pool staff looked at me like I was absolutely crazy for asking or suggesting they knew where it was. I half expected in the ensuing chaos of collecting 200 towels in a downpour that they might misplace one or two things -- BUT I did not like their attitude in this one instance. They pretended to have no idea what I was talking about, as if it was impossible that any hotel guest brought a personal item to the pool. They acted similarly ridiculous to a little girl who lost her pool goggles, and had an attitude to her as well. Just confess or apologize that you were moving quickly and couldn't catolog everyone's belongings in a monsoon -- but please don't look at me like I'm crazy for asking where my stuff is. This was literally the only example of poor service on the whole trip, and obviously a case of people not wanting to admit they had done something very stupid. A secondary point on this incident is there were other times during very sunny weather where pool staff seemed awfully quick to get rid of people's towels, pull down umbrellas, even if they had just walked away for a minute to go to the bathroom, etc.. It was if they were waiting for guest to leave so they could go home. 3) I don't have a good solution for this, but it was slightly annoying that there was no breakfast buffet, even if they were to charge a ridiculous premium. We're personally not breakfast people so to endure the formality of ordering in a very formal restaurant and waiting 15-20 minutes for food is a waste of time to me when I want to start my pool day, particularly with the very expensive prices. But I understand how buffets can become less elegant and/or inefficient for a fine hotel like this, so not the biggest deal. 4) Lastly, turndown service: The great hotels of the world need to declare a new system for this. We have found no matter what fine hotel we're staying in turndown service is erratic and haphazard. In some cases (not here), it never happens or happens 50% of the nights, as if the hotel has no way to monitor who is being serviced. In others, they show up at your door at 4pm for evening turndown service and ask to make the room, even though it's not nearly evening and of no use at that time and then seem to have an attitude when you ask them to come back. It basically then becomes a negotiation, which is not the service I'd expect. Here, I'd say they were reasonably good compared to the bad actors and definitely came each night, but they did show up at the door at 5:30-6pm each night. This isn't terrible - but if hotel restaurants don't open until 6pm, then in most cases people haven't started their night out and are likely not out of their rooms for the night at 5:30pm. And we've found to ask them to leave and come back is something of a game of chance. Just a pet peeve, but it's been so consistent that hotels need to rethink the process. That's really it. Loved the trip. Have wonderful things to say. Although if I was paying $1,000 cash a night, I'm not sure how happy I'd actually be. On points, the price was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Mini Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Quacks55
Reviews.Content: We just returned home last evening after a very brief, four day stay at the St. Regis. After reading some of the recent posts prior to our trip, I wasn't so sure I wanted to go. Now I'm questioning if we were at the same hotel as those people??? This property and employee attentiveness was near perfect. This place is an easy 25 minute drive from the airport, but having a car is almost a requirement. As soon as we pulled into the main entrance, we were greeting like old friends and we didn't have to touch anything. Since we got to the hotel very early (and during Thanksgiving weekend) the place was busy and our room wasn't ready. No worries, we changed and went to the pool for the day. They called and said our room was ready at about 3:00 and when we were ready, we were taken to our room by a very welcoming and informative employee named Christopher. The room was beautiful, quiet, great balcony, comfortable bed and pillows. I overheard several guests attempting to secure upgraded rooms. I don't know why people were obsessed about this. The "standard" rooms here are 100% nicer than any room an most people's homes. I'm a platinum member also, but my standard room was better than most of the hotel rooms I've EVER stayed in - and I'm sure these people also. For dinner we went to the Kiosks at Loquillo down the road about ten minutes. Average food but fun atmosphere. Back to the hotel for drinks at the bar. Alsmost empty in the evening despite the full occupancy rate. This property is gorgeous. Everything is manicured beuatifully, and despite prior comments, the beach is raked every morning. Sorry people, but this is an island in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean. Stuff washes ashore. Remember Tom Hanks in castaway?? It's not trash, it's ocean debris and they clean it up daily. And sometimes, stupid people on boats throw their water bottles overboard. It was very busy through Saturday night. I didn't care for all of the kids (and their parents) yelling from the pool. I do think young kids should have their own pool area. There were obviously a lot of familes going home on Sunday, because it became much quieter. Monday and Tuesday it was very quiet - fantastic for us. Only one negative comment from me and it is by no means a deal breaker. Food and drink is outrageously expensive - other worldly expensive! As previous posters suggested, go to Ralphs (a very large, bright supermarket) near the hotel and stock up on sodas, chips, whatever floats your boat. Every time you order two Bloody Mary's by the pool it will set you back $33.00. Lunch - almost every item on the menu was near $20.00. That said, the food is quite good. Free coffee from 7:00am at the main house every morning and it's a great place to sit outside and watch the ocean. Leaving yeaterday was sad, but Rafael did all the work. Couldn't have been nicer!! Thanks you all. We look forward to our next trip to Bahia Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, and better than expected”
Reviews.Author: susan robin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Thanksgiving weekend and were pleasantly surprised after seeking decidedly mixed reviews of this place. Our room was quite nice, bathroom luxurious. Our "garden view" room was not much of a view, but we did not really care. Golf course and service there was outstanding, course not crowded at all --- the unlimited golf package is an excellent deal. The staff was wonderful, made an effort to know and remember names of guests. The pool and beach area are large enough so that we (traveling with no children) did not feel as if we were being overrun by the 10 and under set. All three restaurants were quite good, prices in line with a typical 5 star property. This New Yorker was appalled by the exorbitant prices on the spa menu and therefore did not indulge. There have been some complaints on this site about drink prices but they may have changed, most cocktails we ordered were around $14 or $15, which was not out of the ordinary. Housekeeping seemed to have been a bit overwhelmed, there were two days when our room was not made up till after 4 pm, plus minor things like no replacement shampoo, body lotion first appearing on day 3 of our stay, but I am sure these items would have been brought to us had we asked. This is a large (but not overcrowded) property, as mentioned by other reviewers, you are best off requesting rooms near the main house in order to not have to wait for a shuttle to pick you up.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property, great people.”
Reviews.Author: DCHOTELGUY01
Reviews.Content: This is a amazing property and the people that work there are very kind and helpful, however there are some small issues with the service offering. My wife and I went here for three nights in mid November. We were staying on Starwood "Stay three, get away free" promotion. We paid a fee to be upgraded to a suite with a ocean view instead of a standard room. The check in was slow but we didn't mind since they were serving a rum punch, but the suite was not ready when we were taken there by golf cart. We got a $60 credit per night on our account for this inconvenience which was nice. The food at both Fern and Seagrapes was very good, expensive, but good. Try the french toast at Fern, and the beet salad. Yes, beet salad. The beach was very clean, and was raked by tractor or by hand almost every day. It was nice to take a long walk in either direction each day. We found small shells and sand dollars, especially to the east. I swam in the ocean and found it warm and refreshing. The pool area was well kept, and the service there excellent including the frozen grapes, a treat. Although the resort was almost at capacity, it was never crowed feeling. There were very few families or kids. They offer bocce and croquet. The trails on the property were very well taken care of and relaxing to walk. The landscaping was wonderful. The bellmen were great. Rafael was especially terrific, always there to assist with the bags on arrival, to chat when we saw him on the grounds, and make recommendations when needed. However, there is room for improvement- Housekeeping was minimal spending only minutes in the room cleaning one day, and they left the vacuum cart with sheets and towels outside our door several days. Curious. They even entered our room when we had the do not disturb sign on. Not good. They were pressuring washing the pool one morning at 11AM, but finished quickly. It was also annoying that they took the coffee away of the common area at 10AM each day. I would like to see it offered later, perhaps 11AM. One day I just missed it, and I was not able to get a cup, and had to pay $6 for it. :( I think with a bit of training, and help they can get 100% on track with service. They seem to read the reviews, and attempt to make changes for the better. Take time to go to La Parrillo at the kiosks at Luquillo. The food is good, and service excellent. Also go into the town, and see the red sand beach and surfers. For transportation to the resort from the airport we used shuttlevanpr.com. Hit their web site, or e-mail them. More economical than the hotel. It is $85 one way for two. Another great option is Shawn at Luquillo Taxi - --. He took us to Luguillo and back in his Chrysler 300! He also does airport runs, rain forrest and other places. Nice guy. Take a day to visit Old San Juan. Remember PR takes the USD, and all the electric is the same. We did not golf, play tennis, or use the kayak or bikes, but all these areas looked great. A really nice property with a lot to offer. All and all we have a very relaxing stay, and we a bit of training for house keeping this should be a true 5 star resort!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful place but blah garden room”
Reviews.Author: Paula D
Reviews.Content: Service is outstanding but rooms lack detail. Being a platinum member I am spoiler and used to getting fantastic rooms. Not here. Ground floor garden room doesn't make me happy about celebrating here. New property should not have worn carpet and soiled upholstery. Great bathroom but perhaps some of the space should be used to provide seating area big enough for two people. In sumaary lots of bells and whistles but little things are missed.)

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad.....”
Reviews.Author: firstclass-TRIP
Reviews.Content: We were a family of four, two adults and two teenagers. I am a platinum member and travel extensively for business and pleasure. We have stayed at St. Regis properties and expect a high level of service. For the positive, the resort built into the rainforest is absolutely stunning and huge, over 415 acres. Golf carts take you around the property and property is Eco friendly. Rooms are beautiful and large. We had a standard room which is large and had a beautiful terrace. The bathroom is one of the nicest I have ever seen. Large sunken tub with two shower heads, really spectacular. The girls had a suite because there was an electrical issue in room and it was dangerous. Suite was very nice with two bathrooms and living room. Really unnecessary for us but the girls loved the room. Carl, the tennis pro was fantastic and enjoyed his clinics and one on one time with him. The spa is lovely and has plenty of water all around. A complimentary glass of champagne is given. Prices are what you would expect at a resort and extras are given with massage at no charge, such as paraffin and hot stones. The boathouse offers kayaks, boards and bikes included in 60 per day resort fee. We also took a complimentary nature tour with a marine biologist that was interesting. Food is of high quality at the three restaurants. The concierge, Josell was very good and was a clef concierge. He went out of his way to make our stay enjoyable Now for the bad.....When checked in asked for upgrade and was told that they were full. Went to starwood web site and suites were available. Just be truthful that you do not want to give an upgrade. There are only three restaurants on resort with 138 rooms. Breakfast was painfully slow. Over 1 hr today and still no food. We ended up walking out. Service at sea grapes was poor first day but increasingly improved. Am used to paying high prices at a resort but sone things are just a rip off-165 one way car service from airport (paid 65 with Shawn-see review under luquillo), and 10 a glass for iced teas with no refills. Everything just seemed like an argument at hotel. Housekeeper didn't make up room one day. It is obvious that St. Regis mgmt is not here. When asked to speak to GM, was told that need to make an appt. Evidently, mgmt does not care about it's loyal guests. Check cashing was a nightmare. No one seems to know what to do here. Staff is lovely but with No direction. This property has been opened a year, so there should be no excuses. This property based on service is not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: tromano17
Reviews.Content: We had read the reviews and were worried however we had nothing worth complaining about the entire stay. The price is really not crazy. We have gone to many all-inclusive type places around the carribean and price with air was in line. The biggest difference was we felt safer than say Jamaica or Bahamas and the workers were nicer...and meant it. Property: The grounds are beautiful well maintained and very tropical. No complaints. Pool: Very nice well maintained pool. Athough we had a 5 year old (who is very well behaved) there were a few parents who were letting their kids run around too much. Parents have to keep in mind it is a quiet resort and people want to relax. If you cannot control your kids go somewhere else this is a quiet pool area. Beach: we watched it get raked every morning, we found it to be clean. we read reviews complaining about sea weed washing up...really?!?! It is a beach that happens. Rooms: We had an ocean front room that was large, CLEAN, and just perfect. Balcony was very large and perfect for winding down with some wine at the end of the day. Our air-conditioner was not cold enough however when I called the front desk they sent someone to fix it in 10 min. After that it worked great!! I cannot say enough how clean and comfortable the room was and the view was beautiful. Shower very large, hot water worked great, large walk-in closet etc. Restaurants: Seagrapes is perfect for lunch or early dinner and it would be great if it were open for dinner. it's proximity to the pool and ocean would add to the dining experience. The chef Richard at Seagrapes came out during our first day and first meal to ask us if everything was ok. When I mentioned to him I had Celiac and my daughter had a peanut allergy he seemed to not really pay attention. HOWEVER, the next day he found us at the pool and informed us he had purchased Gluten free Pasta...which he made for me with grilled veggies and chicken and he also bought chocolate brownie cookies for my daughter so she could enjoy a dessert. Thank you Richard you really helped make our vacation perfect! Thelma and Pedro were also very attentive and excellent wait staff. Breakfast at Fern was very good, fresh well prepared food and excellent waitstaff. Mollasses: Excellent. We ate here two of the nights during our short visit. Mofongo was great and it is a must try! Service was also excellent. The first night we ate ate the bar and Ricky the bartender/waiter was so nice. He talked to us letting us know what he thought we would enjoy and even made a "special ingredient" mix for our daughter to put on her bread. He did it right in front of us and although it was only honey, butter and cinnamon my 5 year old daughter felt very important. Thank you Ricky! **The girl who seats guests at Molasses needs a lesson in politeness and should learn to smile but once you get past her Molasses is a nice dining experience. Prices: Our driver from the airport was nice enough to offer to stop at Ralph's super market on the way into the resort. It is a big very clean super market just like the U.S. that has alcohol. We bought 5 bottles of wine and a bottle of rum and pineapple juice and a thermos to bring it to the pool. We also bought snacks for our daughter and cheese for us to snack on. It was a good move and saved us some money. It was also nice to have cheese and wine on the balcony at night. We bought some breakfast stuff which was also nice to eat on the balcony in the morning. Make sure you make it down for the free coffee in the Plantation house in the morning it is good and will also save a few bucks. **The best thing we did was get our daughter the $25 a day food pass. she was able to eat whatever she wanted, whenever she wanted from the nice kids menu they had at each restaurant or by the pool. It has the usual kids menu stuff such as big grilled cheese sanwiches with fries, burgers, pizza, macaroni with butter, REAL mac and cheese, etc. Staff who pick up in golf carts are very nice and friendly and do a great job. Overall: great time, great weather, and would def go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property / Poor Service!”
Reviews.Author: stonebridge2010
Reviews.Content: We arrived to a great welcome. No less than five staff members assisted us upon arrival. Unfortunately, that is where the service ended. Pre Booking Form : I highly recommend filling this out before you arrive. In order to get the dinner, spa, tennis, or golf reservations you want you must fill the request form out. Confirm the hotel received the form. We had to send it twice. Pool : Took forever to get drinks or food at the pool. Food : All three restaurants were great. We have no complaints. We highly recommend all of them. Service was good at both Fern and Molasses! House Keeping : One word "sucked!". They did not replace any glass wear during our visit. Dishes sat in the hallway for 3 days, 5 requests to pick up made. Toliet Paper holder broke the first day and they did not fix. HOT WATER WENT OUT FOR 48 HOURS. WE HAD TO COMPLAIN ABOUT NOT HAVING HOT WATER BEFORE THEY WOULD ADMIT THERE WAS AN ISSUE!!!! I will give the resort another chance. To be honest, if you are looking for a 5 Star resort go to Ritz in Caymen. St. Regis has a long way to go to achieve 5 Star status in PR.

Reviews.Title: “A+ Property, B+ Attention to Detail”
Reviews.Author: va1174
Reviews.Content: Made my second visit to this property last week. It is in a beautiful and serene setting and the architecture is a perfect fit for the location. Thanks to way too many nights on the road this year, was upgraded to a suite which was beautifully designed and appointed. The patio opened straight out onto the beach which was a real treat. As much as I enjoyed being there, I was disappointed that the attention to detail that had made the first visit to the property so impressive was missing on this visit. The room had an HVAC problem to the point where there was mildew growing on the lampshades in the bedroom. In fairness to staff, i didn't realize or report this until the day of check out otherwise, I am certain it would have been repaired immediately. That said, a few more minor issues: the wrong room number on the patio entrance, the front door to the villa wouldn't close without a fight. Again, very minor, but given the rack rate for the room and the St. Regis reputation for service, I would have expected these issues to have been discovered and corrected long before a guest encountered them. Also a bit of a disappointment, the little touches that I remembered fondly from the first trip - arrival mojito prepared by butler, small keepsake tile at turndown service, etc were absent this visit. Don't get me wrong, it is an amazing property with a friendly and helpful staff. In fact, it's already so close to being perfect on facility and location alone, I would just love to see them take it that last little bit to be truly spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, but average service”
Reviews.Author: cheetah72
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the St. Regis. We have been to Puerto Rico many times, but this was our first stay at this property. We have stayed at other St. Regis properties and other 5 star hotels so we had certain expectations in mind. We book with SPG points. If I had paid the over $500. per night rate I may have been more disappointed. The grounds are beautiful and the room was probably one of the nicest that I have stayed in. We did have 2 maintanence issues. One (our door) was quickly addressed. The other, our balcony light was never fixed. The pool is nice and we enjoyed our time at the pool. The beach was not the best (a little dirty). Enjoyed outside dining venues and bars, but Mosquitos very bad, not sure if something could be done about this. My biggest complaint was service related. Let me preface with the service was not bad, just could have been a little better for the price. Check in was good, both bell service and desk. The bellman showed us to our room. My only complaint was that he never told us about the complimentary coffee and we paid over $15 for a pot of coffee the first morning. Service at the pool was good. Drinks and food expensive even for a resort, but that was expected. Bar and restaurant service was good. On a service related note I was sent pre- registration paperwork which was not on file when I checked in. Housekeeping was good. On the first night we received turn down service around 8:00. On the other nights they showed up around 6:00 while we were getting ready for dinner, so they just dropped off water and towels. Overall it is a nice property, but just a little more attention to the details would make it great and worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “classy”
