Reviews.Author: family-relaxing
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. Entering the hotel through the big wood gates, you feel like entering a lush/ green rain forest. during the day you can hear the different birds, and see the iguana's pass. at night the coqui frogs sing and sing. We spent our days by the pool and beach, lots of fun for the kids to boogie board and swim in the waves. The boathouse offerd kayaking, sailing fishing, paddle boarding, bike riding and much more. At the pool restaurant they serve a great pizza and fish sandwich and an awesome chocolate mouse. dinner we had at Molases (local food) and the restaurant in the plantation house (a mixture ).... Great food and service at both places. The rooms are nice and spacious, mirror tv in the batroom big hit with the kids, big bathroom and tub, walk inn closet with tons of space. The hotel is not for your average Hyatt, Mariott..... etc. people.. It has true class with excellent service mixed with caribbean flair. Don't expect pool games,bingo, loud music and everything you find in Miami South Beach. Every employee we saw would greet and ask if they could be of any asisstance, the butler in charge of the room would call and offer his services and would tell of any special activities. We would definitely go back when we have an opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Won't return”
Reviews.Author: LOGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a major disappointment. After seeing it on the " hot List" in a magazine and traveling all the way from the west coast I was left to wonder what the hype is all about. Yes- the suites are great. Spacious, comfortable, well appointed. beyond that- it's awful. SERVICE- A major problem. No one has been trained. There are no standards followed. Every request is a crap shoot. Every encounter leads a different result. One employee good. the next horrible. From check in to check out no one knows your name or is attentive. Waited at restaurants for seating at open tables, never saw or heard from our " Butler" in the 4 days we were there. Never had a bucket of ice. We had to call housekeeping supervisor TWICE due to poorly serviced room. Bath tub was dirty. Vanity not cleaned. Bed made messily. Dishes not taken away from night before. Floor not mopped or vacumed. A Mop and vacuum sat outside our door for our entire stay! After pointing it out to supervisor, the mop was put away but the vacuum stayed outside. POOL/BEACH- The biggest disappointment of the trip. This property is DIRTY. GARBAGE on the beach and around the grounds. This is not rubbish and seaweed that has washed ashore. ( although there is that too). The garbage is from the hotel! Plastic cups, straws, paper napkins, bottle caps, a cloth tarp, soda bottles, cigarette butts all laying in the sand and grass of the hotel! Chairs at pool are mildewed from rain ( never covered). Chairs and umbrellas at beach are ratty and worn. Attendants are not trained- I had to ask for water and a menu every day. And then no one came back to get my order. Maintenance was pressure washing a full pool deck at 10 am- PRIME TIME for guests. We had a cabana one day- It took three requests to unlock our mini bar. Attendant made up chairs with towels that had HOLES. The photos make the ocean water and sand look very tropical. Water is murky, sand is brown. If you want beautiful beach- this is not the place. FOOD/BEVERAGE- Again, a disappointment. Three restaurants on property and all basically serving the same thing. The biggest joke is their golf course location called Mollases. It is billed as Cuban food but menu reads almost identical to Fern restaurant. There is one pulled pork entree that could pass as Cuban "inspired." Otherwise it is bistro fare served in a sports bar. TV 's are on but servers are dressed in suits. Tables are scattered with no flow or thoughtful placement. This is more event space for groups or a lounge for golfers - not a nice restaurant. Major identity crisis. Fern restaurant was OK. We sat outside on a full patio. Food was good. Server was obnoxious. He wanted to make sure we knew this was a Jean George restaurant and rambled on about all his other restaurants and how famous a chef he is. Menu was basic. Roasted Brocolini was burnt. Same exact chicken entree was served the next night at Mollases. Seagrapes by the pool was basic pool food. Burgers, pizzas, salads. Prices are ridiculous. $17 for a pina colada served in a cheap thin plastic disposable cup with a cherry. For those prices I want an acrylic tumbler and a wedge of pineapple at the very least. Husband is a diet coke drinker and refills were never offered. Getting water is a hassle. Had to ask for it at every location and it was never refilled. RESORT FEE- $60. THIS IS A CRIME! There is nothing included in this! Gym is small and unattended. Bottled water in room is never replenished. Morning coffee is not worth $ 60! Kayaks are a joke- they are located on a small " swamp" for your use. SPA- Small but nice. I had a massage. The therapist was professional and included nice extras such as hot stones and a scalp oil. Waiting area is nice and stocked with waters and teas and nibbles Again- poor service. Attendant asked if I would like my glass of champagne ( complimentary) before or after my treatment and then I never saw her again. Front desk attendant was more concerned that I was taking my tea mug and robe back to my room than asking if my experience was pleasurable. Reception Staff through out this property are simply not well trained. Overall- it was not an enjoyable trip. If I am going to travel 10 hours to a beach I will head to St. John.

Reviews.Title: “Our trip to paradise!”
Reviews.Author: smarin3
Reviews.Content: This resort is spectacular!! The grounds alone are just amazing - you feel as if you've stepped into a pristine and (mostly) private jungle. The staff are helpful, the rooms are spacious, the pool is huge and incredible, the beach is great and the plantation house (main building) is a perfect spot to drink coffee or cocktails and watch and listen to the waves crashing at the beach. At night you are treated to a chorus of coqui tree frogs and other insects singing you to sleep. Our stay at St. Regis was unlike any other hotel/resort experience we've ever had. We would highly recommend it. Things we loved: Exploring the grounds is a must! Walk around and see everything. If you stay only at the pool, you're really missing out. Rent some bikes from the boat house (included in resort fee) and check out the trails around the bird sanctuary. Try the stand up paddle boarding (again included) and watch the birds and turtles around and in the lake as you get a great workout. Sip the free coffee on the porch of the plantation house and soak in the views. Find an iguana. Use the boogie boards and take advantage of the huge Atlantic waves. Read a book at one of the many private secluded sitting areas around the resort. Walk the beach. Spend an exorbitant amount of time under the rain shower. Things we would have changed: We got lucky the first few nights with no one in our adjacent rooms. On the last night, a couple arrived and we could sadly hear a lot from our room - including a coughing fit at 6 in the morning. Wish the rooms were more sound proof! We loved walking the resort at night, but there were areas that could have used more lighting. Nothing drastic, but there were a few unlit spots that we would have loved to explore. We also would have loved to have more dining options on the resort. If you're there on a weekday (Mon-Thur) your dinner options are Fern and the bar. It would be nice to have some more casual dining places open all week for all meals. Tips: (1) Rent a car at the airport. Yes, you will pay a $22/day parking/valet fee, but we loved that we were able to leave the grounds at any point to explore the island. We went to El Yunque rainforest (a 10-15 minute drive) and went hiking. We ate at a beach side restaurant near Luquillo, PR. We went to Old San Juan one night and had a homestyle Puerto Rican dinner. (2) You can buy wine and other groceries at Ralph's grocery store (about 5 minutes from the resort), which is highly recommended. The rooms have a mini fridge so you can buy and store cold groceries and drinks. (3) As mentioned before, take advantage of the entire resort. (4) The ocean/beach at the resort is not good for snorkeling - know that you're not going to have the clear blue Caribbean sea - but you will have some amazing Atlantic waves (perfect for boogie boards!). (5) Be on island time. Everything in PR is more relaxed and "slower" than what we're used to in the DC area. Embrace it!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent!”
Reviews.Author: njhounds
Reviews.Content: From the moment you pass through the electric security gates, along the private drive, past lush vegetation, lakes, a golf course into the cobbled courtyard with it's koi fish pond, you know you have arrived at a very special place. The staff are friendly and welcoming. As you enter the lobby of the plantation house you feel as if you are in someone's private mansion. There is no front desk, but a room with elegant furniture, where they check you in and bring you a complimentary rum punch. You feel like a celebrity. They can't do enough for you. This trip was to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We booked five nights in the least expensive room, but it was luxurious. Lots of nice extras: flat screen TV, touch-pad by the bed to control the lights and air, a walk-in closet, a wet bar with fridge and granite counter, a very nice king bedroom with seating area, private terrace with nice padded furniture. The bathroom was huge! It had a walk-in shower with two shower heads and there was a TV hidden in the mirror. Instead of a "do not disturb" sign, you press a button for privacy. We watched the humming birds and lizards from our terrace overlooking the golf course and lake - very private and peaceful. It was a bit of a walk from our room to the pool and beach but we didn't mind. They'll pick you up in a golf cart if you ask. The pool is one of the nicest we've seen at any resort and the water temp was perfect. The property is gorgeous and they keep it spotless. The beach is very nice, but beware walking north there is a lot of broken glass. We found several sand dollars and some lovely shells. Beachside and poolside service is very good. They set up the chairs, towels and umbrellas for you. There's also a hot tub which was again, the perfect temperature. This is a place you can truly relax, unstress and be pampered. But of course, all this luxury comes at a price. It is very expensive to stay, eat and drink here. There are three restaurants: The main one (Fern) serves breakfast lunch and dinner. Breakfast will cost you about $40 each and it's all a la carte (no buffet here) an extra slice of toast is $5, an extra egg $8! The restaurant by the pool (Sea Grapes) only serves lunch and drinks. The third one (Molasses) is too far away to walk (take a golf cart) and beware of strange opening times- we never got to eat there because it is closed 3 days of the week. So we ate at Fern most nights, and the food is good but not excellent. Dinner for two will set you back at least $100. The service is outstanding. We loved the lunches at Sea Grapes, especially the brick oven thin crust pizzas with unusual toppings (try the one with figs and fontina cheese - so good) A cocktail or glass of wine will cost you about $16 and up. There is a spa and a fitness room and also a little boutique/gift shop and a car rental desk. The resort location is quite remote so unless you rent a car you'll have to take a cab to go anywhere. Cabs are a bit expensive. The nearest town is Rio Grande and there's really nothing there. We rented a car ($90 for a day) and drove to Luquillo, about 15 mins away. There are food kiosks along the beach there, serving local Puerto Rican dishes. A delicious lunch for two with beers was only $12! The next town is Fajardo where there's a lighthouse but you have to make an appointment to tour it. We didn't drive into San Juan because we've been there many times before but if you do, it will take about 30 minutes and the roads are mostly highway so it's no problem. There's not much nightlife at the St. Regis, so we drove to a nearby resort one evening for dinner (the Grand Melia) about 10 minutes away. It has a small casino and 3 restaurants but there was nothing much going on there either. We didn't really mind the lack of entertainment because the main purpose of our trip was to relax. We really enjoyed our stay at the St. Regis and we only had a couple of minor problems: (when you are paying this much to stay somewhere, you expect to find toilet paper in the ladies room)!! This was rectified quickly by an embarrassed member of staff. Checking out was a slow process (waited over 25 minutes for bell boy to pick up our bags, while our driver was waiting to take us to the airport). But again, that was only a minor annoyance. The St. Regis really does live up to it's five star rating. The service was first class and the resort is fabulous. If you want to splash out and treat yourself for a special occasion, this is definitely the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Will not be returning”
Reviews.Author: cbuzz
Reviews.Content: The property - simply breathtaking with the all the style and comfort that you would expect from the brand. The rooms are large and the bathrooms are truly amazing. We got ungraded to a suite upon check in which was a nice treat. Customer Service - non existent at best. The weekend was simply a comedy of errors. The staff were clueless about the hotel. I was always met with a "let me find out" and they would just disappear never to be seen again. We had reserved an ipad at the front desk. We were told it was actually reserved under our names this ipad never surfaced and noone ever bothered to contact us about it either. Always kept waiting by this hotel and the staff had no idea about what services are offered. Worst thing that happened on this trip was that our bed was infested with bed bugs. On the last day of the trip my friend and I had these weird itchy bites all over that were definitely not mosiquitos. This itching was so bad I went to the doctor when I got back to New York and it was confirmed. Upon complaining to the hotel management they refused to acknowledge that and they insisted that it was mosquitoes. On the last day, we also reserved a taxi to the hotel. The front desk forgot to reserve the taxi - my friend ended up missing her flight because of this. Even though it was their fault they charged her an extra night at the hotel. Ambiance - none. There is nothing to do in the evening at this hotel. Its pretty far removed from San Juan and at night this hotel is just boring boring boring. Food - average. I enjoyed a pancake breakfast one morning at Fern and a nice dinner at Molasses. Everything else I had was just okay - lunch selections were nothing special other than your typical burger, hot dogs, salads. I will never stay here again and I will make sure no one I know stays here either. I've stayed at other St. Regis and this place is not on par at all.

Reviews.Title: “wow!”
Reviews.Author: magua551
Reviews.Content: This place is truly spectacular. From the property to the staff to the golf course. It is located @ 30 minutes north east of San Juan close to El Yunce. As a result, the weather may be slightly unpredictable especially in the fall. However, the views are spectacular. There a some aspects of the resort that some may qualify as a limitation. To me they are few but I feel I must share them with anyone contimplating this resort for their stay. #1. It's expensive...from drinks, to food, to vip car service, golf, spa, etc. My response would be that you should alreday know that going in. #2. Places to eat are very limited on the resort. Basically two restaurants and one pool side "cafe" that is open from 11-5. They serve drinks and light lunch. No breakfast though which is a head scratcher. The main restaurant Fern was great. Food is of ther highest quality and its difficult to get a bad meal. You may get tired of eating dinner their every night and may want to get out into San Juan at least once or twice during your stay. The pool is so pretty and the service their is outstanding. The beach is ok. They have close to 2 and 1/2 miles of private beach but its the Atlantic side keep in mind. Blue crystal beaches you will find in the southern part of the island(facing the carribean). The rooms were truly outstanding. I must confess, I stayed in a lux suite so I would expect nothing less. Tv in the bathroom mirror(first I've seen of that one) but very cool. If you are venturing out to San Juan may I suggest the vip service. Its 65/hr and driver stays with you. They know all the short cuts, best local places to eat(Mojitos!!!! cant say enough) and can access all the vip parking at most historical sights. It may in the long run be more cost effective than renting a car. That is for you to decide. If you are going out to dinner in San Juan...try Marmalade....absolutely wondeful. would put it up there with any restaurant in any major us city. All in all. i enjoyed my stay and would go back. Its a different vacation though...one far removed from the hustle of San Juan. Better njoy the one your with???:)

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: katiekates
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was very nice. The pool was great. The beach is only okay. It is not like the pictures with crystal clear water. It is murky. Some of the staff were great, others were only okay. You have to go through concierge for ice. We called for ice. After 45 minutes no ice had arrived. The concierge called us and asked if the ice ever came and we said no. They said it would be right over and it never came. My husband eventually found an ice machine and we just got our own. We ran out of toilet paper and asked for more and it never arrived. Some days the room wasn't serviced before 4pm. Like other reviews say you have to valet and it is $22/day. The drinks are about $17. Virgin drinks are $8. Soft drinks and beer are $5. Most of the lunch entrees at the pool side restaurant (Sea grapes) are about $20. For room service breakfast pancakes are $20. The food is all good, not great. Entrees at the Fern are $30-$40. Again food is good, not great. I got a bad seat at the Fern as the a/c vent leaked on me several times. They do not have a coffee maker in the room, but you can walk to the plantation house (lobby area) and get free coffee at the St. Regis Bar. The hotel rooms have a mini fridge with alcohol, soft drinks and snacks. St. Regis says that they provide St. Regis water (as much as you want) for free, but the housekeeping never gave us any when they cleaned the room and when we called concierge for some, like with the ice, it never showed up. The fitness center is open 24/7. It has free water and apples. Every time I went it was empty. They have lots of cardio equipment and not very many weights. If you rent a car, there is a Ralph's grocery store about 5 minutes from the hotel which is a full grocery store. We ended up buying fruit and breakfast stuff there as well as snacks, which was great. The hotel had different activities throughout the week. A champagne sabeur with a free glass of champagne for everyone who attends one night, smores by the fire another night, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Beach”
Reviews.Author: Raymond Q
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful...if you want a hotel, pool, golf, spa. The beach is like dirt & was cleaned only one time in the 5 days we were there...ocean is murky & trashy from nearby river. Broken glass & trash on the beach...plus on our final day, Saturday, no one was even around for chairs & towels until 10a.m. Food is way over priced, $28 for coffee, juice, 2 eggs, very small fruit bowl & 1 piece of bread. Service was fair..took 45 minutes for our "butler" to find a cork screw. Additional $22 per day parking fee & $60 a day resort fee. Much nicer beaches in Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: SportsFreak30
Reviews.Content: New resort as of October 2011. Top notch customer service. Property manager should be careful, and special attention should be given to the pool. Places on the pool tile are accumulating dirt, and without detailed cleaning the pool will grow mold

Reviews.Title: “Cold water.”
Reviews.Author: vaporrub
Reviews.Content: This resort is as a resort should be spacious and peaceful and quite beautiful. The food is good as is the service. Why can't they heat the swimming pool. The ocean is too cold for swimming and so are the pools.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott impersonating a St Regis”
Reviews.Author: nycluxtravel
Reviews.Content: Probably decent hotel for a convention but in every respect not even close to a luxury beach resort

Reviews.Title: “SCABIES!!!! - DON'T RISK YOUR HEALTH!!!”
Reviews.Author: WHopperNyc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited this hotel with another couple to celebrate my birthday. This was our second visit to this hotel (we stayed last November when they first opened). When we were leaving after a 3 night stay, all three of my guests broke out in a rash. After visiting the doctor the next day when we arrived home in three different locations (Phoenix and Two places in Atlanta), all three of them were diagnosed with SCABIES!!! My wife is 5 months pregnant and I'm livid! I'm nervous about her health, the health of my unborn child, and the safety of future guests that will be visiting this hotel. Rashes and animals breeding under your skin aren't my idea of a Category 6 Luxury Hotel. By the way, I've been a PLATINUM SPG member for almost a decade and have stayed in over 100 Starwood properties around the globe. This is UNBELIEVABLE! DON'T risk your health!!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing vacation”
Reviews.Author: hc555
Reviews.Content: As you can see, the reviews for this hotel are varied, and this concerned us prior to booking our vacation. My wife and I are discerning travelers, and we travel infrequently, so researching a hotel and location takes quite a while -- despite mixed reviews, we chose the St. Regis Bahia Beach and are we glad we did! We spent 4 nights at the property, and had a wonderful, wonderful vacation. Upon arriving from the airport (I recommend toursanjuan,com) and pulling up to the luxurious grounds, we were very excited. Check in (with a rum punch) was smooth, and our room was ready in 15-20 minutes. We had a garden view room, right near the plantation house and the pool -- beautiful room with a foyer, bedroom, walk in closet, and amazing bathroom with a "rain shower". We loved the artwork, and the bed was very comfortable. Meals: Restaurants are somewhat limited, but the food is delicious (but priced like a resort). We had breakfast every day at Fern -- great food with a wonderful view of the ocean -- ask for Jay. We had lunch at the pool each day at Seagrapes -- great food and nice menu. Dinner we varied between Fern (priciest and special) and Molasses (at the pro shop -- a little cheaper but delicious). On our last night, we ventured into Loquillo to the kiosks and ate at #2 -- La Parilla -- a great taste of Puerto Rican cuisine. The Spa: Probably the nicest spa I have ever been too -- pricy, but fantastic. My wife and I had massages -- be sure to get there early to enjoy the relaxation area, outdoor showers, and saunas. Amazing. The Pool: Absolutely gorgeous, and where we spent most of our time -- a series of interconnected infinity-like pools with comfortable chairs -- pure relaxation. Only negative are the speakers that are hidden in the vegetation that play a loop of techno songs at moderately high volume -- my vote would be to get rid of the music! The Service: We had NO problems with the service -- everyone went out of their way to be friendly, and many learned our names by the end of the trip -- we had no problems in this area. The Property: Magnificent -- we took advantage of the walking trails each morning -- the more adventurous may choose to use the large lake (kayaks, etc.) or partake in the nature walks or beautiful golf course. The grounds are amazing. All in all, a wonderful long weekend and exactly what we expected and desired -- I recommend this property without reservation -- one of our best vacations ever.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Facility”
Reviews.Author: stephanie m
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is magnificent - the rooms are gorgeous, the beach is private, the grounds are lush, the restaurants are beautiful. The hotel itself blew me away - very romantic. The reason I haven't ranked it as a five is because the service wasn't fantastic. Granted, I went when it was a relatively new hotel, but given the price point, the kinks were inexcusable. Service people popped up in all the wrong places at the wrong times - and getting everything squared away was a challenge. Now, I don't mean to imply that the people weren't very nice - the issue was operational. Also, the food on site didn't blow me away either - and for the price, I expected excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property with great service and one small speed bump!”
Reviews.Author: holiday9554
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. The staff makes you feel special as you walk in the door. The entrance to the hotel tells you that you are going someplace very special. After we checked into our room, my daughter noticed there wasn't a coffee maker. She mentioned it to the gentlemen who took care of our bags and escorted us to our room. Ten minuites later it was brought to our room. The rooms are beautifuly decorated....with elegant detales. Huge bathroom fabulous shower. We had a lovely view of the ocean from our deck which included a comfortable couch for an afternoon rest The pool area is beautifuly manetained and staff ready for any request. I can not say enough about the staff every where at this hotel. Service..Service..Service at it's best. The food at all locations was terrific, a bit exspensive but again the service amazing!! There was only one waiter who was a bit difficult. We had made the mistake of thinking the tip was include on our dinner check. After dinner we went to the bar near the lobby for a late night drink. The waiter found us there and placed the check down on the bar demanding us to address the tip issue. Even the bartender was embarrassed by his behavior. His behavior was in such contrast to everyone else at the hotel we just let it go. We had such a fantastic experience and found the rooms and grounds so beautiful that our daughter is considering having her destination wedding there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Property... 4 (or Less) Star Service.”
Reviews.Author: FEOHIO
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a 5 day trip to Puerto Rico; we got to stay at this amazing property tucked away from everything, very quiet. A very relaxing trip that we both needed... My wife is a weekly business traveler and we both enjoy staying at better hotels and by our first day here this appeared to be one of them. We had been upgraded to a suite that had the best appointments in room ever, as you would expect with a SR. Resort staff was very friendly but I got the feeling they didn't appear to have service training, they were ok with kindness and the basics but didn't know how to predict needs. This prediction of needs I would only expect at a resort of this caliber, simple things like checking if we had enough water and ice since it was pretty hot there. The room was barley cleaned when we were there, one day I had to call three times to have it cleaned and then showed up at the front desk. They said they would take care of it and let the Manager knowâ€¦ By the time we got back the room appeared to have been turned down only but it was 8pm. I never heard back from any manager about the level of service and it occurred one other time on our last day there. Enough about the lower than expected service levels; we had a gorgeous pool, amazing RT Jones golf course, a couple great pounds / lakes to go kayaking. Oh if you go this did have one of the best spas my wife and I have been to (according to her, I donâ€™t frequent them as much)! The Food was top notch very good and if you left the property they had good recommendations as well... Bring cash as tipping is a must if you want good (to better) service.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Panoch1s
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 nite stay. Rooms are large and beautiful. The pool area is great. The beach was a little rough with lots of tree bark washing up. The staff is very friendly. The food is a little pricy eg. $20.00 Hamburgers. Overall the place is beautiful and well maintained. Xavier one of the vallets was very helpful with directions around the area.

Reviews.Title: “The vacation unlike any other!!!”
Reviews.Author: jloon321
Reviews.Content: I went to Puerto Rico not expecting much but ended up with more than you could ask for in a vacation!! Staying at the St. Regis is like staying in another world. The service was wonderful from the men at the plantation house there to greet you as u arrive(Angel in particular), to the people at the boat house who where more than accommodating. The boathouse being where we spent a good portion of our stay where they offer; boats, paddleboards, kayaks, fishing and bikes. Our family's favorite though would have to be our guided tours! We did both the kayak tour which was a hit with the kids and the nature one that the grandparents are still raving about. Guided by a young girl named Mara whom was very knowledgable about the autubon sanctuary located on the resort and happy to answer all the questions grandma had for her about the wildlife(Mara is in the family picture we took at the resort). The rest of the vacation was spent between the private beach and the beautiful pool where people are there to meet your every need imaginable. I would recommend for breakfast trying the place located above the plantation house, lunch at the poolside bar and dinner the restaurant at the clubhouse. All in all this was our most memorable vacation to date. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this to anyone and we'll most definitely be back for our next family vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location, Great Room, Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: GuavaMike
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the The St. Regis Bahia Beach Resort, in spite of their terrible service. The beach is wonderful, The beachfront room perfect (large and luxurious). The butler making mojitos is a great perk. However, getting anything out of the concierge or front desk staff is impossible. We tried to reserve a cabana on the beach but they weren't available. The next day, when seated on some beach chairs, we were told they were reserved for someone else but they would not help us with other chairs It took almost 2 hours to rent a car. They tried to overcharge us by 200%, gave us a car with the gas on empty, and when we got to the airport we discovered it was rented by someone else according to avis.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury oasis”
Reviews.Author: RHW1974
Reviews.Content: Stay there in October. Had wonderful one bedroom suite with luxury ammenities beautifully appointed. Everything excellent; very personalized and attentive service. Magnificient pool area with excellent pool side restaurant. Very clean and well maintained. The only area for improvement is the so-called gourmet restaurant "Fern" which is, at its best, a compilation of regular american cuisine combined with european touch and a wine list that does not complement the selection of dishes. Other than that, very recommendable! Need a rental car since the place is very remote.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING property, lacking in the service details.”
Reviews.Author: LCME
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were given a trip to the St. Regis for our honeymoon. (My mother paid for the room/resort fees and we took care of the rest. Thanks mom!) Due to her relationship with the hotel she was given 3 nights free with breakfast, and the last 4 nights she purchased. This will be relevant, VERY relevant, shortly.... TIPS: Definitely rent a car if you plan on going anywhere outside the property. It will save you a great deal of money and give you flexibility. Stop at Ralph's for room snacks and drinks to save time/money. Breakfast at "Fern" is lovely. Try the french toast!! YUM! Visit the rainforest (see and swim at La Mina Falls). Do a bio-bay kayak trip to see the glowing water! Old San Juan is fun for shopping during the day but everything closes at 6pm so go early. Stay for dinner at SigloXX or splurge at Marmalade (tasting menu was fantastic!) PROS: The property is gorgeous. Expansive and clean. We were nearly alone our entire stay, never encountering more than 15 other guests total the entire week. Breakfast at Fern was delicious every day. Free coffee is offered in the lobby/plantation house from 6-11am each day. (It's $6/cup in the restaurant). Spa is huge and a beautiful part of the property. CONS: Kids are everywhere. I do not know why they don't keep them in the "Iguana Club" area but the pool was often overrun with screaming, splashing, running children most days. Keep an eye on your account or you may find yourself with unexpected/unauthorized charges! Room service food was generally OK but nothing to write home about. We do not understand what the $60/day resort fee is for as it does not include valet parking, coffee, newspaper delivery or any other noticeable amenities. (Yes, I know you can use their kayak for free.. great.) - Day 1: The property is just stunning! Our car was taken to valet and we were escorted to the reception desk and given a nice fruit juice cocktail. The check-in was a little rocky. Included w/our gift was free breakfast the first three days. They had no record of it but thankfully we brought our certificate, signed by the hotel manager, and they took it to make a photocopy for their file. Also, we had reserved an ocean-view room (specifically made sure to book this as it was our honeymoon and we wanted to watch the sunset from our balcony) and were told they were sold out so we would be on the golf course instead. We were just going to accept it as we are fairly easy-going and not generally picky... then she showed us the map of the property. Ocean-view rooms are a short stroll to the lobby/beach/pool. Course-view rooms need to call for a golf cart to come get them to drive them everywhere they are so far off the path! I then asked for a manger who apologized and said they THOUGHT we would have PREFERRED the golf-course room even though we had specifically requested the ocean view (and confirmed it via both phone and email prior). He kindly restored us to our original room so all was well though the whole thing seemed unnecessary. Confident that all was settled, we were ready to go to our room- then they told us it would be about an hour until it was ready. They offered to put our luggage in storage and we were happy to take a walk around the property and grab a bite/drink at the Seabreeze restaurant. (Seabreeze was OK food for pool-side fare. Nothing amazing but generally tasty bar food). After an hour we went back to see if our room was ready- and saw our bags had been "stored" outside where we left them by the car. I was a bit miffed as I feared my makeup may have melted in the heat for so long. However, we let it roll off us. The room was very close by (thanks to our ocean-view push), clean and plenty big for the two of us. The showers/tubs are especially nice and the balcony a lovely touch. Day 2: Breakfast at Fern- the french toast was AMAZING! Breakfast there is slow and relaxing. (Try a spicy bloody mary). Sit outside for a lovely breeze and view of the ocean. Unfortunately, they did not have our comp breakfast in their system but we brought our certificate as we had feared that may be the case. They easily accepted our comp, we left cash tip of over 20%. We spent the day at the beach- nearly entirely alone it seemed. Towels and chairs were set up for us, the sand was very clean and the ocean warm with nice waves. We had a wonderful time, ordered a drink which was brought to us- no complaints whatsoever. We went down to Old San Juan and ate at SigloXX (great paella, great coffee!). A wonderful day. Day 3: Breakfast at Fern- again they did not have our comp breakfast on file. A different manager gave us a very hard time about it but we were firm and confident it would be sorted out upon speaking to the front desk/general manager. Again we left over 20% tip cash. We went to the rainforest (go early to avoid crowds). Hiked the lovely trails and swam at La Mina falls. We tried the Luquillo kiosks for lunch and had some great conch. Upon our return, we decided to try the spa- it was lovely. HUGE space w/separate mens and womens sauna and pool areas. Water, dried fruit, etc. Very relaxing. My massage was a bit weak despite my requests for her to increase pressure, but still relaxing and overall enjoyable. My husband enjoyed his very much. A tad overpriced but nothing unusual for a resort spa in terms of pricing. We had room service that evening which was pretty good. Day 4: Breakfast at Fern- again they did not have our comp breakfast on file. (Funny as this day we overheard them tell another guest "oh your breakfast is comped today- no need to pay".... we had to fight for ours again). Again left over 20% tip in cash. We hung out by the pool for a bit (fairly deserted except the unattended children) then went to do some shopping in Old San Juan. Had a lovely day down there, bought some souvenirs, and had dinner reservations at Marmalade. DELICIOUS! Try Marmalade!! Day 5: Breakfast at Fern- waiter finally offered to comp our breakfast but we knew our comps were up now so we corrected him and charged it to the room plus his over 20% tip. Spent the day at the beach, then had dinner at the Luqillo kiosks, then went for a biobay kayaking excursion. Bio Bay is AMAZING. Definitely an experience you should not miss! Day 6: Breakfast at Fern- charged plus 20% tip to the room. Relaxed at the beach nearly all day. Were going to try one of the resort restaurants for dinner but nothing sounded very good (menus quite limited) and the reviews were very mixed. Instead we drove just down the road to a local restaurant, Antillos Puertoricano, it was great and very affordable. (Sangria was very tasty as was the mofungo!). Day 7: Went to breakfast outside the resort for something new Hung out by the pool and ate/drank. As we were checking out very early the next morning we decided to do a check on the incidentals then just in case the breakfasts were not yet sorted- YIKES. They had charged us every breakfast and added extra tip for themselves on top of our 20% cash tips. To be fair, this was quickly removed to honor our comp certificate. (Though we suspect the waiters walked away with 40% tips those first 3 days). But the biggest upset was that my mother had sent thoughtful gifts to our room each day (a bottle of wine, fruit, cake, etc...) And they had CHARGED HER GIFTS TO OUR ROOM! They were helpful in attempting to sort it out but I had to go through each expense with a fine-tooth comb to try to figure out what she had ordered vs what we had ordered during our stay. Then they had to CALL HER to get her to authorize the charges to her credit card and off of ours. How in the world did an outside party manage to call and make charges to our room/credit card? It seems absurd to me that that even occurred in the first place and they are very lucky it was a family member and that we were willing to sit there for 45 minutes and try to sort it out. In the end, we did end up paying for a few of her gifts to us (which is fine with us personally but absolutely unacceptable for a hotel in general. Very dangerous ground to allow an outside party to charge to a room without their explicit approval or signature). SO...Overall it was a great trip with a few hiccups. We were disappointed as those hiccups were absolutely preventable with a little organization and communication on the part of the resort. But it all worked out and we are not the kind to worry about that sort of thing for long. We loved our honeymoon. We loved our room and the property. The staff was kind and helpful from beginning to end. But we will be sure to keep all receipts to prevent future difficulties and illegitimate charges with this company. Last thoughts: My mother sent us a slice of cake for our honeymoon. It said "happy birthday" (it was not even close to either of our birthdays. Small mistake. But strange.) And while parked in valet an animal soiled our back windshield. They offered to clean it.... they forgot.. we reminded them.. they forgot.. we asked again.. they forgot. Four full days it remained there. We actually returned the rental car soiled they forgot so many times it never got done. Tiny details. But seems unacceptable for a self-proclaimed "six star hotel."

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Bahia Beach”
Reviews.Author: PDRoberts
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the St Regis Bahia Beach as a one day stopover between red eye flights from the West Coast and going on a cruise in the Southern Caribbean. From check in to check out everything was simply marvelous. I've read the reviews by other memebrs and can't for the life of me figure out how some can be so critical of the staff. Property: As is uniformly reported the grounds and landscaping are exceptional as was the pool. The planting and thoughtfulness of the layout just can't be beat. We had lunch at a nearby town right before checking in and my wife was getting eaten alive by the bugs. At the resort there were none. The attention to siting the buildings in the landscape and the raised walkways to achieve a much higher level of sustainability was appreciated. Rooms: The rooms are terrific. We were in their basic accommodations which are still luxurious and huge by normal standards. great soaking tub. The bathroom was larger than the stateroom of the Serenade of the Seas where we spent the following week. I always find the television in the mirror at St. regis properties to be a gimmick gone too far, but the quality of the furnishings and the layout was all of high quality. I didn't realize until booking that at 52 I could still get a senior citizen discount with my AARP card. The savings for us were significant. Dining: We had a lovely dinner at Fern the one evening we were there. Expensive, but with corresponding quality. Breakfast the next morning was expensive, but with quite alot of tasty food. Drinks: The drinks at $18-20 by the pool is getting too crazy, but we had a meal by the pool and it was great. The pool staff was very attentive and came by fairly frequently. Service in General: My needed the Concierge for a couple of requests and they were most helopful. My wife wanted to go to Sunday mass nearby and the resosrt provided information promptly and arranged for a taxi to take and pick her up. Very freindly staff from start to finish. Helpful and professional, but not fawning. On Saturday night they do the sabering of the chanpagne and the staff seemed unprepared for the seventy folks who gathered. It took twenty minutes to get enough champagne served to everyone by which time one third of the folks had left. A gaffe yes, but a minor one. We would love to return sometime to Bahia Beach. Puerto Rico was more interesting than we expected and there is much too see such as the Biobays and the rainforest. If money is at all an issue, stock up at the markets on the way in for provisions. The do soak you pretty good and if staying for five days it could add up to a huge sum. Note: Drivers in Purto Rico are pretty wild. I haven't had so much fun with crazies in cars for twenty years. Drive on the wrong side of the road, no problem, cut other folks off, no problem. It really was kind of fun though, just keep your wits about you and be prepared for surprises.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, disappointing beach”
Reviews.Author: Angela837
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a great visit to Puerto Rico and 4 nights at the St Regis Bahia Beach. Overall, the resort was beautiful, the service good (not blown away by it, but it was quite good), and the island was a nice respite for us. GETTING THERE -> We rented a car at the airport (more on that later) and took the more scenic route down 187 (vs the way that the hotel suggests down 66). It took about 30 minutes and afforded us ocean vistas, roadside kiosks, and lots and lots of trees with full canopies over the road. If you take this route, there are no signs telling you that you are close to the resort, so watch carefully along the road after about 20 miles for iron leaves indicating the resortâ€™s entrance. If you miss it, you will hit the town of Rio Grande and can turn around, so no biggie. Coming from the other direction (which we also did a number of times on our way to other stuff), you will see signs, but they will all say â€œBahia Beach Resort,â€� not â€œSt Regis.â€� In general, there are only three main roads to know about: 187 and 66 meet up at the airport and then diverge, one (187) along the coast and the other (66) through the middle of the island; 66 then spills onto highway 3, which is the other road to know about â€“ and 3 and 187 converge near the town of Rio Grande; 3 will take you into Luquillo and Fajardo. Once you master the layout of those 3, itâ€™s really easy to get around. A note about leaving the resort going back to the airport â€¦ we took 66 back and it should have been a quick 20 minute drive. However, it took almost 90 minutes in bumper to bumper rush hour traffic (it was a Tuesday morning around 7 AM). Luckily our flight was delayed otherwise we would have missed it. Just giving you a headâ€™s up to allow PLENTY of time! THE RESORT -> Upon arriving at the resort, you are first faced with an impressive gate house. You tell the attendant your name and they let you through, and then you will drive through very lush property towards the Plantation House. There, we were greeted by the valet who unpacked our car for us as we checked in. At check in, we were offered welcome drinks and a brief tour of the Plantation House while our room was being readied, and then we were whisked away on a golf cart to our â€œcasa.â€� A note about check-in, my husband is a Platinum member of Starwood but we were told that there were no upgraded rooms available. As we spent time at the resort, we were surprised by this considering it was MAYBE a third filled. Probably, they had already gotten the standard room ready for us and just didnâ€™t want to bother. At this point, we also learned that the other Platinum benefits have changed. Others have mentioned getting free movies and other such benefits. The person checking us in explained that they no longer do this, and instead offered us our choice of 500 extra points or a $10 F&B credit daily or a book, times two. They were somehow out of the book (whatever it was) and so we split the difference and took one of each of the other two. As others have mentioned, the rooms are beautiful. The â€œbutlerâ€� who escorted us spent time showing us around the room, explaining how to turn on the TV in the bathroom mirror, showing us that the A/C automatically turns off when you open the sliding doors, etc. He also unpacked some of our things for us (including the groceries we had brought with us â€¦ see below). Never did he put his hand out expecting a tip, and this is indicative of everyone we interacted with at the St Regis. The entry to the room was a small vestibule and then you get to your private entry door, which made you feel like it was your personal apartment. The door itself had a â€œprivacyâ€� button which, when pressed, made your doorbell red in color so no one would bother you â€“ no door hangers needed. The room was decorated in British colonial-style furnishings. We had a king bed, a small desk, a small easy chair, a small mini-bar with fridge, and a standard-size (maybe 36 or so) TV with a bluray player. The closet was large and the bathroom was, well, bigger than most regular hotel rooms, with a giant shower (two shower heads), double sinks, and soaker tub. There were free bottles of water on each side of the bed and above the mini-bar, and we learned that these were regularly replaced, so no need to buy your own water. Because we didnâ€™t get upgraded to a suite, we did not get the full â€œbutlerâ€� experience that others have written about. I want to be very clear about this, because after reading about all the great service on Trip Advisor, we were expecting that â€“ but learned quickly that most folks who have written in must have received an upgrade. So, this means we didnâ€™t get coffee delivered to our room (instead, we had to walk to the Plantation House every morning and serve ourselves â€¦ they didnâ€™t even have a coffee maker in the room), nor did we really ever seem to have a dedicated â€œbutler,â€� but instead different random people who serviced us depending on time and request. Our room was on the ground floor, which we quickly became happy about, because you have an unobstructed view of the lawn outside your room and we felt like it was our own personal lawn. There were no bars on a balcony, just our patio that walked right out to the lawn, and from there, down to the path to the pool. We spent every morning drinking coffee and eating breakfast on our patio, watching the many lizards and birds that congregated there. Very memorable! The grounds are lovely and very lush. Think jungle-meets-beach, with luxury added in. Walkways between the various casas, the pool, and the Plantation House were raised wooden platforms, so you were above the jungle floor which was pretty cool. We regularly saw iguanas and other lizards as we walked around in the day, and at night the whole place came alive with singing â€œcoquis,â€� tiny frogs that live on Puerto Rico. We saw one of them when he stowed-away on our towel and we discovered him in our tub after we tossed the towel in there. Speaking of lush grounds, we spent a morning biking around the property (the bikes are free to use), and went into the nature reserve area of the property. We saw even more iguanas, turtles and birds. Where you rent the bikes is at the â€œnature centerâ€� next to the pier area, and the service there was top notch. The staff there even helped us get some â€œsea grapesâ€� from a tree overhanging the water. The pool area is great â€“ five or seven interconnected pools of varying depths, connected via a series of infinity ledges and waterfalls. They provided free sunscreen, although it was only 15 SPF â€“ not enough for us so we still used our own. The beach was so-so. The sand itself was full of seaweed. While I expect some of this, we have been to other beach resorts where they comb the sand early in the morning and I am not sure why they donâ€™t do that at the St Regis. The beach is crescent shaped and the St Regis owns a three-mile section of it. The chairs and umbrellas are free to use. The water was very warm and comfortable, but it was also very murky â€“ completely unlike any of the other beaches we passed getting to the resort and unlike others we saw when we went further east. It was also rough water with a lot of waves (good for body boarding â€“ free to use). Overall, we were disappointed by the unclear water and the run off from the rainforest (lost of wood in the water). The $60 resort fee is not all it promises on the resortâ€™s website or when we called the Starwood folks to make the reservations. First, no more â€œfrozen grapesâ€� or â€œfruit bitesâ€� provided (they told us that the discontinued the service); also, the sâ€™mores were fun but only offered once while we were there (we were there 4 nights); same with the champagne. The ice tea service is still offered at noon, but only at the pool (not at the beach), and if you arenâ€™t there right at noon, you miss it â€“ we walked up at 12:10 and were told we had already missed it. Granted, they went and got some for us, but it seemed odd we had to ask. The fee does cover the â€œfreeâ€� beach umbrellas, bikes, boogie boards, bottled water, etc. though, which is nice. One thing to note about the service is that we ordered ice cream one night ($22 with tip and service fee) and put the bowl outside our room, in the vestibule, after we were done. The next morning we noticed it was still there and when we came back from kayaking in the Bio Bay (see below), the ice cream bowl was STILL THERE â€“ a full 24 hours after we left it. A little strange, we thought. The next morning was when we left for the airport and we were in a bit of a rush so we didnâ€™t notice if it was still there. I would also like to call out that the BEST service the whole time was from the valet. We donâ€™t remember his name but he was super friendly, always smiling and service oriented; and every morning would ask what we had planned for the day. One day as we loaded up our car full of stuff for snorkeling, he noticed we had a small collapsible cooler with us in which we had a few sodas. He proactively asked if he could put some ice in it for us and took it into the Plantation House to fill it up for us. SURROUNDING AREA -> As mentioned above, we rented a car. We ran the numbers and found that renting was about the same cost as arranging for other transportation from San Juan (approx $100 each way in a cab or $175 each way for car service vs $116 Hertz 4-day rental plus $90 in daily parking fees and around $20 for gas). Having a car also freed us to easily visit the surrounding area instead of feeling like we had to spend 100% of our time at the resort. Reasons you may want a car include: - Visit the near-by Ralphâ€™s grocery store (close to where Hwy 3 and 187 meet, in a strip mall next to a Wendyâ€™s and a Walgreens) to get sunscreen, water, soda and some snacks. - Go to Fajardo to see actual clear water and for snorkeling and an evening at the Bioluminescent Bay. We highly recommend both of these - See my separate posts for â€œMini Boat Toursâ€� and â€œKayaking Puerto Rico.â€� We made the reservations for these on our own. The concierge was the one who suggested the mini boat snorkeling but said we should call on that on our own, which we did. The concierge was then going to do the Bio Bay reservations for us but due to several factors they were unable to secure this, and so when we found out that the same company who does the mini boats also does the bio bay, and offered us a discount to book them together on-site, we just went ahead and did that. By the way, we drove ourselves and it was easy to find both locations; of course having our GPS helped a lot. - Visit Old San Juan. Go up highway 66 and itâ€™s a quick 30 minute trip past the airport to Old San Juan. The concierge directed us where to park and provided suggestions on where to walk and what to see. Thank goodness! â€“ I donâ€™t know if we could have gotten to the parking garage without the conciergeâ€™s directions as San Juan is CRAZY busy! We went on a Sunday night at the conciergeâ€™s recommendation because that is the night that families converge on San Juan â€“ it was fun to see locals dancing to traditional music near the old wall and to experience real Puerto Rican street food. - Eat at the Luquillo Kiosks, a collection of 60 beach-side eateries ranging from basic road-side fried food to gourmet meals. These are just 15 minutes from the St Regis along Hwy 3. This is where you get to dive into the Puerto Rican culture with the locals while experiencing awesome food. We ate there 3 times, at El Jefe Burgers (#12), La Parilla (#2), and Osso Bucco (#29). This is definitely a local hotspot on weekend nights. Look for locals arriving on horseback! Overall, we were pleased with our selection of this resort and our time in Puerto Rico, although we wish the beach had been nicer and that we had been upgraded to a suite for the full St Regis experience. If we return to Puerto Rico, we would pick a different resort, due mainly to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Property”
Reviews.Author: kgclark
Reviews.Content: Spectacular hotel. Grounds are incredible and rooms/bathrooms are about as good as it gets. This is definately a place to go for a romantic, quiet and relaxing getaway. If you are looking for an active nightlife, clubs etc. , look elsewhere. It's very expensive - both for the rooms and the restaurants/bars, but it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, but some service issues and it definitely needs an adult pool”
Reviews.Author: spgplat2
Reviews.Content: There are so many positives about this hotel, but sadly the service we received took away from a lot of those positives. Positives: The rooms at the hotel are extremely nice and very large. We had a beachfront suite and it was one of the nicest rooms I've ever had. I don't think anyone would be disappointed in the room, regardless of your expectations. The grounds around the hotel were very well kept and it makes you feel like you are in your own private jungle retreat. The quality of the food and drinks were very good and we liked everything we tried. We loved Fern and would highly recommend eating here. The food wasn't too pricey, but drinks were expensive, even by resort standards ($22 with tax and service fee for all the mixed drinks). I played golf one morning and the course had a really nice layout. The par 3s were all a little too short, and some seemed like they were just squeezed into the course, but overall it was a very nice, fun course that I would recommend to any golfers. Our room was in the building next to the plantation house (the main building) so it was very convenient to everything. I would recommend asking to be in a room close to the main building. Negatives: Our biggest complaint during the trip was the slow service for just about everything. The staff was always very friendly and helpful, but it just took WAY too long for them to do anything. Ordering coffee in the morning took 45 minutes to an hour each day. By the pool, the server would only come by once every half hour or so and the morning we left it took 35 minutes for the bellman to come to the room to get our luggage. Our room wasn't ready until 4:30pm when we arrived on a Monday and we often had to call to have our room serviced. Most days it wasn't serviced until 5 or 6pm. These are just a couple examples, but almost everything was too slow and it became a joke among us by the end of our trip. The other big complaint we had was that there was no adult pool. There were lots of children at the hotel, which was totally fine except by the pool. The pool wasn't crowded, but there was at least one loud family in each area of the pool. Going forward, I really hope the hotel designates one of the areas as an adult pool. Then some miscellaneous notes. The beach is nice, but it didn't look anything like the pictures on the website. The sand was dark brown, and there was a fair amount of sea weed and sticks on the beach. The water was also more of a brown color. It may just be a little extra muddy during this time of the year, but it was definitely not anything close to a bright blue-green. Also there aren't really any "beachfront" rooms. The closest rooms are still probably 40-50 yards from the beach and there are lots of trees in between the room and the ocean. We were on the first floor, so maybe the second floor has an unobstructed view, but our room did not. Overall, the hotel was so beautiful and the flight from the US was so easy that we will definitely try it again and hope for some changes. I would just set your expectations ahead of time and you should have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Chi_LonTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in May 2011 and had a very pleasant experience. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained. There is a rainforest feel throughout the property. The plantation house is beautifully decorated and has an intimate atmosphere of which you feel you are staying at a private home. Staff aims to please and they try very hard. We had a suite with butler service so every morning tea and coffee were promptly brought to us which was a very nice touch. We ate at all the restaurants and had room service as well. While the food was good, I have had a wider variety of choices at other resorts. Some dishes were great while others were just good. However, this did not take away from my experience as I still managed to have a fantastic time. If you are heading to Puerto Rico, this is definitely the place to stay. The distance from San Juan did not bother us and we made a day trip out of the journey which was a nice change of pace from the resort grounds and activities. Spa was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Very far from everything and too little food choices.”
Reviews.Author: Our10th
Reviews.Content: We were there to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. The room we booked for, was not available which we found out after arriving! The staff was very very courteous and respectful and promised our king bed in 2 days. We said that's fine..... The butler services isn't as great the hotel advertises it to be. I waited 1 hour for shampoo !! The restaurants are waay too pricey for the type of food they serve!! Molasses is by far the best although you can get better mofongo in old San Juan. One last reminder, you certainly need bug spray with you the whole time!

Reviews.Title: “Cross-sell hell...”
Reviews.Author: MagnoliaMayorSeattle
Reviews.Content: Nice enough place. Too hard to get around, and, STOP WITH THE NEVER ENDING CROSS SELL!!! Let folks get settled and relax a bit before you roll the tanks with the never-ending cross-sell from every staff member on the property

Reviews.Title: “Jungle Setting w/Privacy”
Reviews.Author: AOHAUL
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband and three children over labor day, just after hurricane Irene. Property is located in a beautiful jungle setting. We stayed in beach front suite, but just had peek-a-boo views of ocean through the trees. I would suggest paying for a garden view room, due to the amount of foleage blocking views from all units. Since resort is located in the jungle/swampy area, there are a lot of musty & mildew smells that you can't escape. We took the stairs every time we went to and from our room due to the overwhelming smell in the elevator. Smells in room were minimal with A/C on high. Pool area is beautiful and clean. Beach area not groomed, or cleaned daily. A lot of seaweed, sticks and trash wash up on shore and left. Beach water was not clear or crystal blue. It was a sandy beach, not many rocks. Service is spotty and not very friendly. Prices of drinks average $20.00 each. Nice cabana's are available for $400.00 per day rental. There were fun "free" familiy activities like bike riding, kayaking, nature trails, fish & turtle feeding, tennis, golf, roasting smores at dusk, etc. The property is lovely and unique and I am glad we visited, but we will not return. There are much better locations out there for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, BUT!!!”
Reviews.Author: MyNextVilla
Reviews.Content: We stayed on points for 3 nights, as Gold SPG members we were upgraded to a nice room, the location and room was lovely. We had nice relaxing time and we followed one of reviewerâ€™s advices and rented a car, big mistake. To rent a car is not really that cheap, the cheapest rate is about $35 per day + insurance $30 per day + St Regis daily parking $22 + fees to return back to airport + some other fees = $90-100 per day for KIA! If you really need to get out of the resort rent a car, but for a short stay the car is not necessary. I also did not like the old San Juan, populated with cruise ship people, just wasnâ€™t my thing. Positives: drinks at Fern and lobby are expensive, but great. I did not mind spending $22 for a ginger margarita or cucumber martini. Room is comfortable and the setting is beautiful. Fern food is good, but not phenomenal. Service was good, very good everywhere in a resort. The pool setting is nice and we enjoyed late night swimming. I also liked the privacy the resort allows. Overall I would go back for the privacy and the location. I also would like to note lobby bartenders make the best drinks! Negatives: The beach was not clean; I was disappointed that the beach was not cleaned thru the day. Beach chairs look faded. Seagrapes food is just ok (could be better), drinks are not worth the price there, $18-22 for a smoothie made from a frozen carton productâ€¦ St Regis could not get fresh fruits? Also, Pina Colada was the worst (Seagrapes restaurant) I had in years, also probably some frozen carton. I was surprised to see dirty light fixture to the room entrance, I thought it was obvious to see. Food was good in Fern, not phenomenal, I liked small portions and consistent quality, but was annoyed hearing Jean George at every meal. If Fern is so highly acclaimed and considered 5* establishment then tables should NOT be made from laminated wood, cheap table settings, fake candles and so on. Overall, I could not understand the dÃ©cor mix, Barbara Barry, which is fairly good furnishings mixed with some cheap dÃ©cor, looked odd especially Fern, my suggestion get some white linens and real nice chairs. Also, any room should come with mosquito repellants, at night it is so many of them. I did not have a chance to try the third restaurant because it had some strange days of operations (is not open every day), maybe next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tracy H
Reviews.Content: While a hike from San Juan International, I believe it's worth it! The rooms are most definitely pricey, but, you get what you pay for. The property is gorgeous and the staff is very well trained to not disappoint! PROS: - The property is beautiful and the attention to detail is exquisite. The staff is very well trained to greet every guest in the same manner. Nobody is pretentious. - The rooms are GORGEOUS and offer every possible amenity. First class, all the way! - Jean Georges restaurant is FABULOUS! And, does not disappoint. A bit, pricey, yes. But, I'm willing to pay the price for EXCELLENT food and service! CONS: - We also smelled the mildew/mold all around the property. Fortunately, our room was on a top floor and we did not smell it so much in our room, but, it was so bad in the elevator, I left with a severe allegoric reaction, after one night. - The air conditioning unit in our room was soooo loud, I kept thinking there was a massive storm outside our window. I'd get up to look outside and the trees weren't even moving. I didn't sleep a wink, that night. :( - Right after we checked into our room, the staff knocked on our door to take in all of the outdoor deck cushions, because a hurricane was coming two days later. Turned out, the hurricane was downgraded and never even came near the island. A bit to pre-cautious. - Same thing happened at the pool. They packed up and locked down all of the outdoor furniture equipment and when we asked to have a chase put out, we received attitude and were directed to a corner where they started pulling at chase lounges, to accommodate every one, without making more work for themselves. - We dinned at Jean Georges restaurant, Fern, for both dinner and breakfast. It was not cheap! But, the food did NOT disappoint! Con - when we arrived for breakfast, all of the windows/views were blocked with armoires, again, preparing for the storm, that never happened. They could have positioned the armoires, in place, to move in two seconds, upon the first rain drop. I certainly am all for being prepared, in advance. But, 48 hours in advance, for a storm that never hit the island, is a bit excessive. And, for the price of a room, that is a major CON. It doesn't matter if you have discretionary income or you are spending every last dime in your wallet or on credit, at $695/night, every guest should be pampered and treated to the fine luxuries this resort has to offer. Note to Management: You should prepare for the worst, but not be so invasive to the guests who are there to enjoy being pampered, if only for one day, along side some R&R!

Reviews.Title: “" Our best trip ever !"”
Reviews.Author: smitraPuertoRico
Reviews.Content: What a georgous place ! Kept in mint condition. Staff couldnt be more polite and helpful. Not to mention, the prettiest of female staff and very handsome male satff ! Beautiful decore all over. Rooms were to die for, with excellent room service. Pool, beach , golf course.....all were wonderful ! The only negative, was dinner at Mollases. Server was not attentive, had to call twice to get a drink and the food was just about ok. But, on any note, will surely go back anytime , and would highly recommend couples, families, girls outing, all and everybody to experience this "tucked away " beauty !

Reviews.Title: “Missed the mark on the basics”
Reviews.Author: BarXTraveler
Reviews.Content: Overall, were we disappointed with our trip? No. But, I give this resort a lot of thumbs down for many service-related aspects. As a St. Regis resort, I expect remarkable, above-average service. What we experienced was below-average on many occasions. Here is a list of pros and cons from our stay: PROS - The grounds/landscaping was very lovely - you would not have known Hurricane Irene had just passed through. Very lush and colorful surrounding the rooms, pool and other facilities. They have a raised wooden walkway that winds from the main house to all of the rooms, which is nicely-lit at night and has music playing. They have a nature trail on the property that's great for running/walking, too. - We stayed in a Garden room (building 900) and I would actually recommend this area/type over a more expensive one. From what I saw, there are not really any rooms right on the beach, and our room was very cool to the pool and main house. - The beach area had a great variety of 'activities' - two bocce ball courts, crouqet, and a variety of beach items you could check out from the beach shack. - The pool area is nicely laid out. There are several 'parts' of the pool with varying depths, shade, and sitting areas. - Quiet, clean beach area. - The bathrooms have some nice features - nice rain showerhead and a tv in the mirror - The main house's interior design is beautiful and has a lovely lawn that extends from the back outdoor sitting area to the beach. The workout facility has nice equipment, an exercise room, towels, headphones, a fridge full of bottled water, and a nice, cool temperature. - The food from Fern at dinner (dinner specifically) was excellent. Our favorite are the blistered shishito peppers and the avocado pizza appetizer. (Breakfast at the Fern was very overpriced and bland.) - The bartenders at the main house and the pool bar were all very nice and conversational - it was a pleasure visiting with them. - Great pizzas at the pool bar/restaurant. All the food is pricey there, but these are worth it. CONS - Room service was basically non-existent. We were there for 4 days and they never collected or replaced our used glasses. Not once. We ended up having to wash our own glasses and re-use them. We had to hide our empty shampoo/conditioner bottles in order to have them replaced. It was clear that our counters weren't thoroughly wiped down because none of our items had moved a millimeter from where we'd placed them. - The room smelled very musty upon arrival. It was better after the 2nd day (either b/c we got used to it or because we had the A/C blasting), but not even candles lit or available to even try to address the smell. The drawers in the closest were lined w/ paper but very sloppy, the paper was too big to even fit. Uncomfortable, large pillows. Hard bed (where's the W bed when you need it. - No coordination between the concierge and room service. Most nice places know when you have made a reservation for dinner (we did every night) and schedule the room service to come by then. Every night our room service person would come by when we were showering. I expect 5-star resorts to have some collaboration between departments. - Overpriced food at the pool bar/restaurant. I do expect prices at a St. Regis to be high, but the pricing strategy was a bit of a rip-off (everything on the menu, no matter the ingredients used, were all about the same price). Some food was worth the premium prices (i.e. the pizzas were excellent), but others were sub-par. - The pool bar closes way too early - 5pm if I remember correctly. There were always so many people around when they were yelling last call. Not only was it disruptive to anyone having a nice afternoon in the pool, but it was also disappointing not having a good after dinner hang out spot to enjoy with a cocktail. - I was very disappointed that when I called ahead of our trip and specifically asked if there were any events/activities going on at the resort that the answer was 'no'. (We scheduled a kayak trip for Saturday night.) Come to find out that we booked our kayak outing on the night they were doing a Champagne and S'Mores event. I'm sure it was lovely...too bad we missed out. - Expensive pool bar drinks - a top shelf margarita costs $18, as an example. - None of the doors at the women's bathroom in the pool area would latch shut. Overall,

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC property - will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: rainbowkaine
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I came here for a long weekend with plans to use my Starwood Free Resort Nights but unfortunately our trip was cut short as we had to fly home early to try and get there before Hurricane Irene. Unfortunately, we didn't make it back before the storm and got stranded in Orlando, but the 2 days we had at the St. Regis were fantastic. Everything about this property was beautiful, from the scenery we passed on a regular basis, to the surroundings at the pool, and of course the rooms. We were upgraded to a Deluxe King Room which had an balcony with a view, and a beautiful room with very comfy bed, walk-in closet, nice wet-bar area, and of course huge bathroom with double vanities, rain shower, and separate nice and deep tub. The service was also great, though the food and drinks were a bit pricey (as NYers, we're used to prices like this in the high-end restaurants but this was a bit more than I would have expected even at a resort property). Nevertheless, we had lunch at Seagrapes and breakfast the next day at Fern. The lunch at Seagrapes was pretty good (the shrimp in the jumbo shrimp cocktail really are JUMBO) and the drinks were very nice. If we had a chance to stay longer, we probably would have gone to a store to stock up on some basic items and stored them in the fridge. The property is wonderful, with lots of different plants and trees and wildlife to surround you - overall creating a very natural and serene environment. And of course, there's not enough to say about the service. Especially the concierge, Denise, sat with us for a while and helped us figure out our options for how to spend our one full day there (Friday) - we ended up exploring Old San Juan because El Yunque was closed after the hurricane. Which brings me to a few tips for the trip: 1. Definitely rent a car. Taxi's are expensive and there's no other way to get around because the resort is far from town and really far from anything else as well. Car rentals are cheap and totally worth it! 2. Our second night there (Friday), after exploring Old San Juan (which I recommend - it's a cute little town and definitely has character) we decided to go with the recommendations we read here and based on what our concierge recommended and we went to Marmalade for dinner. Conclusion - there are absolutely not enough words to describe this phenomenal eating experience. It was pure heaven (again, as NYers, we're used to some of the best food in the world and we both put this place in our top 3 culinary experiences EVER). The decor was beautiful, the drinks were phenomenal (Ted, the bartender, really knows what he's doing and if you don't like it, he'll make you another one for no charge. The Plum Sake martini had me happy for the whole night), and the food was out of this world (my BF described it as 'every dish gushes with overwhelming happiness and heaven). We ordered the 5 course tasting menu and were pretty full by the end of the night, but they do a good job with portion size so you are able to at least try each course. We had to end our meal early because of flight reasons, but we both decided that we would happily come back to Puerto Rico for an overnight trip just to be able to go to this restaurant again. Overall, the experience was wonderful and we wish we had been able to stay for more time. No worries though, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed luxury in a gorgeous setting”
Reviews.Author: TravelDaddy01
Reviews.Content: My wife, Susan Hackett, and I celebrated our 25th anniversary here in early August sans children, and we were not disappointed. Although pricey, because it is a Starwood resort we were able to use points for one night, and were also able to book a good last-minute package that included breakfast. The rooms are really luxurious - we were in a second floor room with balcony overlooking the golf course, and it was quiet, beautiful, well-appointed, and a short, enjoyable walk to the Plantation House (where the restaurant is located), the pool and the beach. The main restaurant, Fern, was wonderful: breakfasts were sumptuous and well-prepared, and dinners were to die for. The fitness center was one of the nicer ones we've used in some time, and the grounds - including almost 3 miles of walking trails - are gorgeous. The location is great for day trips to El Yunque or Old San Juan. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Glorious Property - Food was Okay”
Reviews.Author: ARubins
Reviews.Content: Stayed only two nights at the St. Regis Bahia Beach Resort but that was long enough to know I want to go back. My room (a suite) was way more room than I needed but I loved it and enjoyed the pampering of butler service. My tub was as almost as deep as a hot tub which I loved b/c I take long soaking baths. The room amenities, towels, soaps, shampoos, linens etc were all superior. My only complaint was with the food. I ate at SeaGrapes for lunch and ordered a Margherita Pizza - it was delivered without basil, apparently they ran out, thereby rendering my pizza simply a cheese pizza. If I had been advised ahead of time, I would have ordered something else as basil is a key ingredient to a Margherita Pizza. My breakfast at Fern was okay but not great. My eggs were the way I requested them but my English Muffin was served cold and unbuttered. Not a huge deal but this shouldn't be a difficult request to receive a hot buttered English muffin. Having only two food experiences, both being mediocre at best, my impression is the kitchen doesn't care about food quality. For the prices and reputation of a St. Regis this needs to improve greatly. Overall, I loved this resort but would not eat here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort, pricey meals, overall very good service”
Reviews.Author: klorenc
Reviews.Content: Did quite a bit of research on PR resorts before stumbling across the new St. Regis Bahai Beach.
