If you are looking for a secluded resort with immaculate rooms and grounds, and very friendly service, then look no further. Overall, we placed it at or near the top of the list for our family vacations. Some specifics: Pros: * The hotel: Driving into the St. Regis facility gives you a great sense of things to come: lush, tropical landscape, the Jones golf course, the Plantation House -- all gorgeous. The rooms are huge and well appointed. Bathrooms are as grand as other reviews state. We had an oceanfront room, ground level and next to the Plantation House and the pool, which was terrific. Very convenient. * The staff: All very friendly and accomodating. Big kudos to Pedro, our waiter at Seagrass, and Xavier at the front. Everyone was friendly, knowledgable and helpful. The beach: Bahia is immaculate. Yes, the waves are choppy and the water isn't Bahamas blue, but my wife and kids still enjoyed body surfing for hours. * The golf course: A challenging Trent Jones course. The greens had just been aerated and sanded, which meant my round was more challenging than for most, but I could still appreciate it. Pricey, but worth the experience. Cons: * Meal prices: The restaurants are all good, but probably not deserving of the resort prices. Our dinner entrees at Fern were disappointing (undercooked salmon), but breakfast was very good. Molasses for dinner was better - excellent mofongo --but then it was closed for two days due to the slow season. Seagrass, the casual poolside restaurant, was consistently the best but still tough to stomach $100+ for a casual lunch for 4. While we wouldn't stay there, try Palio at the Rio Mar resort for dinner. Same resort prices, but excellent Italian food. For better, cheaper PR cuisine, try the Kiosks in Luquillo -- La Parilla was the best! * Meal service: Despite the overall excellent service, meal service was consistently sloooooow. We were on vacation, and in no rush, but -- since it is the low season and the resort was relatively empty -- we expected our meals in a reasonable timeframe. Not sure if this was due to low staffing, but be prepared to wait. Overall: It's clear from the reviews on TA that word is starting to get out about this place. The fact that it has only been open since Nov 2010 contributes both positives (new, immaculate) and negatives (a few service kinks). I expect that they will be put to the test when the high season begins and more people flock to the resort. Despite some setbacks due to the low season, it was the ideal time to stay if you like to avoid the crowds. We were sorry to leave and hope to be back soon -- can't imagine staying anywhere else in PR.

Reviews.Title: “Staff needs a complete overhaul!”
Reviews.Author: Moriahgay
Reviews.Content: So many things went wrong which is such a shame because the property Is so beautiful but even that didn't overshadow how horrible the service was.... We had reservations at molasses only to find that we were not on the list...mind you my fiancÃ©e was supposed to propose to me this night but that put a damper on the evening for him, he did however end up proposing to me in front of the main house on the grassy knoll, one morning we could not get breakfast bc of some private party going on, and we were not properly dresses ex fiancÃ©e did not have short with him cause we were just going to lie on the beach and have breakfast, we never got towels at the beach, the guy was setting up the umbrellas for people who weren't even there but yet we are laying there patiently waiting to get towels and he never came, so we thought let's go for a walk on the beach and surely when we get back we will have towels on our chairs...nope! We were gone for 30 minutes on our walk, I literally had to go over to the guy and say what is up? He said we are understaffed and he had to set up for the party guests! So ridiculous, when we checked out the lady asked how our stay was and I said well not the best and I left it at that and she never even asked what went wrong! Beware if you order 2 slices of cake a 2 scoops of icecream it will be $80 for room service but yet at the bar the menu said $12 for cake and ice-cream,

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on the beach”
Reviews.Author: akcook13
Reviews.Content: Great three day stay at the resort. Obviously a 5 star resort so I am not going to complain about the high food and drinks. Pros Most polite and helpful staff I have ever been around. The TV in the bathroom mirror was insane. Great lounging area by the pool and beach. Tennis and kayaking activities are nice. Food was great (only ate breakfast). The spacious room and layout was perfect. Did I say the staff was first class! Cons The daily activity fees are a little much. Should be on an "as used" basis. The poolside bar closed at 5 pm?? If you venture out, decent drive to anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort - Roll The Dice Service”
Reviews.Author: ANGEL_L_FONTANEZ
Reviews.Content: The resort is very well kept and the boathouse staff is very friendly! The Smore's and Champagne activities on Sat. night are awesome! The two items I would say I was not happy with are related to all staff or policies not being consistent. When we arrived at 4PM on Friday we had to wait about 2 hours for our room (mind you they did upgrade us to a St. Regis Suite as part of the SPG Platinum benefits). No big deal... but this came into play on Sunday when I was going to check-out. As a platinum member you are allowed to check-out by 4PM (if available). Well, when I requested the late check-out I was told that it was not available. This upset me because I had to wait for my room because somene was allowed a late check-out but when I requested it it was "not available". The hotel was probably at 20% occupancy. The fact is that they probably did not want to have to keep the cleaning staff late on Sunday. The other item that upset me is that my children were told that they could receive hot chocolate in the room as part of the Butler service. The boys ordered a few times and to my surprise I got billed for about half of them. When I questioned at check-out they said it was not complimentary. Which is fine... but why were we told it was and why did we get a few free and they charged a few. So my main complaint here is that the policies and service are not consistent. Overall I was very happy as I stayed in a St. Regis suite for basically free... but I cannot see why someone would pay the 1000+ per night to stay here. The room did have a musky smell, so I am guessing noone really stays there much.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Property”
Reviews.Author: EO-traveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 day family vacation. The development is amazing. Extremely well laid out with miles of walks and trials throughout. Check in was smooth but as others have said the room was not ready when we arrived at 3:00. No big deal as went off to Sea Grapes for a fantastic lunch (the Sushi rocks). We were in ocean front suite #1013 (It faces the ocean but several hundred yards from the actual beach) the room was large and well decorated. The walk in shower is first class. We too had trouble with the HVAC, the room always felt damp and we kept bumping the tstat lower but it never removed the moisture from the air. After several days we needed to have the pillows changed because they had a musty smell to them. Housekeeping needs a check list as we were often left without wash clothes, tissue and other essentials. The pool is 24/7,huge and perfectly clean. Being summer it was like bath water, chairs are everywhere, excellent towel and beverage service too. The 3 restaurants are awesome, great service and great food. There are snack huts at the 10 hole of the golf course and one a mile down the beach. The hours vary so check with the hotel. (Note the concierge did not even know the beach snack shop existed) so be prepared to read and explore. The golf hut serves a lighter less expensive breakfast and lunch. Overall this is a excellent resort that still needs to work on the details. The staff tries hard but there doesn't seem to be anyone really in charge. For example: I would call in to have the car brought up and it only showed up one time out of five tries. These are basics they should be dialed in now that they have been open for 10 months.

Reviews.Title: “The St. Regis made our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Dan P
Reviews.Content: I don't take the time to do this but I just got back from my honeymoon and felt compelled to review The St. Regis at Bahia Beach, PR. Even with the remnants of a hurricane passing through, the service in the hotel was exceptional. Noel our butler employed a perfect blend of professionalism, traditional hotelier manner, and casual fraternity. He instantly made us feel welcome and taken care of without us feeling uncomfortable, which is normally the case being someone who isn't used to being waited on that way. More than anything, he had the three biggest qualities required for good customer service: charisma, intelligence, and intuition (specifically, the ability to anticipate another person's needs). Also, though i can't remember his name, the bartender at the pool bar who works Wed through Sun was exceptional as well (and makes a mean mojito). He was funny, engaging but not overbearing. We recommend the resort to anyone who wants to truly getaway and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property but the service doesn't match”
Reviews.Author: BooTheGroundhog
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 nights in the Bahia Beach Resort, below are the pros and cons: Pro: - Beautiful property. The property is located on the edge of crystal clear water in a rainforest setting. A board walk carries you about 1 ft. above the floor of the rain forest to the rooms. - Great workout room. SPG properties are known for outstanding workout facilities, and this property is no different with a Subzero filled with water and apples for after the workout. - Rooms are on par with other St. Regis properties: very nice. The bathrooms are large and there are large private balconies. Cons: - We were very dissatisfied with the restaurants. We dined at Molasses and both our meals were inedible from too much salt, necessitating an after dinner meal. Fern actually had edible food, but unfortunately the selection was limited. - We were dissatisfied with the service. Our room was not cleaned any of the nights we stayed in the hotel without a call. On one occasion, we left the "Please Makeup Room" light on from 10 am to 4 pm to return with our room still in need of service. We called to ask for service, left for dinner, and returned to simply find towels. Room service trays would remain outside our door for an entire day, and spilled coffee in the hall way was never cleaned. - We were treated like second class citizens. For our dinner at Molasses, no one would give us directions to the restaurant ("you have to wait for a cart", which is not true, it's a five minute walk along the beach) so we called for a cart. We called four times over two hours but no cart ever arrived. We were informed that Carmelo Anthony was at the property and all carts and service were being directed towards his group (not to mention that they shut down Fern that night, so Molasses was the only on-site option). - The property is also a good distance from San Juan (30 minutes) and located on a road that is extremely dangerous to drive (the road has no lines, is almost exactly 2 car widths, and you need to veer off the road to dodge the locals driving 50 mph right at you in a game of chicken). There really are no resort activities despite being called a resort, other than golf. All-in-all, we would not return. It's a shame that such a beautiful property is so poorly run.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, secluded, pampered, private luxury. Exquisite.”
Reviews.Author: Rentett
Reviews.Content: Complete luxury from the moment we arrived. Excellent staff. Excellent room. Excellent facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss! Felt like we were the most important people out there!!”
Reviews.Author: rex6
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the St. Regis as a part of our Honeymoon. We were there for 3 nights, and trust me we were made to feel like the most important people there. Every single person out there knew us and congratulated us whenever they greeted us. Right from every waiter at the restaurant to the people in house keeping. We were welcomed with a complimentary bottle of champagne, chocolates and a personal congratulatory hand written note from the General Manager. The restaurants were fabulous. Excellent food. We took a couples treatment at their spa. Lovely warm masseurs made the experience even better. Would recommend this to everyone!! You'll be made to feel like the most important people there!! The place is pristine, lovely beach, lovely shacks in the lawns, lovely pond for paddle boating. The place is huge so there's plenty to do for everyone, The golf course was challenging and fun. Hope you guys have as splendid a time as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Understated luxury”
Reviews.Author: Jerseytraveler89
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned about some previous reviews, however my recent stay at this resort exceeded my expectations. This property is simply beautiful, nestled on Bahia Beach which is very secluded. This St. Regis property has an understated elegance without ever feeling stuffy. It is a small plantation style resort which during the off season, was not crowded and you really get fabulous service and attention! The room is nicely decorated and very large, the suites (which we were upgraded to) was exceptional. The food at the resort is not cheap but it was consistently very good, especially Fern. NYC style restaurant and a nice pre fix menu . The staff was wonderful, friendly and very attentive throughout our stay. Some suggestions for travelers: We used toursanjuan.com to get a car service to the hotel, excellent service with private luxury transfers that are half the rate of what the St. Regis charges. Stop at Ralph's grocery store and stock up some food/drink especiallly if you have a family. Take advantage of what the resort has to offer, rent the bikes and tour the extensive property. Schedule a nature tour with the marine biologist. Rent a boat if available at the Boat House, Take advantage of the driving range. All listed above are free. The bar is a great option to get a light meal and a change of atmosphere to dine. A few suggestions for the hotel: Seagrapes would be nice to have open for breakfast as it is more casual than Fern and would give people another option in the morning. The gift store could be upgraded and have more to offer. Pool service could be improved, it was not crowded and we needed to find someone to place a drink order. Overall this resort is a hidden gem in beautiful Puerto Rico. I would highly recommend this hotel for a lovely short getaway for couples looking to recharge and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Almost life changing experience”
Reviews.Author: eflikimlkfk
Reviews.Content: I would like to take time to write you about my recent stay at your property. I have heard a lot of good things from my colleagues who have stayed with you so I knew I will have a good time, but after my stay I can tell you that words cannot describe the experience and all my expectations were highly exceeded. The property itself is so beautiful and luxurious but the service is just unbelievable. Never ever have I been treated better in my life. I honestly have tears in my eyes writing this letter, thinking about my stay and your staff. I was welcomed by Carlos upon my arrival. His welcoming, friendly, positive and extremely professional attitude made me feel like I am the only and most important person in Puerto Rico. I could go on and on about Carlos, but I have others I have to mention. The young lady that checked me in was also very friendly and welcoming, â€œunfortunatelyâ€� she was so beautiful, that I was unable to take my eyes off of her and read her name tag:). Juan at the bar- amazing! After the first time I ate there he remembered my name and my order. By the end of my stay I felt like he is my family. Matta (?) at the bar- I came in one day for lunch before noon and didnâ€™t realize the bar was not open yet, Matta insisted on providing lunch for me and we had a wonderful chat. Elvis at the bar â€“ very professional and caring. One day I mentioned I had trouble sleeping and he offered to make me a tea to help me sleep. I thought it was very nice and attentive. Dianne (?) at the boutique - I came in right when she was opening up and she made me feel like she is truly happy to see me, quick encounter but left a memorable impression. Heidi who welcomed me every day for breakfast, so nice and friendly and Salvador! So so so wonderful! He talked to me every day about how my stay is, always with a smile. Jonathan at the pool and all the girls there-one time I was passing by and mentioned I may come back and when I returned, Jonathan had a chaise lounge ready for me. Ludwig was also always taking care of me, I stepped into a gum and he got it off my foot (which I definitely did not expect him to do), he kept looking after me, making sure I was drinking enough water and that I have everything I need. All the staff-and I really mean every single person I would come across to-would constantly ask if I have everything I need and every question/request I had was taken care of immediately with a smile and calm, relaxed and friendly attitude. I wanted to mentioned that I spoke to another guest who stayed with her parents for 10 days and she said she hurt her knee and the butler (do not know the name) went at midnight to a pharmacy to get her an ice pack. She said she feels like every single employee is happy to be working there and is pleased to take care of the guests. Mr. Berger, from the bottom of my heart, thank you for the best 5 days and if any of your employees would ever need anything, Iâ€™d do everything possible I could, to help them. And as far as recommending your hotel, I will INSIST that everyone I know will go visit your beautiful property. There really isnâ€™t a single negative thing I would say about your hotel or staff, specially Carlos.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place. Services tries hard, but needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: gperezv
Reviews.Content: Wonderful picture perfect resort close to San Juan. An architecture jewel right on the beach offering wonderful restaurants: Fern (from Jean-Georges) and Molasses (Puerto Rican inspired cuisine). Without any doubt the best resort in mainland Puerto Rico. People are extremely helpful and willing to help. You can tell they always try. However, small details need serious work to become an elite property. Bicycles available to guess do not work and I recommend extreme caution is taken before getting on one. My wife and I took a couple and one broke 10 minutes into the ride. We had to go back to the facilities to get another one. We were back 15 minutes after once again as the replacement also broke. This time it was the device holding the infant seats. We were so lucky nothing happened to our kids. Onviously we decided not to ride anymore. State of the art technology is used throughout the resort. For instance you can set your room to show you busy / occupied. Howevr, somehow front desk keep calling your room during kid napping time. We had the same situation twice on the road. Looks like they are not using their own technology to allow guess privacy and comfort. A reservation at Fern was canceled without any prior warning. I had to talk to the manager to get an alternative time. They apologized and were very flexible to accomodate us. In general these are small details that you certainly should not expect at a St Regis. I am sure that management will fix the small details I have described and this property will become one of the top 5 places in the Caribbean soon.

Reviews.Title: “greatest hotel in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: airdreams
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel as a weekend get-away with some friends and really had no expectations except having a good time. What a surprise! The rooms were simply georgeous. Big, very sophisticated decor, the best, huge bathroom ever. The boardwalks to the rooms went through lush tropical forest setting which seems to be the landscaping theme. The pool area was very nice but the service was best... they bent backwards for detailed, friendly and prompt attention to any request. Ask to be taken to a private property tour...The food in the restaurant is fabulous, the rest of the restaurants good enough. It is quite expensive in every area so be prepared to spend quite a lot. If in your budget, splurge!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: McMug
Reviews.Content: The resort is beautiful and everyone is so friendly. We brought our 20 month old son with us and he loved it. We stayed for 5 nights and there is no lack of things for kids to do there. The rooms are large - loved the massive tub and rain shower. Should do a stopover at Ralphs coming from airport. There is some pantry space and the fridge is spacious enough to put 2 cartons of milk there. Food is great, although we'd love to have more selection of food. Fern is delicious. Love having breakfast there. Somehow my husband and I didn't like the way they make the eggs though. The French Toast is a must have. Only drawback is the distance of the resort from the rest of San Juan. But if you don't mind driving (because cab fares would be expensive), this resort is definitely perfect for you!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort With Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: mrjones72
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Bahia Beach resort for 5 nights in June to celebrate our 10 year wedding anniversary. We were a bit concerned after reading some of the reviews regarding service, but our fears were unfounded. We had a wonderful, relaxing vacation in this beautiful resort. Here are the details: Getting there - There are many reviews that talked about how confusing and difficult it was to find the resort. We took the scenic beach route (PR 187) from the resort rather than the main highway route (PR-26 / PR 3), and we found it pretty easy to get to. Just make sure that you look for two large bronze leaves off the main road, as it can sneak up on you quickly. The drive there was gorgeous, following the beaches and water for most of the trip. We stopped by one of the many food shacks along the road and ate some great local snacky food. The resort is about 30-40 minutes away from San Juan and is in a very secluded part of Puerto Rico, which is exactly what we wanted. You will need a car, however, if you plan on going out of the hotel even once, as taxis and hotel transportation can be very expensive. The resort - Once we made it to the resort, we stopped by the gate and the security attendant took our names and told us how to get to the check-in desk. The resort grounds are absolutely beautiful and very vast. The drive from the main gate to the lobby must be at least a mile or more, so that will give you an idea of how large the total property is. The landscape is lush, green, and very beautiful. When we got to the lobby, the staff was very friendly and would not let us do anything. We were whisked away to the check-in desk, which is exactly what it sounds like. There is no check in area. Instead, you sit in front of one of two desks where someone checks you in and goes over the details of your stay. We were offered cold rum punch while we waited, which was delicious. They upgraded us to a suite, which was beautiful (more on that later). You can either walk down a series of flora-covered boardwalks and sidewalks, or you can have the staff take you around in golf carts. We opted for the golf carts for the first trip to the room because we did not know how far it would be. Within 5 minutes of check-in, we were carted away to our room. The room - The hotel is broken out into a series of "casas", and we were in one called Casa Sanctuario. It was aptly named, as it was nestled amidst a plethora of foliage and the only sounds we heard during our entire stay were those of the coqui frogs whistling at night, and the ocassional bird that would visit our balcony. Our suite was quite large, although I'm not sure about the square feet. We had a huge balcony with a large patio furniture set, which was great for eating breakfast or drinking coffee. The king bed was very comfortable, the TV was huge, although we did not watch it at all. The bathroom was luxurious, as well as enormous. I am sure there have been many hotel rooms I have stated at that were not as big as this bathroom.. There was a double sink, a huge shower set with a rainshower as well as a wall shower system, a deep soaking tub that we sadly did not get to try out, and a separate, closed-off toilet area. It had all the upscale amenities one would expect from a brand that espouses luxury. The pool and beach - The pool was not crowded at all during our stay there. There were plenty of areas that provide a feeling of being secluded because of the way they have designed it. The lounge chairs were very comfortable and the water was a perfect temperature. The beach was beautiful and pretty much stretched from horizon to horizon, giving you the feeling you are truly in the middle of nowhere, which, of course, you are. The service - This is the area that has received the most negative comments about this resort. However, we found the service to be impeccable. We never had to wait long for anything that we asked for. The only exception was at the pool, where service tended to be slow. However, we were at the pool to relax, not to rush through things, so we did not find this very bothersome. Everyone was incredibly friendly and warm, from the butlers you spoke with on the phone to the custodial staff you would see ocassionally. They gave me a feeling that they genuinely cared about their guests and want to do what they can to make life easier for us. Every time they pulled up our car to go out of the resort, they would make sure that they gave us two bottles of cold water before we left. Whenever I requested something, the response was always "but of course Mr. Vasavda". There were a few instances of service that really stood out to me and are indicative of the type of service one can expect here. We told the staff that we were there to celebrate our 10th anniversary. On the day of our anniversary itself, upon coming home in the evening from dinner, we saw that they had left chocolates and a bottle of red wine for us, along with a hand written and very thoughtful letter from one of the butlers. The day before our anniversary, I had also mentioned to the butler staff that I wanted to do something nice for my wife for our anniversary, but for the day after our anniversary because we would be too full. We decided on getting some chocolate covered strawberries. When we came home the next day after our anniversary, we saw chocolate covered strawberries along with a "Happy Anniversary" written in chocolate, and a letter saying the things I wanted it to stay. However, they also had given us a bucket of ice and yet another bottle of wine (white this time). Despite originally stating that there would be a charge for the strawberries, they never charged us for them, nor for the wine. The pool staff, upon learning it was our anniversary, would not let me go back to my room without giving us two glasses of champagne on the house. They truly went above and beyond to make our anniversary memorable. The food - We only ate lunch at Molasses once and lunch poolside a couple of times. The food was very expensive, but at least it was good. The drinks were very very expensive ($18-$20 for most cockatils), but also were very good. We did not eat at Fern, their signature gourmet restaurant as we prefer to experience local food when we are on vacation. Overall, we had a very memorable, romantic, luxurious, and relaxing trip at this resort, in no small part to the wonderful staff. I can't wait to go back with the kids sometime in the future. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone who is planning on visiting Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property and great service”
Reviews.Author: lloliveto
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I spent 5 days and 4 nights at this beautiful new resort. The service was excellent. All were very sweet to our little girl who had a fantastic time. It was a rainy week but we still managed to enjoy the property. Noel was awesome! He invited us to see the leather back turtles being born which was wonderful to see. He also brought dvds during those rainy days. We wished to see more of Puerto Rico, specifically Old San Juan, but the weather did not cooperate. The St. Regis was a lovely hotel. The rooms were amazing. We were upgraded to a suite and received butler service. The food was excellent at all three restaurants, our favorite being Fern. One night at dinner, I was visibly cold and the host went to the gift shop to bring me a sweater. So very nice and just an example of how attentive the staff was to our family. A great family vacation and we thank you! We also recommend using Toursanjuan and Francisco for airport transport to and from the St. Regis. Great price and punctual.

Reviews.Title: “Total Luxury...But It Ain't Cheap!”
Reviews.Author: khaleesi87
Reviews.Content: We shouldn't have begun our 10 day trip to PR at the St. Regis because it was all down hill from there! It set the bar of luxury extremely high--cashmere blankets on the bed, 24/7 butler, bubblebaths drawn at your behest, 2 stellar TVs, private beach cabanas--but it was not cheap. Drinks were about $20 and not particularly strong nor delish, same with the food. After 5pm, Seagrapes (the eatery by the pool) closes so you're left with uber-fancy Fern or lackluster yet pricey Molasses to choose from. Our advice? Stop at the Ralphs grocery on the way in and pick up some booze and snacks. Another con is the wonky AC that wouldn't behave, so we just left it off all night. Plus, there is NOTHING to do after sunset, so bring some DVDs (not Bluray, they don't play) or drop $17 on an OnDemand movie. We're not exactly stingy, but $1,000 per night, a few freebies would be nice. But the St. Regis will nickel and dime you to death. Still though, it's gorgeous and relaxing beyond belief, wonderfully staffed and well kept. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A must visit destination”
Reviews.Author: nobull21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. The people are very friendly and the service is impecable. The staff goes out of their way to make your wishes come true. The rooms are very spacious and filled with every ammenity one could think of, including a television inside the bathroom mirror! From the main restraunt to poolside, food is fantastic and service was island friendly and relaxed. If you are looking for a quick and romantic (or family) getaway, this is your destination!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Beautiful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: jwskell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our trip to the St. Regis resort back last fall, around the time the property was set to open. We started to get a little wary once reviews started coming in, especially those about the service. The prices, we expected- after all, it is a St. Regis. But we weren't sure what to expect along the lines of service. We honestly could not have been more pleasantly surprised. I am not sure what kind of people are finding the service there unacceptable, but we thought it was the best we had experienced anywhere (and we travel often!). Every person we came into contact with was polite, attentive, and extremely helpful. Above all, they were swift. They made us feel welcome and truly at home in Puerto Rico, and helped make our stay even better with their willingness to give suggestions when asked what to do and where to eat. It was said to say goodbye to them, especially the wonderful people in the butler and valet services. The rooms are beautiful. Since the resort is still so new, everything is in great shape. And the bathrooms are massive- I've never seen a shower area so large! The grounds themselves are absolutely stunning. The property is extensive, and beautiful. Some reviewers complained that it is isolated, but we actually found it to be the perfect "base" for us- it was 20 minutes to the rainforest, 30 minutes to San Juan, 20 minutes to Fajardo- basically in the middle of all the locations we needed to travel to during our weeklong stay. I will say, if you have intentions of doing things outside of the resort- rent a car. Yes you have to pay valet charges, but driving in Puerto Rico is very easy and the hotel always provides excellent directions to all your locations if you don't have a GPS with you. Plus, it will save you a ton of money on taxis/meals by being able to eat off the resort. Some helpful tips for your stay: 1. Like I said, rent a car. It will allow you to truly enjoy your time there by eating locally and experiencing the sites that are close to the resort (there are many!) 2. Stop at Ralphs. The grocery store is right before the turn you make to go to the resort. The rooms have pretty decent sized mini-fridges; we stocked up on sandwich supplies, milk, cereal, fruit, juice, and snacks (along with wine) on our way in. Best thing we did all week! Don't worry about water bottles though; they give them out like candy 24/7 at the resort to keep everyone hydrated (which is wonderful!) 4. Go to the rainforest- El Yunque rainforest is less than 30 minutes from the resort, and it is completely free as long as you bypass the visitor center (they charge $3 a person, but you don't have to stop there unless you want to look around a see a video/get maps). The hikes are great, user-friendly, and they have great waterfalls throughout. Definitely a fun experience! 5. Eat at Marmalade- a restaurant in Old San Juan. We went a few hours early to see the fort/walk the streets which made for a great evening as Old San Juan is very charming (and safe thanks to police there for cruise visitors!). It is one of the best restaurants in the city for a reason. You'll get an amazing meal and still pay less than you would at the resort. Can't say enough good things about that place! 6. Visit Culebra- their flamenco beach is ranked #2 in the world. You can get there from Fajardo which is about 30 minutes from the hotel. You can either take a ferry for less than $5 a person (2 hour ride) or a plan for $40 a person (less than 30 minutes). We enjoyed the flight for the beautiful view and lack of seasickness, but know others who took the ferry without a problem. Just keep an eye on the clock because it only runs a few times a day and if you miss it... you're out of luck. 7. Do the kayaking BioBay tour. Yes, glowing plankton in a bay sounds completely nerdy. But it was honestly one of the most amazing things we have ever done. Kayaking through the mangrove forest alone was pretty incredible, but seeing the water glowing around you at night is truly magical. We used Kayaking Puerto Rico for our trip and had a great time; I recommend doing the 6:30 tour so you get the best of both light and dark in your trip (otherwise you'll never see the mangroves well!) Trust me, you don't want to miss it! Overall, we had a fantastic trip and loved every day that we got to spend at the St. Regis. If you aren't an overly high maintenance person who enjoys a beautiful resort with friendly people, you will love this place. Hope to come back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mountinfun
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely gorgeous, new hotel. It is set in a nature preserve bordering on a rain jungle and the ocean. The golf course is not only beautiful, but well manicured and challenging. The surrounding neighborhood (outside of the gated property) is typical Puerto Rico. In otherwords, you are in a paradise surrounded by not so wonderful local environs. The St. Regis Service tries very hard and, for the most part, delivers. A high point is the Plantation stly main building. The Bar serves delicious drinks, and the food is interesting and tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Will not go back”
Reviews.Author: brooks44
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the st. regis in april, just after prime season and great weather. My wife and I have been to many 5 star high end resorts. The St Regis facilities are beautiful and first rate. Fabulous beach, great pool. Rooms are great. Spa is very good. Gym is large and nice. Restaurants all pretty. The amenities are all there. The service at this place is the pits. This place charges top dollar, but does not deliver. Every aspect of the resort outside of the physical plant is sub par. They nickel and dime you every minute. Starts with daily resort fee of 60 bucks/day. At this price point-900-1300 bucks per night, just charge another 60 bucks and not call it a resort fee. But jeez, another $420 just to use the chairs and beach?? At the bar the drinks are pricey, top shelf cost me $23 for a drink. BUT they measure the booze in a shot glass as they make it. ( a pet peeve of mine- just pour a nice drink). car services are prohibitive and make you not want to leave and explore. they even charge you to park if you rent a car. Service is abhorable. my room phone did not work, they didnt fix it. Air conditioning is on a motion detector so at night it gets hot. you can disable it but you have to call. made the call first day, and it took 2 days before they got it right. I clogged the toilet early in the am, called to have that taken care of. left for the day, and had some guests come by and told them to use my room to shower before dinner while i was at the spa. I get a call from my guests that my toilet was clogged....very embarrassing, and the worst thing was the room was cleaned and made up. Cleaning crew actually came in and ignored a clogged toilet. Irate I went to the manager who agreed it was unacceptable, and offered to comp me a night. at check out that guy was no where and there was no indication of the arrangement, and despite my arguement with them they charged me and I got no comp. Wait staff seldom comes around at the pool you have to get up to order. You have to adjust your own umbrellas etc cause they are rarely around and if they see you doing it yourself ....let you. This place is no 4 seasons or One and Only although they are priced in that range or even higher. At the spa, no male attendant at any time i was there in the locker facility. I was scheduled every day for a week in the spa. Turn down service was requested for after 7pm while i go to dinner. Would come back from the pool after the day at 6 and the room was already turned down. took 3 days for them to get it right. This resort was as pricey as it gets, which I have no issue with, BUT at least deliver the service that ALL the other fine hotels and resorts deliver. I had a great time with my wife, cause the place is so close to NY, easy plane ride, etc. The weather was great. The food was good, although they dont have enough choices. You must leave the resort a few times, and any ride out is at least 60 bucks, and if you want a private car forget it. I would suggest that at this price point one should go else where. Also part of my reservation included a room upgrade. Of course they told me that there was nothing else available. Resort was far from full. Additionally on plane ride out I spoke to a couple who arrived on my inbound plane etc. They booked a King bed in the same room I had. They checked in after I did and were told there were no rooms with a King at that type. I must have gotten the last one. They were put into a suite, but charged for the room upgrade, and told it was pay for the suite or take the room with 2 queens. This meant there was a room upgrade available for me, they didnt offer it and lied. Had they given me my upgrade the other couple would have had their room with a King. And can you imagine not having the requested accommodation, and told you had to pay for the upgrade. You go on a 10-15 thousand dollar/ weeks vacation and cant sleep in the same bed with your wife, or you have to pay 300 bucks/night extra to have that pleasure all cause they ran out of the room. This place was absurd when it came to catering to guests, and I wont ever go back to a st. regis if I can help it. You just dont get this at other fine resorts and hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great food and service”
Reviews.Author: sbkPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel, with wonderful food and service. Facilities for meetings are nice (large room for meeting; decent chairs for sitting all day; good projection equipment). There is a good program for kids, and the beach is beautiful. Kids love the pool. Golf course is close (you can rent a bike or golf cart to get there) and it is wonderful. Only negative comments: No taxis at the hotel. The hotel staff have to call a taxi from San Juan so you pay double ($67 both ways to San Juan). There is a good limo car with helpful driver but also expensive and has to be reserved in advance. Or you can rent a car on site. But you aren't going to be taking a quick trip to a nearby village cafe. Vacation rental: We rented two beautiful apartments from a company co-marketed with the St. Regis. We didn't realize that they were owned and operated by a different company than the hotel. One family had to cancel a few days before our expected arrival due to serious illness. The rental manager (Jarida Encarnacion) insisted that we pay at least three days (over 1K). Also some of the prices are not apparent, e.g., golf cart rental fee; we thought it came free with the apartment. Since we rented through a business that was meeting at the hotel (a major meeting), we asked the hotel to adjudicate.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: LLT512
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over the long Fourth of July weekend. Upon arrival, we were thrilled by the expansive, breathtaking property and the attentive service upon check-in. Little did we know that would be the last decent service we would receive for the entire five-day stay. First, we could never get through to the concierge desk on the first try. We would often have to call several times to get someone to pick up the phone. When someone picked up, he or she was often rushed or unhelpful. Second, none of the staff could recommend anything to do off the property. While I understand wanting guests to spend as much time and money on the property, it was somewhat ridiculous. Third, the service at Fern was equally unimpressive. Our waiter abandoned us halfway through the (mediocre) meal and none of the replacement waiters ever asked if we needed anything, or whether we were enjoying the meal. Fourth, the wait service at the pool was unbelievably bad. I had to hunt down the waitress to order a drink. We also ordered water, which never came. All in all, a poor value proposition. I will not return. Melany the bartender at the Plantation House and the crew at Molasses are the only reason this is not a 1-star review.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Tatiana1971
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. If you are looking for a beautiful retreat away from city madness, this a place for you. It is perfect for romantic getaways. The rooms were gorgeous and staff was friendly and courteous. The hotel nests amidst rain forest and is right on the beach. The views are incredible. I loved everything about being there. Including Remede bath products. We later had to move to Ritz Carlton in San Juan and that hotel pales in comparison with St.Regis.

Reviews.Title: “It is pretty nice, but uneven quality for price”
Reviews.Author: Virginiatraveler56
Reviews.Content: Beautiful facility. Staff tries hard, but things just fall through- calls not answered, message not returned. Food ranged from great to so-so. Nice pool, beach ok. Rainforest, San Juan, luminescent bay nearby. All in all not up to the standards implied by it's cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: tderry0581
Reviews.Content: I organized a trip for seven couples over Memorial Day for a long weekend. Given I was organizing all the details for the entire group, I would say I was somewhat demanding of the hotel concierge and the hotel staff. Overall, our entire group was very pleased with the rooms, pool, restaurants, and hotel staff. As the person planning the trip, I couldn't have been more happy with the attention I received prior to arrival and throughout our stay. As a platinum Starwoods member, my wife and I have stayed at many St. Regis properties. I would easily catagorize the Bahia Beach property as top notch and also consider the entire staff to be best in class. I have no concerns recommending the property to other travelers. I would also suggest reaching out to the concierge staff prior to your arrival to set up any and all events that may be of interest to you. I would be remissed if I did not specifically mention Jossell Valasquez, the main hotel concierge. Jossell and I exchanged multiple emails and had multiple phone conversations prior to our arrival. In the end, Jossell ended up planning all the individual airport transfers for our entire group, pool cabanas throughout our stay, dinner reseravations at the St. Regis, a Saturday night away from the hotel into Old San Juan (limo and dinner reservations included), and a private birthday dinner at Fern. Literally all of our requests were met and all of our needs were taken care of over the weekend. Thanks to the entire staff for a great trip. Sorry for taking so long to post the review. Can't wait to visit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, secluded property”
Reviews.Author: GRT13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week with our 14 year old daughter and her friend in a beautiful St. Regis suite. The room was spacious, allowing us our own room and large bath and the girls the living room with a pull out couch as well as their own bathroom. The large balcony in the Casa Atlantico, building 12, had an nice view of the Atlantic ocean. The property is spacious, connected by wooden walkways and beautifully landscaped with tropical plants; so spacious, in fact, that we usually felt like we had the place to ourselves! It can be a hike from one area to the next but I enjoyed the walks! However, if we didn't want to walk, the staff was always available to pick us up in one of the property's golf carts and shuttle us around. I really noticed, and appreciated, the staff's willingness and graciousness. The butler service called every day to ask if we needed anything and the guys at the plantation house (the main lobby area) were always helpful with bags and information on where to go.

Reviews.Title: “World class surroundings, great staff but penny pinching policies”
Reviews.Author: bladerama
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this resort is beautiful, great design incorporating the natural surroundings. There a lots of staff around who have clearly been through some great training and are friendly to boot. Little things grated on me here that smacked of profiteering. The valet parking was one, space is not something they are short of and I had to walk past my car to go to the valet to pay him to go back and bring me my car. Charging for something that adds value is ok this is anti service. Also getting service around the pool is not so easy and the gratuity situation around private dining is misleading, 22% gratuity is added (of which 5% is retained by the hotel ~ why not add it to the food) + $5 delivery + tip. It is not the amount, rather that it is not a transparent way of pricing and makes you feel like you have to be watchful which is not nice when you are relaxing. These, I suppose, are policies which are not set locally and so should not reflect on the great people working there, but they do make it a bitter sweet experience for just a few extra dollars profit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel. Inattentive Service.”
Reviews.Author: Lucy77
Reviews.Content: Overall, the St. Regis is a gorgeous property and we had delicious food. However, the service for a 5-star resort was inexusibly poor and worse- inattentive. Sadly the list of service hiccups is much longer than the positives. We traveled in mid-May to the St. Regis to celebrate my husband's 40th birthday for a long weekend. Prior to arriving, I had a lot of e-mail back in forth with staff, which was great- until it wasn't. I happened to call the hotel the Weds prior to our Fri arrival- only to find that nothing I had filled out on my pre-arrival form was completed (no car service, no restaurant reservations, no spa times, no cupcakes for my husband, etc.) That day the conceirge kindly took care of things, but had I not called... I am not sure what would have happened when I had put so much into surprising my husband. We arrived at the lovely property but had to wait almost 20 minutes to check in- just sittting in the lobby. The room was gorgeous and big, especially the bathroom. We were on the ground floor facing the pool area, but shielded by lovely tall tropical gardens. The room and patio were absolutely great! We had breakfast out there every morning- with no issues. I had set up Fern for my husband's birthday dinner. However, the service was inattentive at best. We saw a party of 8 walk out since our server had 1/2 of the restaurant to cover. The food was delicious- but the service was so bad that we left before dessert- on his birthday- no less! The pool area is lovely and there is plenty of seating, again the issues were no food or drink service. I saw some free cold drink samples come around at one point, but they ran out before they got to us and they never re-appeared. Now onto the spa... again lovely space, good massages, poor service. We booked the 'Honeymoon Package' in the couples villa- however, that simply entailed getting your massage there. No use of the patio or hot tub- this was not accurately reflected in the services description. I was told we could book more time there if we paid for it. Included in the package was lunch (which we again had to wait 20+ minutes for them to set up- which they knew when our services were ending (yoga session)), but since it was raining they set it up back in the villa for us- but at that point with the rain- there wasn't much point. Last gripe with the service was as we were departing, none of the 4-5 people at the entry could find/go get our luggage which was in storage despite repeated requests and the car service waiting for us. I had to track down Anthony, who dropped it off, to find it for us. The only bright spots in our service experience were: the conceirge, Molasses- we had an amazing waiter- attentive- helpful- and delicious food and Anthony, bellman/golf cart driver- welcoming and informative, room service was also great- I loved this pulled prok sliders at Molasses and with a bit of an extra wait- they brought them to me- yummy! The grounds are beautiful and the food is delicous. But the service left much to be desired. I would love to visit the property again, but the service will likely keep me from doing so- sadly.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort and getting better”
Reviews.Author: mdr9
Reviews.Content: OK I have read a ton of reviews and it was fun to experience the resort knowing the goods and the not so goods. First off the resort and its grounds are awesome, very rainforest. The rooms are great, huge and very nice. I would say that the rooms are the major selling point for this resort. We thought the service was very good and we never really had a problem. The only time we even came close to service problems would be a the restaurants and timely service, but we were on vacation and this is just island time. We did take numerous pointers from people and have some tips of our own. First off if you are traveling to this resort expecting PR to be a typical Caribbean island, you will be disappointed. The beach is very lackluster and the water looks more like Galveston than a Caribbean island. If I had one key complaint it would be for the location of resort. If this resort was where the Westin is in St. Maartin it would be unbelievable. The prices are fairly typical of a high end resort and we are Starwood Gold members and stayed on points so we have no real complaints about the high room prices. For point wise it was OK but I think the other Caribbean Westin hotels are a better value for points based solely on location. The rooms and grounds were unbelievable. On the grounds we ate at the pool restaurant Seagrapes and our favorite was Molasses at the golf course. We thought it was very good and not as expensive as Fern. We also like to visit local places so we ate out a lot. Went to La Parrilla and it was OK but I wouldn't recommend. We also tried to go to Pasta y Pueblo but that place was pretty hard to find, it literally was a shack with about 5 table. We love those places but our schedule didn't let us try but I would try, the menu looked good. We did have a great meal at Ay Bonito grill in the kiosks. Highly recommend, had a great meal and the Halibut was extremely good. I would suggest getting out away from the hotel and having some meals. I played golf and the course is fun. Hardly anyone on the course so you play pretty quick. I though the pool was good and never had a problem with finding chairs etc. Almost everyone at the resort goes to the pool instead of the beach so it is by far the busiest part of the resort. Went to Old San Juan but it is about 45 minutes away and it wasn't really our thing. It is really cool old time building and the fort but has tons of tourist stuff and stores. We basically went down there to eat at Marmalade which we were told is one of the best restaurants in PR. It was great and the soup is to die for, highly recommend. We also went to the rainforest and thought it was a little overrated. The grounds at the resort are better than what we saw in the rainforest. It had some pretty views and nice waterfalls but nothing that great. It was an easy drive from the hotel so it didn't take that long. We did hike to the waterfall, about a 20 minute good pace hike to a waterfall. The waterfall on the side of the road is a larger waterfall so unless you are looking for a little exercise you can skip the hike. We did want to do the BioBay but it was all full and we didn't get to go. Heard it was pretty neat. All in all we had a very good and relaxing time. The resort was great and service was very good especially for a Caribbean hotel. I just wish they would of put this resort in a better location with pretty blue water. I gave the hotel 5 stars but would give Puerto Rico 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, amazing food and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: jvtrav
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent our 18th anniversary at this very special hotel and loved it !!! The developers and the managing director were able to preserve the amazing tropical setting of a palm tree laden beautiful (and long!!!) beach with top of the line St. Regis accommodations. The beach is so long that we walked for 30 minutes and still didn't reach its end. The grounds and the golf course are immaculately maintained. From the moment that you arrive you know that you are at a very unique destination- the lobby is a gorgeous plantation style home with a very classy bar on the ground level and a top notch restaurant upstairs. And when I say top notch, I mean it- with Jean Georges Vongerichten as the executive/supervising chef. Every dish we ate at this restaurant was simply delicious!!! How can you make a simple split pea soup taste out of this world? I don't know how but they did it so I had it twice during my stay. The rooms are spacious, incredibly appointed with an elegant tropical feel. Yet with a spectacular bathroom suite and a great balcony to enjoy the sounds of the ocean. The bedding and environment are so serene that you will sleep like a baby. The main pool area with its adjoining restaurant are also beautiful- again a mix of casual elegance with tropical landscaping. The gaspacho was beyond delicious and so were the bloody marys and tropical drinks. So what about the service? I saw some postings that it was substandard. I disagree. Every single employee that we interacted with was friendly, attentive and trying to make sure that we were content. If you are looking for fancy with exquisite attention to detail, you might be disappointed. It is more like relaxed, please let me make you feel at home- straight from a humble heart without pretense. One of the best parts is that it's a quick flight from most eastern US cities followed by a pleasant 30 minute drive from the airport ( ask for the coastal route unless you are arriving on a Sunday). So if you want a tropical version of St. Regis accommodations in a beautiful beach setting with spectacular food, great golf and spa don't miss a visit to this spectacular resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could say good things but...”
Reviews.Author: Loves_Great_Travel
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I was puzzled by the range of reviews on this hotel. However, now that I have stayed there I understand it completely. Overall, I was left with a very negative taste in my mouth regarding the hotel, but I can see why some might enjoy. Let me give you the good and the bad. The good 1) The grounds are gorgeous. The property is brand new and the landscaping is incredible. You really feel like you are out in nature. 2) The concierge was very helpful. Joelle, I might have spelled it wrong, was really knowledgable, showed that he cared a lot and was full of good ideas about ways to spend our time. His personal touch was very much appreciated. The bad 1) Service. Honestly this was some of the worst service I have received at a hotel in a long time. I was staying for free on points, but would have gone ballastic if I had been paying. Examples. Ask for coffee to be brought to the room, told "your room is not one that can have coffee delivered to it, that is for suites only" However 4.5 hours later a full coffee maker shows up in our room. At the restaurant or the bar, it was like a roulette wheel for what you would get. Order a pizza day one, it has tomato sauce, the same one next day, no sauce. We ordered two of the same drinks at our table and they came out completely different. 2) A special shout out to the awful service at the Fern Restaurant - This was so bad it deserves its own category. The restaurant was half empty but we were still left standing outside for about 10 minutes. Then when the waiter made it to our table 20 mintues later the only emotion he conveyed was the look of contempt when my wife asked for tap water. The couple next to us had called a week in advance to sit outside, but somehow that was lost in the restaurant who sat them in the corner. No body ever came to check on us, nobody ever refilled "the above water glass." In general I have had better service in Denny's 3) The expense of everything. A personal pizza, burger and 2 drinks that's $100. The horrible dinner descibed above $150. Nothing is free here. They even charge you for parking $22 a day (in the jungle...really is parking room at a shortage here, I have paid cheaper rates at garages in NYC). I am sure this will show up on another review, but the valet at the property gave our friend's car to the wrong person so when they went to leave...voila no car (to be fair the hotel did eventually work it out and returned their car to the airport for them...but still). 4) Paper thin walls. I am in the jungle yet all I could hear was the thumping of the bass from my neighbor's stereo. 5) Even the activities didn't occur. I was excited to attend the cigar rolling. It was something to do but yet the class never materialized. After asking about 5 people the 6 of us who showed up for the class were told the teacher was sick. 6) Its remote. There is nothing else near it. I mean nothing. So you are pretty much trapped. If you go, you MUST rent a car. It is the only way to escape. One thing I do want to mention is that there is a great little restaurant up the road in Kiosk 21 "Ay Bonita!" Give that place a chance. It is inexpensive, great food and the people there could not be any nicer. In summary between the attitude given and the crazy expense of the place, I just can't recommend it even though it is beautiful. I can see how one can have a good stay here it is beautiful, but heaven forbid you should actually need something here. You just won't get it.

Reviews.Title: “RELAXING TIMES AT ST REGIS!”
Reviews.Author: CFNOBIS
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were planning on doing a lot of sightseeing on our trip but my wife had surgery just before we left, so we turned this trip into just a relaxing resort getaway. Like many others, we used points for our entire stay. If not, the cost would have been about $1k a night. I have never spent that much money for a room in my life and probably never will. So if it wasnâ€™t for Starpoints, we most likely would be staying somewhere else. I inquired about upgrading to an ocean front room before we left. I was told it would be $100 plus tax per day, but they only had one room left and it had two queen beds. As a result, we declined. The ocean front rooms are set so far back from the ocean, unless you are on an upper floor, the extra money may not be worth it. We took the red eye from L.A. to San Juan arriving at 9:30 am. After picking up the rental car we headed to the resort. There is a toll booth on the route to the resort; some have an attendant and some do not. The unmanned booth accepts coins only, so be prepared. The charge is $1.50. The drive to the resort was nice and fairly easy. There is a lot of construction going on for the new freeway that ends by the road to the resort. Getting there is kind if tricky but if you follow the directions on their web site, you will be fine. The entrance to the resort is hard to see from the road. I initially passed it and even when I knew where it was, I continued to pass it almost every time we returned to the resort. A sign on the road would be helpful. We arrived at the resort at about noon and were told that our room was not ready, so we waited out on the patio. It was only about 10 minutes until they came and got us and took us by golf cart to our room. The room was fantastic, as good as a room could be. We ended up in a garden view room, which was behind he pool area and faced a small jungle. The room is huge, especially the shower area. We could hear the waves hitting the shoreline even though we were not near the ocean. We arrived the Saturday before Easter and I believe the hotel was sold out, yet the hotel and facilities did not feel crowded. We spent most of the time at the resort, but ventured into town a few times for sightseeing and to look for places to eat as the food on site is very expensive. If you order still water, be prepared to pay $10 for a bottle of Fiji water. We dined at Fern three times for breakfast and dinner and Seagrapes twice for lunch for convenience and because the food was excellent. Dinner at Fern was one of the best meals I have had in a long time. Breakfast was good as well, and I highly recommend the French Toast. We enjoyed the Turkey wrap at Seagrapes and it is large enough for two to share. I would highly recommend looking at the menus on line for the pricing before you go as many people have complained about the pricing in their reviews. The only two prices that shocked me was $10 bottle of Fiji water at Fern and a $18 hot dog at Seagrapes. I will admit that I saw someone order the hot dog our last day there and it looked really good. It was a foot long with lots of toppings. If I were to stay another day, I might have ordered it myself just to see what a $18 hot dog tasted like. Service at the hotel for the most part was very good. Everyone was helpful and nice. We only had a couple of issues that normally I would not even mention but since this resort is a five star resort, I will mention them here. Our first lack of service was at Fern. We had dinner reservations at 6:30 and arrived a little early. At that time, we were the only ones inside the restaurant. About five minutes later another family sat next to us. The waiter took their drink orders and gave them bread. I asked the bus boy for some bread and later had to ask the waiter again. He told me it was being baked. We finally received it just as we were finishing our appetizers. I would think that since we had reservations and were seated first that they would have had the bread ready for us. Again a minor thing but this shouldnâ€™t have happened here. My wife was excited about getting fresh coffee delivered to the room in the mornings. She called the Butler to make the necessary arrangements and was transferred to another extension where the phone just rang and rang, no one ever answered at this extension. The last issue was when we were by the pool and wanted lunch. There was no attendant for so long, we finally walked to Seagrapes to order our lunch. When we returned, our towels had been removed by the attendant. We tried to go to the Kiosks for lunch or dinner as others have mentioned. However, every time we drove by, most or all of them were closed. I donâ€™t know if this was due to the holidays or the owners just come in when they feel like it. Needless to say, we never ate there. We asked our bellman about it and he said the same thing, they are always closed. Overall, our stay at the resort was excellent and will hopefully return one day. Even though we did not venture out far from the resort, we did go to the Outlet Mall and the Wyndham Resort, which has very nice grounds and many restaurants. The prices for meals there seemed more reasonable. PS: To the guy that lost his cell phone, donâ€™t blame the resort for your stupidity! This is an excellent resort that does not deserve the rating you gave it. Take responsibility for your own actions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Minus a Stolen Iphone”
Reviews.Author: NYCtravels21
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. Loved the staff. Loved the amenities. Did not love losing my cell phone at the pool and being told that no one on staff could find it (it was either on a beach chair or at the pool bar). When we called the phone it rang the first time and then went immediately to voicemail, which indicates someone shut it off. Minus many many points for the hotel staff pretending that the phone would be found and that it could not possibly have been stolen. Stinks to stay at a five star resort and have to worry where your possessions are at all times. No one has called me since I filed several complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great”
Reviews.Author: Ezrabourne
Reviews.Content: I'm a meeting planner who booked this property before it even opened. I planned my preconference visit for the end of April and started looking at some of the reviews. To say I was nervous would be an understatement. So for those who might also be reading the reviews and getting a little nervous...no need to be. The property is fantastic and the service was great. From check-in to check-out was all that I expected it to be. So I'll try to address some of the concerns it seems folks had listed in some previous reviews. Food costs at the resort restaurants - As someone who's job it is to stay at plenty of top-rated properties, the costs of food is pretty much on par with what you would expect at a property such as this. So if you are expecting to pay $6 for a sandwich, probably not the place for you. I had breakfast in Fern (their signature restaurant) and my only issue was that the waiter didn't just automatically refill my orange juice. Yes, petty...but for the price he should have been refilling after every sip I took. One reviewer suggested going to the nearby Walmart and stocking up. Best advice I've seen on the property so far. Better yet, there is a new Ralph's open by the intersection of 187 and 3. Plenty of options for any family or individual that may want to stock up. Kids at the pool - If you're going to a resort and don't expect to see kids at the pool then you really have a problem. They even have an Iguana Club that will take your kids for the entire day. There were kids at the pool, but the pool is huge. If you need some quiet or privacy, they would gladly put the a nice chair and umbrella down on the beach for you. Or do like I did and go lay in one of their many available cabanas on the beach free of charge. I also never say any shortage of available seating around the pool. Service - This was never an issue while I was there. My butler called each day and left a message with their name and number in case I needed anything. I hardly ever ask for stuff when at a resort, so this was never an issue for me. No need to run my bath or unpack my clothes. Location - the property isn't really as isolated as folks make it seem. It does seem a little far at first, but after venturing out the first day I was there it wasn't bad at all. Once the new highway section is completed, it will take about 20 minutes off the trip from the airport. The intersection where you turn onto 187 is a mess and you will drive right pass your turn if you're not paying attention. Beach - It's a little weird seeing so much open beach and hardly anyone playing in the water. There were some folks here and there, but most people stuck to the pool. The beach was great for my morning runs. Here is the catch 22 - if you get that nice ocean breeze comign off the ocean then the water is a little rough. If there is no wind, the water is nice a calm, but that mean hot and humid on the resort. Give me the breeze and I'll just listen to the ocean. Overall I had a great experience. I was very relieved and will be traveling back to the resort for a week at the end of June. I plan on renting a car from the airport, stopping at Ralphs, and enjoying a great property with great service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort, with a few minor issues”
Reviews.Author: mglass78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the St Regis Bahia with my wife for 6 nights and we had a fantastic time. The grounds are beautiful and the rooms are amazing. The resort looks like it was placed right int he middle of a rainforest and the builders did an exceptional job blending the property into the landscape. The prices are high, buit this should be expected from any high end resort. We made a trip to Ralph's, a local supermarket and did some shopping to mitigate some of the high prices. We purchased wine, liquor, breakfast items and some snacks which turned out to be a great thing. We did feel that the service lacked at times. We had one bad experience at Fern for dinner and got a little tired of hearing "yes" with nothing ever coming from the request. This problem was not uncommon, but certainly didn't occur at every request. Overall, I would highly recommend this resort and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Simplest Choice in Travel”
Reviews.Author: mikomiko58
Reviews.Content: This couldn't be simpler: with the St. Regis, PR, you are getting a spectacular hotel with everything you can ask for in a resort property, but you have to have a sense of humor about the service. The staff is polite and they try hard, my wife and I really liked everyone we interacted with, but they are truly learning how to be a luxury hotel with an untrained staff and it shows very clearly. A significant percent of the guests were extremely uptight couples from the NorthEast (it seems like 90% of the guests are either from NYC or Boston), and we witnessed multiple blow-ups along the lines of "we are paying $900 per night and expect better service than this". If you are going to have this expectation and attitude, which is completely reasonable given what you are paying and the hotel's brand, then definitely find somewhere else to stay: you are sure to be disappointed and you ruin your vacation as well be very annoying to other guests. On the other hand, if you go in with some patience and a sense of humor (and frankly just carry yourself like a nice person rather than an American colonialist) you are going to have a great time at this hotel. My wife and I have been to a number of high end resort hotels and this might the nicest one we've ever stayed at. The room are perfect (large, great balconies, amazing bathrooms), the beach and pool are wonderful, the restaurants are excellent, and the activities are really fun and mostly free. Activities (all free) include bike rentals for biking around the hotel grounds, various boats to go around the hotel's lake, tennis courts and equipment, and great walks around the hotel's bird sanctuary. My wife and I love animals and got huge kick out of the tons of iguanas and birds we saw all over the place. There is also a very nice (but not free) golf course on the property. The best restaurant is the one on the golf course, Molasses, though it's definitely better for lunch and drinks than it is for dinner. The food by the pool is solid and the drinks are great. In short, we loved staying at this hotel and highly recommend it, but only as long as you don't take yourself too seriously and can live with slightly comedic service.

Reviews.Title: “Not getting a bang for your BUCK”
Reviews.Author: Rurbani
Reviews.Content: I am not going to lie, the place is beautiful. However, everytime you turn around they charge you for this and for that. They are strictly by the book and cut you no mercy when it comes to the dollar. I went to the restraunt to pick up the food since rooms service had all these horrendous charges. Since, I placed the order to go they charged me a $2.00 hot food service fee. The food on the other was delish. This place does not have anything happening in regards to the social life. I would recommend this place for the older generation or if you are planning a family trip. Just keep in mind, this place will take you to the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and beautiful property -- some areas could be better”
Reviews.Author: ivanciment
Reviews.Content: I visited the property and checked things out, but didn't stop overnight. The rooms are very nice. I saw about 5 of them from different categories and they were all fine. The St Regis suites are a good bet. The views from the oceanview rooms are good; but the rooms are set back far from the beach. The gym was adequate and a bit disappointing. The kids clubhouse is adequate but not impressive. I think that for a resort that you expect to stay in and not to really leave, this place is adequate but lacks the sizzle. The landscaping is beautiful. The staff seemed quite outgoing and service oriented. I just think I'd be bored here if I came with wife and kids and expected to stay a few days. No kiddie pool either....I have plans to go to Las Cassitas this year and I didn't see reason to change the plans after visiting. Clearly the food would be better here but I'm not sure my family would have fun; I think this is a place that says it is for families but seems really for adults.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Oasis!”
Reviews.Author: KrannertPete
Reviews.Content: My wife, 11 month old baby, and I booked this property for 5 nights using points. I have read every review on TripAdvisor since booking the trip in December and never thought to "cancel based on the reviews here" as others have admitted. To give you a little profile of my family - my wife and I both work for a living and this vacation was more about spending time away with our daughter in a relaxing atmosphere more than anything. We don't make 7 figures as many of the other guests clearly do, and we would not have chosen to spend $1400/night at this resort if we were not using points. The $60/day resort fee did not irk me as much as many of the other guests - primarily because the Westin St. John (where we have also stayed "sans baby" has a similar fee). But I guess if I was shelling out $1400 a night the $60 cherry on top would bother me as well. Additionally, we are fine with "doing things ourselves"- in fact it makes us uncomfortable to ask someone to unpack our bags, or come to our room and serve us coffee. We iron our own clothes, walk to get our coffee ourselves, and generally straighten our room up before we depart for the day to make it easier on housekeeping. I mention these things above because I feel like this resort gets a bad rap on this site based on service alone. Based on my everyday life, the service was great. However to the small percentage of the guests who traveled with their nannies or personal assistants, and expect to have their shirts ironed for them by someone else they may tend to ding this property, and I guess rightfully so. Now onto my review... The bad: -It is tricky to get to, and a little scary the last 5 miles. Don't be discouraged however, paradise is right around the corner. -Food /Drink prices are outrageous and the selection is limited (See Tips below). -While we did not have this problem personally, we met a few couples who complained of poor service at Fern. Apparently they only had 2 waiters working at a time (one inside, and one outside) which resulted in long waits for food. Additionally, one couple we met indicated that the first 2 bottles of wine they ordered were sold out. A restaurant of this caliber should add an addendum to the wine list to call out wines that are out of stock. -Pool umbrella's were a hot commodity. If you did not get to the pool by 8:00 to reserve your seats you would be stuck in the blistering sun for the day. For some reason they donâ€™t have enough umbrellas to cover each pair of chairs. The Good: -Amazing Grounds. They are so expansive you really feel like you have the place for yourself - with the exception of the pool which is brewing with guests - not in a bad way, however. -Great for Kids. There were lots of children here, clearly having a great time. Pablo was especially great in talking with the kids and letting them feed the Koi in the pond at the entrance to the Plantation house. -Huge and nicely appointed rooms. We had a standard Garden View room and it was amazing. The shower alone is nearly 40 square feet. The walk in closet was great for storing our suitcases in an effort to keep our room looking tidy. We had 2 double beds which were very comfortable. The outdoor balcony was huge with a nice dining table and couch to relax on. We had a wetbar/sink in the main part of the room as well which included a SubZero mini fridge. We had no problem with the AC noise as many others have mentioned. -Friendly staff. Everyone who works at this place is happy and accommodating and greets you with a warm smile. We asked one of the bellmen what the guest to employee ratio is. He indicated there are 134 rooms at the property and a little over 800 employees. I have to guess, however, that half of those employees are gardeners. Tips: -On your way to the resort, stop at the Super Wal-Mart. Normally when you get to Route 3 you turn right to get to the resort. Instead, turn left and after about 100 yards the WalMart will be on your right. This Wal-Mart has a grocery store in it so there is no need to stop here and then stop at Ralphs as many have mentioned. We bought milk, cereal, granola bars, fruit, disposable bowls, Cheese & Crackers, Rum, Mojito mix etc here so we could have breakfast and cocktails each day on our balcony.
