An easy, domestic, non-stop flight lands you in San Juan and the St Regis is only a 20-25m drive away (I say this from experience!) The hotel car service is expensive ($168 each way + tip) so if you have more time, or perhaps rental car elite/convenience status, a rental car is not a bad idea. I think parking is included in the $60/day resort fee. The hotel is situated directly in the middle of 2 miles of pristine beach which is outstanding for beach walks. For a moment, you can get away from the other guests and feel like you're on your own island. There is one pool and a designated 'beach club' area. The hotel only has 139 rooms so there aren't too many people around (yet... Residences are under construction). The pool bar and service are great. The pathway music was loud at times for guests lounging on their patios but you can't hear it once you go inside. We never figured out what they're trying to cover up with the ambience music. There are 3 restaurants and we sampled each of them. Fern was outstanding (killer Octopus) and Seagrapes offered very good beach/pool fare (ask for the Mahi Mahi sandwich as a wrap instead). Molasses had a limited menu but you should order the Mofongo - so you don't need any other options! There are people who have complained about the F&B pricing throughout the hotel but you have to remember that you're at a St Regis. The prices are high, but the quality is superb and the portion sizes are very generous. The spa was the only sore spot of our trip and I can see where earlier 'a lot of potential but...' reviews may have originated. Once the same attention that has been applied elsewhere reaches the spa, I'm sure that I will change my mind. In short, there were some lapses in service and my masseuse did not provide the 'deep tissue' massage I requested so it was a bit of a waste of $200 (60m massage). In summary, the hotel is too easy to get to for us not to return! If you're looking for luxury that's quick and easy to reach (all you need is a driver's license) - you would be a fool to go elsewhere. We thought about the Ritz-Carlton for a moment and I'm glad that we didn't select them. The Ritz-Carlton is directly adjacent to the airport and surrounded by a Courtyard and a Chili's. That does not spell "luxury beach getaway" to me! Go with St Regis!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing beauty!”
Reviews.Author: LadyAnguilla
Reviews.Content: Still going through growing pains, but the staff could not be more accommodating. Food at Fern is a bit salty so I would recommend asking for no salt ahead of time. Rooms were neglected for turndown service for two out of five nights that we were there. Pool was not cold at all inspite of previous reports. Beach is beautiful but needs a bit more tidying. All in all it was an amazing place and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible resort - can't wait to go back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jbef333
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from an amazing week at the St. Regis. We were cautious about booking a trip here after reading some of the earlier reviews. Bottom line- do not hesitate. It was amazing! The resort is absolutely gorgeous and so relaxing. The pool, beach, and spa are magnificent as are the meticulously groomed grounds. Book a spa service and spend some extra time at the spa before or after- it is well worth it! We used the free bikes, kayaks, and paddleboards which were a blast as well- the only downside to the paddleboards and kayaks are that you are limited to a cove that smells and is on the small side so that you go around in circles. But it was still a fun late day activity as was walking the gorgeous beach. The room was gorgeous, and I had the best night sleep I have ever had at a hotel. The halls were silent and we did not hear a thing! The only complaint that we agreed with from earlier reviews was the food situation. We ordered lunch from Seagrapes on the beach every day and it was wonderful- no complaints at all. Dinner is another story. We ate at Fern twice- the first time we had incredible service (this is a shout out to Miguel- he deserves a promotion!) and a wonderful meal. The next time we went to Fern they ran out of lobsters, the food was salty and dry, and the service was fair. Same with Molasses-salty, dry food and fair service. But the setting was so gorgeous we did not even care. The other thing that hampers your dinner options- the St Regis does not allow cabs. Thus, to go off property you have to either rent a car or take a car service-both of which get expensive. We went to old san juan for a day and night to eat and gamble and to la parilla in loquillo- otherwise we stayed at the resort. It was hard to leave paradise so we really did not mind. In the end, if you are looking to relax, spa, sun, etc. this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: jfox724
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the St. Regis for 5 nights (2/13-2/18). We loved every minute at the property. First - it is a beautiful property. The landscaping (everything from the walkways to the plants and trees) was amazing. They somehow hide the true size of the property through the use of trees, etc to make you feel as if where you are is the only part of the property that exists. It's a little hard to describe, but you'll understand when you see it and you walk around the property and realize how big it really is. Second - we found all of the staff to be very friendly and accommodating. Based on previous reviews we didn't use the concierge service so I can't comment on some of the other guests negative experience there. I can tell you that whenever I needed anything on the property, there were plenty of people willing to help me figure it out. I also had very positive experiences with the butler service. Getting coffee from them in the morning can be a small issue as they are not as timely as you might like, but overall they were very helpful. Pros 1) Walking trails around the property are beautiful. Grab a trail map from the concierge and it will take you through a tour of the extended property. The trails are well marked, mostly paved and have lots of signs describing the local trees, bushes, etc. The trail goes through a nature preserve and bird sanctuary. We walked each morning varying our route between the trails and the beach (you can walk 20 minutes in one direction on the beach and see almost no one). The nature trail is probably 3 miles long if you start at the plantation house. 2) Food is excellent. We ate at Seagrapes for lunch each day and Fern for dinner. While the meals at Fern ran about $125-200/night for the two of us + wine, it was very high quality food and we didn't run out of things we wanted to try on the menu. For those of you that use Open Tables.com for reservations, Fern is a member and you can get points. Also, if you do it that way, you can bypass the concierge which others have noted is a problem. We had no issues with our reservations and were able to do it weeks in advance and get the times we wanted. 3) Beach and pool areas have plenty of chairs with shade or sun. My wife and I were able to work it where she had sun and I had shade for the majority of our stay. 4) Staff are very warm and nice. Their friendliness didn't seem forced. We especially enjoyed the waitstaff (restaurants and plantation bar). They are very nice people and we enjoyed talking with them. 5) Rooms are large and the patio is great (we had a superior king with garden view). There is a large couch on the patio to read and relax and there is a table with two chairs to eat or have your coffee. We spent most of our time in the room on the patio. The bathroom was nice with dual shower heads (rain shower + normal shower). There is also a large soaking tub. Cons 1) you can get isolated out here. You'll need a rental car to get off property to visit El Yunque or eat somewhere else. 2) Air conditioner in rooms are loud. I found the constant blowing to be white noise that didn't affect me (it doesn't turn on/shut off but blows constantly), but the blower is located just over the bed and I can could see where light sleepers or those sensitive to fans/noise could be annoyed. My wife was bugged a little by it but not enough to detract from her sleeping well. 3) bugs. I am one of those that mosquitos seem to like and when I sat outside at dusk, I was bitten several times. Over 5 nights, I probably had 25-30 bites. Fern does keep bug spray available if you sit outside which helps or bring your own. Also, if you avoid dusk, you miss most of the problem. 4) I am a platinum starwood member. I did not get an upgrade at this hotel. The hotel was full, so I guess I shouldn't be too surprised, but if you book a garden view and think you'll get upgraded at check-in, I wasn't. 5) pool/beach beverage service. It's not like I was on spring break looking to do shots before noon, but there isn't any beverage service (water/soda/alcohol) at the pool until Sea Grapes opens at 11am. I thought this was a bit odd. 6) The pool is situated a little strangely for the following reason. The cabanas ($300/day) are located by the only area of the pool with a zero depth entry (re: this is where all the babies and small children play). I can't imagine being a couple buying one of these cabanas only to be situated right next to the kids play area. Conversely, if you have young children with you (we did not), the pool seats right next to the zero depth entry area are reserved for the cabanas therefore you would have to sit elsewhere and walk over to that area to play with your children. If you are looking for quiet, avoid this end of the pool. As noted in other reviews, the pool is situated in a way that you really can't tell how big it is from any one view and if you sit closer to the beach, you won't be near the kids play area. Overall this was an outstanding property and we have it on our list of places to get back to eventually.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous all around.”
Reviews.Author: potlowmi
Reviews.Content: The location of St Regis Bahia Beach Resort was private and luxurious. The tennis courts were available although quite warm by noon. Water was provided and a great tennis pro was on site. He provided names of other guests looking for partners to play. He also arranged a tournament which was great. The employees are well trained and educated, they enjoy their relationship with the clients making the stay luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “The first true 5-star property in PR - but with MAJOR service issues and poor value.”
Reviews.Author: ilikehotels77
Reviews.Content: I've been to Puerto Rico many times over the years. The St. Regis Bahia Beach property is heads and shoulders above every other resort on the island (note: I've never been to W Vieques). The property itself is stunning. It feels like an eco-resort--it has been built into the environment. The boardwalks over the lush plants are lovely. Gorgeous, spacious rooms (but with loud air conditioners). Lovely pools--though no lap pool for those who want to swim for exercise. The beach is incredible. Property-wise, it is 5-stars and a true St. Regis. BUT... The first rule for a 5-star hotel should always be: Only promise what you truly can deliver. The service is so spotty and erratic. At times, it is St. Regis. At other times, you might as well be at an airport Sheraton. They offer free coffee in your room delivered via butler service. The first 2 mornings, it took almost an hour to arrive. The 2nd morning it was cold. The 3rd and final morning, we placed our order the night before to be safe. When it was 15 minutes late I called--they had no record of the order and said it would be 30 minutes minimum. Not acceptable. When we went to the Plantation House to get free coffee instead--both mornings we did, the coffee pot was empty. It took 3 staff members and 20 minutes to actually get a hot cup of coffee on our final morning in the lobby. Outrageous and embarrassing for a St. Regis. They also proudly offer a complimentary Mojito made fresh in your room by a butler. That's great, but they don't warn you that the butler won't come for 1.5 to 2 hours. By that time we were more than ready to have left our room and would happily have paid for a mojito at the bar. Their centerpiece Jean Georges restaurant is FERN. We went the first night. I would never return. The service was APPALLING. Our waiter made a suggestion which we both took for our entree. 10 minutes later he returned and apologized--the chefs were out of that selection. He proudly recommended that we order a different type of fish but with the same preparation as the original--we did. Another 10 minutes later, he returned to say that the chef was out of "beans." We ordered again. At this point, I still had not received my cocktail that was ordered 30 minutes prior--this only came after I asked 3 separate other workers for it. Also, the caviar appetizer he recommended was so tiny it was more like an amuse-bouche. When the entrees finally arrived--he brought me the wrong dish. After we had had a whole discussion about the temperature and preparation of my dish--he brought something totally different. I sat while my friend ate and waited. No one EVER apologized. No comped desserts. No checking in from a manager. AND the meal was $200. AND the $28 tiny caviar appetizer I ordered was only $18 the following day. BIZARRE. I nicely shared my story 2 days later with Lisa at the front desk, who took 50% off the bill from dinner. The food and drinks are so overpriced at this St. Regis it is shocking. $10 for an iced tea. $18 for a hot dog. They need to get with it. I expect overpriced at a St. Regis but this is too much--AND when the service doesn't match the 5-star prices, it is BAD. The Remede Spa was lovely and well-run. Though I was the only customer there. Overall it was a decent stay--but only because I stayed on Starwood points. If I had been paying the $800/night quoted rate, I would have been really upset. Give this property another 6-12 months before you pay insane prices for it. If you get a good special or use points, go for it. Otherwise, take the longer flight and hit the St. Regis Punta Mita--which is on another whole level and is sheer perfection.

Reviews.Title: “5 star luxury but service must improve”
Reviews.Author: ogol17
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from 5 days at the st. Regis Bahia Beach. Like other reviewers, we seriously considered canceling due to the issues mentioned in past reviews, but we are so happy we didn't! At the end of the day and despite service issues that still exist, this is a superb resort that we wish we could return to often. However, while beingÂ a 5-star resort service issues are still too frequent, and especially the ridiculous, incompetent concierge service, which deserves 1 star at most for both attitude and effectiveness. I must note that the hotel management is aware of the service issues, and seems to be working to fix them while seriously listening to guests' complaints and compensating unhappy customers. On the good side: - Everything around the hotel is beautiful and luxurious - from the excellent room amenities (in a very large room), through amazing landscaping, buildings that blend with the natural environment, and excellent nature trails within the resort area. - the pool and the beach are both wonderful. Due to the many pool levels and bays, the pool area feels quiet and peaceful even when many people are around (which doesn't happen too often - during the week the resort felt rather empty, and only the weekend became somewhat busier). While pool water is not heated, we found it definitely warm enough to swim in. The beach is beautiful with the coconut palms set against the ocean, and the sand is clean, soft and nicely groomed every morning. If you walk along the long beach you quickly reachÂ secluded areas where you feel alone with the tropical forest and the ocean being your only company - just fantastic ! - Other than at the concierge, all employees are genuinely nice and seem to honestly care about you having a good time. This applies to employees all around the resort, and especially to restaurants staff and to the pool staff, who keep checking throughout the day on whether you need anything and pamper you with free treats such as smoothies, frozen fruit, cold tea etc. - All three restaurants are excellent. The Fern provides the most upscale and expensive food ($15-25 for most starters and $30-40 for entrees), while the poolside Seagrapes provides a tasty selection of pizzas, sandwiches and other light meals for prices that are mostly in the $10-25 range, plus a wide selection of drinks (but they are open mostly for lunch, catering for dinners only on weekends). Our favorite by far, however, is Molasses (at the golf club house) with excellent upscale Puerto Rican food, very large portions, superb service and more sensible prices than at Fern's ($10-20 for starters and $25-35 for most entrees). Having enjoyed our time as much as we did, we really wanted to rate this hotel with 5 stars, but service is still far from a 5 star level and we kept running into service issues throughout our stay. Some of the issues were smaller though still inappropriate for a 5 star property - for example the newspaper not being delivered to the room every morning, or the turndown service not showing up as requested. The biggest problem however is with the concierge, who are hard to reach by phone, unpleasant to talk to (with fake smiles instead of genuine wish to help), lack basic knowledge about hotel services, and are completely incompetent in fulfilling your most basic requests (such as confirming a table for the hotel restaurant next door).Â To avoid frustration and until the concierge staff learn their job, we strongly suggest that you avoid asking them to arrange anything (from booking a table at the hotel restaurants to calling a taxi), Â and instead get the phone numbers from them (hopefully they can at least get them right) and then make the phone calls yourself. As mentioned earlier, hotel management is very responsive to complaints and seems to be working to improve all aspects of service, so I am confident that those issues will be resolved shortly. Prices of both accommodation and dining will probably remain very high, but if you can afford them, this beautiful, peaceful, luxurious property is by far the best place to stay in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic resort, beautiful grounds friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lweiss9069
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple stayed there for five nights. Had a wonderful time, the staff could not have been friendlier and more helpful. The rooms were beautiful, beach beautiful, pool big and pretty with PLENTY of chairs. My only negative comment is that the food was quite expensive (to be expectef at this type of resort) and there are only two tennis courts. We did not encounter any problem reserving courts but expect at busier times of the year it might be a problem...Otherwisre I give this hotel a TEN.and I would like to go back again.....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: BeachE14
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the earlier reviews we considered canceling.That would of been a huge mistake.The resort is gorgeous one of the most beautiful spots we have been.Pool and beach service excellent staff very accommodating Luis at the pool and Ramon at seagrapes restaurant in particular.The food was very good overall in all 3 restaurants on the property ,but they could use more as there is no place off property close by to dine..Our room and bathroom wer really lovely .We had a oceanfront king on the second floor.One complaint the pillows very uncomfortable!.Golf was very good and very convenient being on the property.We enjoyed the nature trails and biking too. The spa facility is really nice.They also have spa treatments around the pool area and massage on the beach.We loved the frozen grapes,smoothies and cold towels given out poolside!This is a quiet resort if you want a secluded spot and plan on not leaving the resort you will love it .If you are looking for nightlife and action it is not for you.We can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, seculded, beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: SLC_54
Reviews.Content: My husband and I needed to get away from the unrelenting cold and a busy work schedule. The St Regis was just the cure. The hotel is beautiful with luxuriously appointed rooms and a lush, mature landscape design. The beach is seculded with a wonderful staff taking care of your every need. Because the hotel is on the Atlantic Ocean side of the island the beach is a little rough but the expanse of isolated beach is wonderful. Swimming can be done at the pool which is large, interesting built with many levels and areas, and not crowded. The spa was, like the rest of the hotel, beautifully appointed and the massage I had there was excellent. The gym has a separate area for classes but only one was given in the four days we were at the hotel. Food at the hotel is wonderful, especially at Fern, a Jean George restaurant. I must agree with a prior review that talked about the concierge service at the hotel. It was difficut to get a hold of them - I e-mailed prior to my leaving many times to get trips and restaurant reservations set up and had problems getting confirmations back which continued even when I was at the hotel. The only other draw back to staying here was that there were no restaurants worth eating at outside of the hotel. The trip to Old San Juan is 45 minutes which makes it a long trip just for dinner. This should be rectified shortly when an extension to the highway is completed which will shorten the trip to San Juan to 20 min. I highly recommend the hotel and would certainly return. There is no competition for this hotel in Puerto Rico - it stands out for its beautiful desing, luxurious appointments and wonderful, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “tipping policy is vague”
Reviews.Author: speish
Reviews.Content: this resort is beautiful and the service and staff is most attentive. the food is great but extremely expensive. I wish there were a tipping policy or that tipping was included in the room rate,as everywhere you went it was unknown who to tip or how much was sufficient.. this made for a very uncomfortable situation.Also to charge for parking was ridiculous. Tax and tip at 27 % was most excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: skyplane
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful time this past weekend at the St. Regis. The room was beautiful and well-appointed; service as generally excellent. I would highly recommend the hotel to others. That said, we had only a few complaints: On our first day we were locked out of our room several times. It took three trips to the front desk, a visit from the house electrician and elevating the issue to the manager the next morning before we were asked whether we had stored our room key next to our cell phone. It turns out that when a key is placed next to a cell phone it loses its electronic encoding. If we had been told that the first time it would have saved everyone. Leaving aside the restaurant prices, which are what you would expect from a St Regis property, the restaurant food was just average. Room service, on the other hand, was excellent. I know it comes from the same kitchen so there shouldn't be that big a difference, but execution on the 1 room service dinner and 2 room service breakfasts was substantially better than what we experienced at all three restaurants. Also, the service at the Jean Georges restaurant was not even close to what it should have been given the chef's pedigree and price point. We were unable to get onto the tennis courts during the morning hours all three days we were there. I understand they are building additional courts, but in the meantime you should definitely consider booking times in advance.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest places I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: Elias-Michigan
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere of the resort is so relaxing and pleasant. We stayed for 1 full week and enjoyed most all of the resort. The pool was fantastic with excellent service poolside. Fresh towels and chairs were abundant. We even ate our lunch a few times right at the pool. The spa was great. Again the atmosphere was relaxing. The staff at the spa wanted to make sure you were comfortable. We visited the spa twice and had customized treatments both times. The food was a real treat. We most enjoyed the Molasses as it had more of the Puerto Rican flair. The Fern was also very nice but a little loud indoors. We did enjoy breakfast on our balcony every morning. That was a real treat. The service at the restaraunts, in the main lodge, the bars and our room was spot on. We couldn't have asked for nicer treatment. I think that this hotel has really worked hard to work out the start up kinks that every new hotel has. My recommendation would be to sit by the pool, order a pinapple/kiwi Mojito, and dine on the mofongo. You really can't go wrong! The Elias Family - Michigan

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, quiet, secluded spot at a tropical beach”
Reviews.Author: alcw
Reviews.Content: We've been anticipating visiting this spot for months, reading almost every review. As many state, as a new resort, it is going through some growing pains. This is not a place for the budget conscious. If you're squeamish about money, this is not the place for you. However, if you want a gorgeous location, with great staff this is the place for you. There's no doubt the working staff are absolutely friendly, helpful and accommodating to your every need. They are still working through some process issues with management. The grounds and rooms are simply magnificent. The beach is spectacular with a great view of a small bay and a long wide beach perfect for walking. During our visit it was never crowded and there was always multiple staff on hand for ordering drinks, food or a towel. In fact overall, I marveled at the sheer manpower throughout the visit. There's no shortage of assistance during any part of our visit. We opted for a superior room. I loved the overhead shower and classic huge soaking tub. The daily french press cafe is spectacular and great part of the service provided by their butler service. Overall, when ever we called the Butler service they were extremely helpful and usually very prompt. We only had one occasion where we had to check on the status of an ordered item. The food was very good but nothing was amazing with exception of some chicken soup that we had specially made to order. Breakfast was disappointing and something that could be improved at this level. As stated before, the grounds are great and if you're an active couple there's plenty to do in a no stress environment. . We took advantage of the golf course, the bikes and the sailing. Take advantage of the resort fee and hit some 'free" balls on driving range (they will supply clubs), ride some bikes, play some tennis (they supply rackets) or take a kayak or sailing lesson. If you want to lounge a the pool or beach all day, this is a great place for that too. We visited during a time when we didn't see many children except for a few pre-school agers. Unless they come up with an adult pool only area, I can see how it would be annoying during holiday breaks. Generally the crowd during our stay was almost all couples or older families. There's little to nothing going on in the evening unless you want to rent an in room movie or sit quietly out on the deck. We opted for both of those but there is no nightlife here. This place could use a pool room. Rent a car if you want to make a trip to the rain forest, nearby restaurants or other attractions. It's a short ride to San Juan, but there's plenty of traffic to deal with during rush hour. Take that into account when planning your itinerary.

Reviews.Title: “This place is tops!!”
Reviews.Author: Dnsatty
Reviews.Content: We decided last second to book a five day trip to the Caribbean and all I can say is that I am so happy we chose this resort. Like many other tripadvisor readers, we were quite aware of the service issues the St. Regis had in the first couple of months they were open. It seems, however, that the management has rectified these issues and this is truly a 5 star resort. What baffles me is a few recent "bad" reviews on tripadvisor. They couldn't have stayed at the same resort as we did. The rooms are very large (the smallest is 750 sq. feet!) and beautifully appointed. The bathroom is larger than most bedrooms and is first rate. I know that many people have complained about the room air conditioners being a bit loud, but I certainly did mind it at all. First, you should definitely rent a car since you will not have to depend on taxis to take you to the resort or anyplace off the resort. We used Hertz and it was extremely convenient. The resort itself is so beautiful that it is almost beyond description. It is the site of an old coconut plantation and many of the original palm trees are still on the property. We were told that they planted over 1 million new plants and trees on the property (some 500 acres). The nature trails, golf course and beach are just something to behold. Although we didn't play a round of golf, we did go to the driving range/practice course and were able to hit golf balls without charge (we were given two sets of clubs and a golf cart at no charge). We also took out bicycles on a couple of days and biked around the entire property. It was just wonderful. Sailboats and kayaks are also available. My wife and I are avid tennis players and having a good tennis program is important to us. The St. Regis has two beautiful hard surface courts and we thoroughly enjoyed our time playing tennis everyday at the resort (there are three more planned). The tennis pro, Carl Gavine, is a superior teacher and pro and we took part in the daily clinics he conducts. We would highly recommend Carl, whether you are a beginner or an advanced player. He not only helps with technique, but he is very helpful with game strategy, either singles or doubles. The food at the St. Regis is excellent. The daily coffee is served free of charge. We ate at Fern, which is a Jean George Restaurant located at the St. Regis on two occasions. Although a bit pricey, it is as good as any restaurant in New York or LA. We also ate at Molasses, a restaurant at the golf course. It serves mostly Puerto Rican fare and it is also quite good. We did not eat at Seagrapes, the restaurant at the pool,but we heard from more than one couple that the food was quite good. Overall this is one of the finest resorts we have ever gone to. It is a service oriented hotel and it caters to all your needs. The staff is unbelievably friendly and attentive. Our advice is this: If you are looking for a Disney World or Atlantis type resort, this is not the place. Take the kids there. But if you are looking for a beautiful and secluded resort, with tennis, golf, bicycling, boating and beach, you have got to go to this place. You will not be disappointed. People complain about some of the high prices, but face it, this is a 5 star resort, not a Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, but service issues are absurd given the prices”
Reviews.Author: mrguard7
Reviews.Content: First off, this is a gorgeous property, with stunning rooms--you can see for yourself on the website. However, we are very glad that we are staying here on points, because the service has some issues to work out if they are to justify their price point. A few issues to note (after staying less than 24 hours). --We sent an email to the hotel email 3 days before our stay asking about airport transfer options, and never received a reply --When forced to call on the day of our departure to address the same question, we were transferred to the concierge desk, which rang to a phantom no-name voicemail box twice. We had to call back to actually get someone to to talk to us. --The "resort fee" is a ridiculous revenue grab at $60 per day, which just inspires annoyance as the hotel itemizes a charge for things that are clearly fixed costs, like bicycle use and supposedly "free" wireless internet. --We had to sit in the lobby for 25 minutes waiting to check-in upon arrival, even though the hotel is relatively small we arrived after the prescribed check-in time --We were told that our butler would be available to make a "welcome mojito" (part of the $60 resort fee) at any time of our convenience, but when we called just before dinner to cash in on this option, we were informed that it would be at least a half an hour wait for him/her to come around --We sat down in the lounge by the pool restaurant to have a drink pre-dinner, and after recieving no notice from servers for 15 minutes, decided to go elsewhere --The marquee restaurant, Fern, which has Jean-Georges as its headline chef, was only ok. Food was tasty, but the menus were not in agreement (some things not available that were on one of our menus), they were out of multiple items, and the service was snooty and extremely fast (our entree arrived within 90 seconds of our very large appetizer being removed from our seat, and before we had come close to finishing our first wine pairing). For a restaurant at a hotel of this calibre boasting the JGV name, we were unimpressed. These all may sound like minor issues, but when taken as a whole in the first 24 hours of interacting with a hotel, it certainly creates the impression that this property does not have its act together. We've stayed at a number of great properties, both St Regis (New York, Rome, DC) and other great hotels (Oberoi properties, Singita, etc.), and we feel that this property has the setting and the decor top notch, but the value for money and overall experience are off given the lack of customer service polish. I would recommend the hotel only if people are planning to stay on points. The $800 per night room cost is absolutely absurd given the extras that you will pay, and you will become annoyed that you are not getting more for your $$.

Reviews.Title: “what a fabulous vacation”
Reviews.Author: minnie979
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived till the second we left the service was out of this world. My husband and I travelled with our 3 children ages ranging from 11, 8 and 6. The weather was great and the amenities were great as well. When my kids wanted to buggy board they had them readily available at no charge for them. The service at the pool was great they had people walking around giving out frozen grapes to different shots of non alcoholic drinks as well as frozen towels to cool yourself off from the hot sun. The boat house was so much fun. we were able to take canoes out and surf boards with awes. We were able to fish and paddle boat. The rooms were clean and beautiful. Our room was always cleaned as soon as we left in the morning and every night the turn down crew always greated you with cold water bottles and extra bath towels. Every morning our personal butler brought french pressed coffee to our patio. All was like a dream and we highly recommend going to this hotel. We can't wait to return as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest relaxing vacation ever taken!”
Reviews.Author: vv4489
Reviews.Content: Amazing service, nicest staff, quite serene. Property a botanical garden. Great golf course. Didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, great staff, sweet stay”
Reviews.Author: JMG_11
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights at the St. Regis Bahia Beach with our 1 and 4 year olds. Like others, we were almost scared off by the reviews. So glad that we stuck with our plan. This is a top notch resort -- total luxury without being oppressive or overwhelming. Stunning pool and grounds. Beautiful stretch of beach which the hotel works hard to maintain. Many little details, such as beach toys on the beach for the kids every morning. A truly caring and attentive staff -- from the managers to the butlers to the maids to the waiters and hostesses in the restaurants. (Service may have been more spotty during the holidays but it was incredible while we were there). Elegant and comfortable rooms with incredible bathrooms. Negative reviewers must either be extraordinarily fussy and picky or looking to trash a new resort which is actively and aggressively working to create a relaxing and fun resort. Either way, don't listen to them if you just want some warm weather and a luxurious atmosphere. Keep up the good work St. Regis.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and tropical paradise”
Reviews.Author: rbgilder
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights here on SPG points. I will try to mention things that others haven't. LOCATION We drove from airport ourselves. We had no trouble at all. The highway toll road was first class. As you get to rio grande the traffic gets a little crazier. When you finally get on the country road it can get hairy. The resort is reachable by driving through cattle farms on a road that appears too narrow for two cars yet everyone goes 50 mph. A country road best served during the daylight. That being said, never got lost and used an iPhone turn by turn app with voice commands. I think it was x-drive. Walgreens is very nearby for some last minute deeds. As for car rentals, I recommend Hertz, avis of budget. They are at the airpor. Others like thrifty and dollar are pretty far away by shuttle. FOOD We only ate at the resort and at sea grapes and fern. Main tip is to be careful about of hours of operation as they are weird and change every day it seems. Sea Grapes, pool bar, was usually very good food with ample portions. Margaritas are fantastic. Sandwiches are great. Wife especially liked the gazpacho. We ate at Fern once. It was the best meal and on par with some of the superior choices back home in Chicago (like MK). Menu is small. But we had the filet and the salmon. But first was the amuse bouche of uffles and monk fish. Banana cake and chocolate cake were top notch. We wanted to ea outside and feel the breeze but the Mosquitos were horrible. It was the only place we ever saw one the entire five days. We asked to be reseated when they did without complaint. The bill was about $159 for two meals, two drinks, and desert. We didn't thi that was expensive for what we got. Lastly, room service one night. Chicken noodle soup was the best and a huge portion. Prawns were the biggest I have ever seen. Gnocci was over cooked/hard. BUTLER We called for the free coffee every morning. Usually took about thirty minutes but was tasty French press style. Also asked for them o come make us mojitos on the first night. Also free, but they were really bad so didn't ask again. Called them to borrow a DVD and the selection was very bad. Maybe ten choices all LAME. SERVICE We never met someone rude or not eager to help even when it was hectic. Always friendly. Ground crew, maids, waiters, butlers, etc. They called every day asking if we needed anything. Waitresses at the pool were always accessible and hustled for our orders. We also got the pool treats like frozen grapes or smoothies they hand out. They only thing to complain about is that the paper was only delivered three of five days. TIPS On the beach, watch out for broken glass once you leave the area right in front of the resort buildings. We found many sharp shards. The st Regis section was pristine. Use the gym. It's great with sweet televisions and net on each machine. Don't rush for the pool. Plenty of seats without being on top of peeps. The pool gets warmer in the afternoon. Never thought the temp was cold at all. QUESTION FOR YOU - TIPPING? Curious to hear what others think. Several times we were rebuffed by trying to tip the pool staff, valets. But they refused to accept. While another time a butler accepted. It was all very confusing about protocol. 18% is included in all food but beyond that didn't know what o do. Curious if here is a policy of them not accepting. COMPLAINTS Just one big one. The noise! The grounds are beautiful. But there was always someone with a gas motor working. Blowing debris off the walkways, power washing the sidewalks, etc. All five days. If they could spread that out a bit to maybe every other day would be nice. Others complain about the music they pipe everywhere. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Over the top including the prices”
Reviews.Author: peggyggg
Reviews.Content: Spacious room and beach. The ultimate A la carte experience. At $760 it is an additional $22/day to park a car, to use the sauna and steam @ the spa:$35 (but checking it out was not permitted), and a hot dog was $18 at the pool! it is remote so eating elsewhere is not practical. The staff is omnipresent and always smiling. The grounds are thoughtfully planted with millions of colorful plants. Miles to walk in the forest and along the beach. The pool area is spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “2 star resort”
Reviews.Author: patch813
Reviews.Content: This hotel/resort even though beutiful was the worst managed hotel I have ever been to. They just do not care about the client. The personel was extremly nice but the mangement really had no idea about customer service and follow up. This is suppose to be a high end St Regis hotel but I would put this particular hotel on the lower end of the starwood properties. The just are too many issues to list. If you are looking for a high end St . Regis DO NOT COME HERE go to the St. Regis Punta Mita.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect with a few "growing pains"”
Reviews.Author: plh66
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 10 amazing days at this beautiful resort and already thinking about a return trip. Most of the negative comments have some credibility but probably more a reflection of ones definition of "perfection". There are so many more positives that the weaknesses are easy to overlook and probably just some growing pains. There are a few things I would love to see improved. The restaurants are expensive but the portions are generous. There needs to be more diversity in the menus, especially for those of us who like to stay for more than a week. The menus at the three restaurants should be completely different from each other. The concierge quality must be more consistent and they must be available by phone- at least some of the time. I agree with the comments regarding the resort fee and the valet parking fee. We had a rental car and had no choice but to pay the daily valet fee, in spite of having the parking lot directly behind our room. I think it should be an option, not required. All in all it was a wonderful week in a beautiful property with some of the friendliest, most caring and considerate staff we have ever encountered anywhere. Don't hesitate to check it out and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay...Totally Worth the Hefty Price Tag”
Reviews.Author: rickydow1
Reviews.Content: Just leaving after a wonderful, 5-night stay at the St. Regis Bahia Beach and wanted to write a review to better express our gratitude. I have stayed in wonderful resorts all over the world, but really nothing that has compared to this property. While the prices are not cheap, the overall experience is amazing...and totally worth the price tag. Upon arrival, you're greeted by scores of smiling faces, all eager to help with bags, directions, coffee...whatever you'd need. In some cases, this level of attention cab be a bit overbearing, but not here. The staff was helpful when we needed it, and stayed out of our way when we didn't. Big, fat props to Ramon and Carlos...two young staff members who went WAY beyond the call of duty and made our stay even more special. Beyond the staff, the resort is truly one-of-a-kind. The grounds are impeccably maintained, the beach is ridiculously perfect, and the rooms/facilities are second-to-none. Further, the food at Seagrapes and Molasses (didn't hit Fern) was fantastic. Make sure to try the chicken mofongo at Molasses. Overall, an amazing experience that we hope to repeat several times over.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing luxury”
Reviews.Author: das317
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this tropical paradise a day early from NYC to escape the ice and snow. Our reservation specified a ground floor room but reception insisted there were none available. The manager was called and he graciously found us one but this was not a good start.. The room was lovely, spacious and comfortable. There was a covered patio with a table, chairs and two person chaise longue were we had our breakfast every morning. There are several restaurants- one by the pool/beach area, a Jean Georges high end place called "Fern" and a Puerto Rican style restaurant called Molasses. Meals at most of these places was unremarkable, while every Fern meal was outstanding. The wine prices at all the eateries are very expensive. The grounds and facilities are all very far apart so we used the pickup serve provided by the hotel frequently.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: lottaluv937
Reviews.Content: From the moment we were picked up at the airport in a brand new Mercedes s-class hybird, we knew we were in good hands! The hotel has the feeling of being at a private estate-- check-in is at a desk (with champagne offered) , and you are escorted by your "butler" to your room. We loved the poolside attendants standing every few feet around the pool, just waiting to assist us! The food at Fern was as good as many of the best Manhattan restaurants--we had the tasting menu with wine pairing one night and it was delicious and well served. The room was luxurious without being over-the-top---everything you need to feel pampered (great bathroom and comfy bed) and terrace. The only drawback was a noisy air conditioner which we were told the hotel is rectifying. The beach is on a private cove and is perfect for walks and the hotel has ample lounges both at the beach and poolside. Bottom line, my husband and I can't wait to go back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort but some issues”
Reviews.Author: vision20
Reviews.Content: Going to make this review easy. Bottom line, great facility and getting better with time. The low rating is to make sure the hotel does something about the Cons. It's the power of us Reviewers to not only inform other potential guests about the property, but to alert management about issues and to make a difference with our voices. Pros Attentive staff that remembers your name Butler service is good, although not readily "available" No room upgrade for SPG even though resort was less than 30% at capacity Beautifully designed and landscaped resort Oversized bathroom and tub Smooth check-in and champagne greeting Decent food at Seagrapes (Did not eat at Fern) Nice Boat house with kayaks, sailboat etc. Prompt valet parking attendants. (To be expected since the resort was nearly empty. Only saw 12 other couples there during the entire stay.) Clean, comfortable linens/bed Nice turndown service Cons $60 resort fee (this is quite ridiculous) needs to be included with the room rate, until they change this I suggest we limit the amount of high ratings we give this place $22 valet parking - again, understandable if space were a concern (i.e. NYC etc.) but not valid for a such a sparse area with ample room Extremely loud A/C with fan that blows directly over the bed Super loud leaf blowers that the gardeners used all over the resort. This is really bad. (How can you enjoy peace and quiet when these blowers are running from the early morning all through the day, on the pathways and all areas of the resort?) Excess debris on the beach. (Although this isn't "trash" per se, it does detract from the appearance of the rest of the well manicured property) The pool is cold and there really wasn't anyone in it due to this fact. Not arctic frigid, but not warm either. Although I'd imagine this wouldn't be an issue in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful facility”
Reviews.Author: ScottM211
Reviews.Content: my wife and I stayed the first week of january. the grounds are beautiful, the golf course is great, the room was wonderful and fern is a great restarant. I found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful. we rented a car and were able to have other eating options which I think is important. the pool and beach were clean and well run. a shout out to paula and juan lopez. we would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, a couple service issues, but a BEAUTIFUL place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dansac
Reviews.Content: Reading the reviews on Trip Advisor in advance, I was expecting the staff to spit on us and slap us in the face but to have a pretty decent room to sleep in. What I found was an absolutely GORGEOUS place to stay with a couple fairly minor service issues, but overall a wonderful experience. First, the good: The hotel is beautiful, the setting is beautiful, the facilities are all beautiful. The room is extremely large and elegant - and we absolutely loved the terrace with its great couch. The spa was amongst the nicest we've ever been to, with great outdoor post-treatment area (where they brought us champagne after our massages). The setting for breakfast and both places for dinner were beautiful and we loved eating outdoors in January. The pool is a terrific place to read and relax. Even better - the grounds have terrific walking paths, an area where you can go "boating" (paddleboating and small sailboats) or fishing off the pier. The butler service (which somehow some people missed) was very gracious - they made us mojitos every night, they brought us DVDs, poured us a bath, etc. The bad: Okay, there were basically two issues we had - and most of it came upon check-in. When we arrived at 4:20 P.M., we were told our room wasn't ready. We responded that a St. Regis should have the room ready almost an hour and a half AFTER check-in time. After all, you are paying for the room after check-in time. The response from the receptionist was, "I'm sorry, I know, but as I said, the room isn't ready." This wasn't really acceptable so we asked to see the manager, who came, typed in a few things and as it happens our room then suddenly became ready. The notion that a room isn't ready for customers paying this much after check-in time is pretty bad at a 5-star hotel. Moreover, when she asked us for dinner reservations - we made our selections, she agreed to them and said "wonderful" and then afterwards we noticed that some of the restaurants we chose were closed those evenings we chose them and she had no idea. Additionally, we were given a brochure that offered a promotion at the spa - but when we went to the spa it was clear that the promotion was expired and they checked with the manager before "honoring" it. Well, thanks for the favor, but next time don't hand out that brochure! Finally - we paid the resort fees which included (allegedly) treats by the pool, but we spent an entire afternoon by the pool and were offered nothing. Anyhow, these are all fairly minor quibbles in the context of a terrific 3-night stay at what was genuinely one of the nicest places we've ever stayed. Okay, so they're working out the kinks, but if you can swing it, it's well worth treating yourself. (p.s. as a side note - we stopped by for lunch at the Ritz-Carlton San Juan and have been to a couple other hotels on the island - there is no comparison. At the others you could be in Florida, but at the St Regis, you truly are in a unique destination)

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: bigsharer
Reviews.Content: Prior reviews lowered my expectations of this new resort. Thankfully, it was a fine experience - not great and worth $1100 per nite plus charges but fine. The overriding negative for us was that there were too many families and children --- and some very large families (20+) which made pool experiences and restaurant experiences somewhat challenging. The pool and poolside restaurant SeaGrapes was the best managed of the resort facilities (as well as the spa). All the staff was quite poliye and friendly everywhere! However, concierge is the weakest (rarely answered the phone, was unaware of certain services that were prepaid or complimenary, didn't seem to communicate with the reception desk staff, etc.) Fern was very good but not excellent --- the staff was friendly but need more training AND needs a more visibile floor manager. Table cloths for dinner would improve the ambience and dim those lights in the main dining room. Most important for the 7-day stays --- have one or two nightly specials- The menu got boring after 4 or 5 days. The pool is beautiful, and water is tolerable but not heated. Would recommend making one of the three pools adult only --- please!!!!! The beach is beautiful and so wonderful to walk any time of the day ---- Our neighbors one veranda over were smokers which really bothered us when we tried to relax on our porch. Recommend some buildings be made "Smoke free" including outdoor spaces. All in all- this will become Puerto Rico's finest property in short time IF the GM reads and acts on these 55 plus reviews. They covered just about everything! Speaking of the GM - we were there for 7 days and saw him frequently but he never approached us. What's up with that?

Reviews.Title: “Not quite a 5 Diamond, but VERY close!”
Reviews.Author: gusrageous
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a wonderful 5-day vacation at the St Regis. With all the mixed reviews, we almost changed to another hotel. But Iâ€™m so glad we did not. Although there are a few areas that could be improved, this property is very special. The grounds are amazing. From the moment you drive through the gated 400-acre property, you realize that this is not your average high-end resort. The property was sold out during our visit, but it seemed that the hotel was half full. With so much space to spread out, you never felt crowded by others. Staff: Overall, the staff was extremely friendly and a pleasure to deal with. The valet/bellmen were the best Iâ€™ve ever experienced. All of them take such pride in their jobs and go above and beyond to make your vacation perfect. We never had to wait for them to get our car. We never opened a door. We never had to ask for anythingâ€¦they knew what we wanted! The butler staff was also amazing. In particular, Vanessa made our stay even better. One thing to remember is that the butlers are not â€˜servantsâ€™. A lot of the complaints we have read on this site complain about the butler â€˜serviceâ€™. If you pick up the phone and dial â€˜0â€™, they are ready to help you out with everything. But they do not stand outside your door and wait for you to say â€˜Oh, Jeevesâ€¦will you fetch me a glass of scotch?â€™ The check-in process was great. Once the valet opens your car door, they escort you inside and ask if you would like some champagne. You then sit down in main room and wait for someone from the front desk to check you in. You are then driven to your room on a golf cart where your luggage has already been delivered. (Tipâ€¦ask the butler unpack for you. It was great to walk around the property and then come back to see all your clothes hung in the walk in closet or folded in the dresser) The pool staff was also very good. When you walk up to the pool, several people will great you and assist in finding a nice spot. Even with the hotel sold out, there was never an issue to find a nice quiet area around the poolâ€¦plenty of space. The only downside to the pool area was the expensive cocktails. I know this is a St. Regis, but cranberry vodka should not cost $14. The staff at the boathouse was excellent. You can tell they love their job and are happy to assist the guest. This is a hidden gem on this property. Most of the time we were the only people using the bikes/boats/fishing equipment. Be sure to take a bike and explore the property. Itâ€™s the only way to see everything. The concierge is the weak point in this hotel. It was a struggle to get much info out of them. I called them several times and no one ever answered. And many of them seemed very unfamiliar with the local area. The valet/bellmen were the best to offer advice. There was a visiting concierge from the St Regis New York there helping the staff. Robert was excellent and obviously understands what guests expect from a top-notch concierge. Hopefully with his help, the rest of them can provide better service. Activities: The golf course is simply beautiful. Although $180 is expensive, it is worth every penny. You really donâ€™t care what you shoot that day. You spend most of the time taking pictures at every bend of the fairway. Every hole is unique and perfectly landscaped. The last 3 holes are on the ocean and they make for a memorable finish. The staff at the course was excellent. The pool is first class in every way. The chairs are very comfortable and there are plenty of umbrellas for shade. The pool is NOT COLD!!! Pools are not hot tubs and are not meant to be bath water. Iâ€™ve read many people talk about how the pool was too cold to get into. Plenty of people were in the pool and enjoying it while we were there. Itâ€™s refreshing to jump into and cool off. The layout of the pool makes for a relaxing time. It winds thought the trees and landscaping. Even though there were a lot of kids, it wasnâ€™t loud at all. The actual hot tub was oddly placed. It seems like it was an afterthought in the design. The beach was beautiful. The sand is not a white as some beaches. But you have miles of private beach to walk up and down. We took a long walk and saw 1 person the entire time. The water was about the same temperature as the poolâ€¦very refreshing. There are cabanas on the beach, but at $300/day, not a single one was rented out. I think the hotel might want to revisit the charge. Iâ€™ve already mentioned the boathouse. They offer beach bikes, mountain bikes, paddleboards, kayaks, sailboats and fishing gear. Food: Overall, the food was great at the resort. I think the prices for food were very reasonable at Fern and Molasses. But the restaurant at the pool (Seagrapes) was overpriced. Fern is simply one of the best restaurants Iâ€™ve had the privilege to dine. If you are a foodie, then you will love this place. Iâ€™ve written a full review of Fernâ€¦you can see it via this LINK. http://www.10best.com/destinations/puerto-rico/san-juan/all/restaurants/fern-at-st-regis-bahia-beach/?search=fern The Tasting Menu with Wine parings is a must. And at just over $100/person, it is a decent value. Chef â€˜Mikeâ€™ is very willing to answer any questions and is happy to make changes for personal preference. We saw him come out and talk with several Jewish families that keep Kosher. He was trained in NY and is very accommodating to special request. Our server, Joel, was excellent. Rooms: The rooms are huge and extremely well done. Everything from the outside courtyard, to the solid wood entry doors to the high-end fixtures made you realize the level of detail that went into the design. There is even a Subzero mini fridge at the wet bar. The bathrooms are huge, as people have mentioned. The tub is so big it takes about 10-15 minutes to fill. But itâ€™s well worth the wait! The bed was very comfortable. Our A/C was a little loud, but we enjoyed the white noise it provided. If this is a concern, make sure you ask for one of the â€˜newerâ€™ rooms. We were told they made some changes so the vent would not be so loud. I would also ask for a room on the top floor. These will have vaulted ceilings. We really enjoyed our balcony overlooking the golf course. But you might want to bring some bug spray, especially if you plan on sitting out there at night. Our main entry door was extremely hard to open because of a water leak in the roof. This caused the door jam to expand. We had to use both hands to open and use our whole body to close. They tried several times to fix this, but it didnâ€™t help. Management should have offered to move us to another room. But we didnâ€™t let this bother us. Summary: Overall, this was a wonderful, relaxing vacation. With just a few small changes, this place will be a 5-diamond property. Right now, I would give it 4.5 diamonds. The people are so proud of their beautiful island and are so willing to share it with us. Every employee had a smile on his or her face. Even the grounds crew would stop working, turn off their equipment and say hello. Thanks, St Regis Bahia Beach, for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “A resort that rivals the best in the world”
Reviews.Author: billandpat3
Reviews.Content: This resort is extraordinary, a combination of outstanding physical beauty and exceptional and personal service. Everyone I encountered truly cared about our entire experience. I have to mention Miriam in the Sea Grape restauarant, who on noticing that I had left a tip on a service included check, sought me out to point out the "mistake". i have never had that happen to me anywhere I have stayed and incidentally, she literally lights up her restaurant with her smile. i have travelled extensively and stayed at wonderful resorts, this one is a must and i cannot wait to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Reinventing Luxury in the Caribbean”
Reviews.Author: dakstr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at the St. Regis for 6 days in the earlier part of January. To begin, the staff's efforts have created a higher bar for all lodging in Puerto Rico. The St. Regis, Puerto Rico is the new First Class. This resort is for those that have watched other top branded hotels sell-out and build large facilities only for profits. When I am at a St. Regis I know the hotel is sacrificing some profits for me to enjoy a living experience that transcends me into a world of lavish accommodations with a little make believe sprinkled on top. When I am at a St. Regis I love to say, "it's good to be the customer'. I will note to you that all I write is for good and while seem critical are meant to only improve the current landscape to continue to raise the bar. From the moment our driver drove us through the entrance gate last Sunday the experience was a pleasure. The bellmen were all very attentive to us and for the remaining of the week always knew our names as we would walk by the front door. The Check-In desk was a pleasure and more a feeling of a checking into an estate than a resort. Even though we did not wish to have champagne it was nice to have been offered. My additional suggestion here is a tropical fruit punch (with or without booze) as an option too and wet hand towel (on ice) to wipe the face and hands. The main hotel lobby is beautiful - so was the path in route to our room. The room was fantastic but the Butler idea was not sold well. We did not understand who to call and what the entire butler responsibilities really were when I checked in. I later found there were some perks but it was not made clear at room check in - he needs a card with his number and hand it to me at check in day to make it clear he is more than room service or the bellman.. Once I asked for room service to have breakfast served the next morning and I was forwarded to room service. I don't know who takes that order but I think the butler answers the phone when I pressed "0" and transfers me to room service. Coffee is free with the butler and at a cost with room service? I'm not sure of the entire thing and itâ€™s a great way to manage stand alone buildings like the resort is set up. Maybe something posted in the closet on the wall would help to explain this service? The bathroom was great...the hotel TV channel is locked in a channel that does not tell you anything about the resort - just one screen with some writing. I assume you are waiting for the tape to arrive to have it play on the hotel channel non-stop. There needs to be a channel directory card located in the bathroom too - preferably on the underside of the remote. The mirror TV was a great amenity. The balcony could use ceiling fans. The bed was fantastic. The phone and electronic controls were all the latest in technology and great stuff. I was not explained how to use the DVD player in the flat screen TV. There should also be a movie list directory - listing the DVD movies the resort has in stock. If I want to play a DVD however I read I had to request this and a list will be made available...why not leave the list in the room and update it (three ring binders - one page per DVD for easy updates). The subwoofer and center channel in the furniture below the TV did not work. The candles that were on a timer every night on the balcony were a great touch. AC seemed too loud - don't know how you can fix that but it worked well. The sound of the HVAC was a common comment on the blogs about the property too. The $5.00 delivery charge for room service on top of the 5% that is on top of the 18% for the waiters/room service.... that is a bit excessive. We headed to the pool and I felt the pool was run very well in all ways. However, it's only a matter of time someone will hurt their self without low lighting on the gravel paths to the pool - and the steps at the path to the pool from the villas. Once again the staff was trained well. They recognized that it was our first day and welcomed us and gave a short tour of the various areas and what is provided in each area - bar, restaurant, pool seating, the sun and where the sun rises and sets each day and how the chair choice would be affected during the day, the price of the cabanas (surprised there are not private showers behind each cabana - I see there is no room now for it), the lawn area below the pool, the beach and the beds on the beach...all well done. I would offer a free cabana for the guest first day (coupon given at check in) until the cabanas are being used more. The staff was good at introducing other staff when they would be temporarily gone or finishing their shift ....they also remembered our name each day. I also think the paths should have little hide-a-ways for a couple to sit alone or hammocks at various locations. The main Plantation House restaurant for breakfast was delicious. There needs to be some sticky buns on the breakfast menu in addition to the bread basket with the chocolate croissant, blueberry muffin (that was not a great muffin) and the bread with the powdered dusting of sugar. Great French toast and the pancakes were great too. Bacon was great as well. The sausage needs to be grilled and really cooked....seemed like it was thrown in the microwave and not on a grill. The fruit is ok but seemed not to be something to brag about...certain fruit was good and others were not so good. You have to figure out how to keep the fruit fresh....this is a blog comment as well. Dinner was excellent. Tablecloths could add to the night meal sessions, at the prices charged I would expect it. The cigar effort is played down too much. I only found out the arrangement too late in my stay. I saw the two humidors on the first floor of the Plantation House and the sitting area for cigar around behind the "Check-In" area. The restaurant at the golf course needs better marketing on days open.....the bonfire should be run more than just the weekend....maybe a fire pit people could set up their own beach side fire on slower nights??? Maybe torches or a big bonfire with chairs out on the lawn between the plantation house and ocean to look down from the restaurant. The beach need to be cleaned up from the trash that is washed up with the waves between the beach club and the resort...small trash...water bottles...but still trash all the same. When we went to the golf pro shop of the beach club it was clear we were off the property. The women were seemingly above the role of reaching out for help. This made the St. Regis look even better as service goes. We also went to the El Conquistador to see the facilities, service and food. Our cab driver 'Manning" took us over there and we told him we would be a couple hours and he asked to wait to bring us back. I am glad we went to that hotel because it made us love the St. Regis all the more. The two hotels could not be more different and I am being kind. We both used the spa a couple times and were very impressed with the service and facilities. I had deep tissue rubs one day by Josephine and one day by Jose. Both massages were excellent and I normally have two massages a month so I know a good massage. They were not overly chatty - they were professional - they went beyond the level of service for what was consider a routine massage and were excellent. Don't ask who was better. The locker attendant was very nice too. He got out from behind the room he has his stuff set up and came to the locker room and asked if I needed anything and mentioned the chocolates laid out for my consumption....very good - champagne etc. He should explain more about what is outside though.....cold pool-hot tub - outdoor shower - sitting area and lemon water etc. Also, the hot water takes too long to get to those showers and he should turn the showers on for guests when they come out of their massage or ask if they wish to shower prior to their massage and turn on the shower. Offering a tour of the couples massage is a good idea after the massage to better sell it for the remaining week. The stock in that spa for sale is weak....more exercise products with the spa products would be a good thing for those who workout. Having a massage at the ocean would have been a nice thing too but this was not marketed.....there needs to be a hut for that for privacy at the beach. This needs marketing. I think the gift shop needed some more gifts items for kids to take home and that includes a basic tee shirt with the St. Regis on it. However, the St. Regis logo is WAY WAY to big on everything. Its tacky when it's that large....I don't want people to think I work here but I want to wear it when I am home or around my home (out to the club or to the store). On a business note-I had a small package I needed to go to the Governor during my stay and it was way too complicated to make happen. It also was going to charge $130.00 for the resort to deliver...way too much to charge for that and no Plan B suggested. The only idea was to give the package to a limo driver. I called a messenger company from the yellow pages and did it myself. I loved the new place and the people that are making it a grand experience for all the guests. Best of luck in your first year reinventing luxury in the Caribbean.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort with Room to Relax”
Reviews.Author: Germancarlover
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from the St Regis Bahia Resort and had a wonderful, relaxing time. First of all, I was alittle concerned over some of the reviews, but I think they are improving on a daily basis and Starwood has strict brand standards that will be met. We wanted a relaxing place to enjoy our babymoon #2 and the St Regis met our expectations. We usually stay at 4-star properties, so we were in heaven, but if you only stay at 5-star properties (St Regis, Four Seasons, and Ritz) then your expectations may not be met 100%. Yes, there are a few things they need to improve, but I think some people that wrote reviews are nit-picking slightly. It's definately improved from the early reviews. Here are the strengths: - Property and grounds are amazing - over 500 acres to walk, bike, boat, golf, with lush tropical foilage that makes you feel secluded. - Rooms are huge with high-end touches - wet bar, monster bathroom with 2 showers and a tub, balcony with lounge furniture - Pool is 3 levels and plenty of space to relax. It's really not cold! - Butler service (this is a service - don't expect an individual butler 24/7, but they will bring you fresh coffee in the morning, comp mojitos, and even comp dvds so take advantage - Food was amazing - we live in Miami and have enjoyed the best Miami has and I can say Fern was so good, we ate there all 3 nights. Try the Grouper! The wine list is great too. We loved having lunch at Seagrapes - you can eat at the pool, at the bar, or at a table with amazing views of the ocean. Be sure to eat at Fern for breakfast - everything is great. - Spa was probably the nicest I've seen - beautiful and huge. Plenty of space and things to do. - They have great free events each night. We had a wine tasting on Thursday, and on weekends they have a sabering with free champagne. - Beach is HUGE and they have plenty of chairs and umbrellas - keep in mind this is Jan so it gets windy on the beach and the surf is rough. Here are the weaknesses: - Some reviewers complained the a/c was too loud - it was not too loud for us and we were in bldg 7, but you will be able to hear it run. - The pillow options should be better - down is fine for some but we like firm pillows which were hard to find (took them 45 min to replace the pillows) - Cocktails are alittle steep at $15. They should offer more choices at a lower price. A beer is $7. - Service is not up to a 5-star resort but they are getting better - we talked to many staff members about this and they are getting trained and building confidence - they are aware of the reviews. Come on, they just opened Nov 6. Overall, I would recommend this to anyone - my wife is on the phone right now gushing about this place to her friend. I want to go back next year because I know the service will be even better. One last thing about getting a car - if you stay 3 nights or less then get a car. It will be cheaper than a taxi. It only takes 30 min and the valet is $22. If you stay for 4 nights or longer, then get the taxi unless you want to go off property. We only did once, but you will want to drive back fast. There is really not alot to see outside of San Juan and the rainforest. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Sanctuary it claims to be... yet”
Reviews.Author: tropicalmaven
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from 7 days at the St. Regis Bahia Beach. While the property is beautiful, as many reviews have already said, Bahia Beach is not up to St. Regis standards. I would not recommend it - yet. It may meet the standards of the Audubon society, but it is not up to 5 star hotel standards yet. o The linens smell bad. They were clean (practically brand new!) but smelled really bad â€“ I donâ€™t know if itâ€™s the detergent theyâ€™re using?? But itâ€™s very unpleasant and unacceptable. I hope they remedy this soon. o The mattress was good, but the pillows and duvet were quite dense and heavy. o As many have mentioned already, the pool water is cold. And there is only one small jacuzzi. Our other pet peeve was the constant music and fair amount of noise: Muzak-y music is piped all along the walkways in the hotel, at every restaurant, and over the entire poolside. The constant, all-pervasive music degrades the experience, rather than adding to it. We were there for the tropical beach experience!: the sounds of nature are incredible â€“ tropical birds, ocean waves, there is no need for this pervasive music. o They could at least create sections of the restaurants and pool without music, (such as the outside balcony of the Fern) or if the music could be much softer. o The pool music is also loudly audible on the room balconies in all the buildings surrounding the pool Buildings 5-10, so if you like a quiet place to sit and read, your only option is the beach, which is sometimes a bit too windy for comfort. o Maybe they could have some quiet hours at the pool during the day, with no music? Or a section of the pool with the speakers off? o Some people may like the music, but if you donâ€™t, youâ€™re quite stuckâ€¦ Other noise: o The buildings seem well-constructed, and the room was fairly quiet, except that the bedroom has an open doorway to the entryway, so you loudly hear the neighboring doors close â€“ they are heavy doors, and impossible to close quietly! o It would have been better if theyâ€™d put an actual door on the bedroom, rather than having an open doorway to the foyer. o Other reviews already mention other noise issues, such as construction noise, leaf blowers, etc.

Reviews.Title: “St. Regis Bahia Beach- can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: alk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a much needed 3 night stay at the St. Regis last weekend. It was incredible. From the moment we checked in the service was fantastic. We were a bit nervous after reading some of the reviews, but we experienced a wonderful stay. We took a private car from the airport for $168 each way. We decided that it was worth the cost as the taxi ride was probably $100 each way and there was a huge line. Since the hotel charges for valet parking and we were only staying for 3 nights we didn't want to rent a car. The pool is beautiful and so is the beach. The hotel is on the Atlantic Ocean so do not expect crystal clear water and white powdery sand. This being said, the beach is still really, really nice. We ate at all 3 restaurants and they are very good. Every staff member we came in contact with was friendly and ready to help us. We were upgraded to a huge ocean front suite which was spectacular and luxurious. We really enjoyed our complimentary morning coffee on the balcony. I had an amazing massage at the spa from Jessica. Take advantage of the complimentary boating. We took a beautiful and relaxing kayak ride around the property one morning. It was a lot of fun. The hotel is kid friendly but I am not sure that I would bring my kids here unless it was a holiday week as it has a quiet vibe. Also not to be missed is the champagne saboring ritual on friday and saturday evenings in the lobby area. As for the comments about the mini bar or cocktails being expensive- this is true of any high end hotel. We are already dreaming of returning to this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Work in Progress - But Still a Worthy Destination”
Reviews.Author: GE1972
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the resort with my wife and three young boys (all 6 years and younger) Jan 14-18. Directions to resort were a little ambiguous especially once you get to Rio Grande, but we navigated through the town. Disappointed that a complementary upgrade was not provided as part of my SPG Platinum reservation as is customary, despite the fact the property was not crowded. Staff were all extremely friendly, kind-hearted toward us and our kids, and helpful. Concierge Kerryann and butler Maria are standouts worthy of special recognition. Grounds are beautiful, secluded, and well integrated with ecosystem. Dined at all three on-property restaurants. Service and food quality was universally so-so. The pools were fantastic. Previous commenters on "cold" pool temperature need to toughen up a little. The hot tub and beach made for nice variety. Agree with comments that it wasn't the most spectacular beach ever. However my kids were happy to play in the sand and splash in the waves. Make sure you take advantage of all the amenities going into your resort fee - namely the beautiful walking paths, catch and release fishing, paddle boats/kayaks, and nature sanctuaries. Also, Iguana Club for kids runs a variety of activies for little ones 5 yrs and up. Short drive to El Yunque which was worth the trip, about a 30 minute drive to Fajardo to catch ferries to Vieques/Culebra. Housekeeping service was erratic in terms of timing and service delivered. Rooms were very nicely appointed and the bath/shower is very indulgent.

Reviews.Title: “Great property--almost there!”
Reviews.Author: Brooklynflyer
